I've come to see the game itself isn't as bad as the other reviews make it out to be yes I'll admit the game does have it bugs (only crashed on me 4 times and had to restart a mission due to glitched doors and a glitched objectives, and yes most of the problems happened on the good path) But what we got did have the potential to be a good postal game had RWS had a bigger staff plus Corey Cruise did a good job of being the postal dude so if your a postal fan I would play it but do with cheats or you'll go insane.

column8:
To be honest with you, I did pay 5 bucks for this game because I was curious to see how it is after I have finished played all the Postal games which were available at the time ('97, 2, Redux, 4 and Brain Damage). On my first playthrough I didn't encounter many bugs (just bad coded SFX, lazy animated cutscenes, overly exagerated jokes - which all of these are the reasons why Postal 3 is awful). 

Why is it so bad? So these are what I have encountered on my 2nd and last playthrough.
Mission design. Postal 3 is standing out as a scripted story, following forced events and tasks instead of letting you explore the town of Catharsis, unlike in Postal 2 and 4 where you could free roam and explore the city/locations at your own will.

Path choices. I understand Postal 2 & 4 had pacifist options but that's different. I'm talking about Postal 3, which in it's title is about Postal dude going... POSTAL, you can choose to be a member of the law with minimal chaos. Nothing wrong with that but it feels so weird in a Postal game, also bare in mind that even the game, lets you know after finishing Bad Ending, that you should've gone for Good Path in order to achieve the best ending.

Escort Missions. Why do they exist? The VIP dies easily. Pro Tip: Just ditch the segway and follow the vip on foot.

Rhino lazer monkey missions. They're broken. Pray to God that they work in your RNG.

Health regen. Takes almost a whole minute to reach full HP. 

Weapons. The M4 is the most satisfying gun in this game. Tbh, I love the M4 more than any other weapons. The rest are barely accurate aiming or do any decent damage. Melee doesn't work. You can barely get your punches to register any damage.

The only good things I can say about this game is that Corey Cruise does an amazing job as being the voice of the Postal Dude and being part of the Postal family.

column8:
El juego Postal 3 es para mucho o para el YT de criticas de v√≠deo juegos autodenominado "gamer" es "otro juego de Postal o muy distinto de Postal" y claro que lo es, eso no lo niego, pero es un buen Postal como Juego y no como historia de la franquicia al continuarla. Al momento de iniciar el juego corre como la MIERDA, corres como est√∫pido y los movimientos son toscos e inc√≥modos. Si van a jugar este juego o le quieren dar otra oportunidad descarguen la FIXED o parche que ha hecho la comunidad (disponible en el √°rea de discusiones). El juego es otra cosa y te permite disfrutarlo mejor a un 100/10. 

Encuentro est√∫pido que la misma desarrolladora no pueda arreglar su franquicia y lo dejo muri√©ndose argumentando de  que "no lo hicieron ellos" (teniendo el logo de esta en el juego). A los que somos m√°s viejos y vimos las rese√±as de este juego, antes sal√≠an con "mayoritariamente negativo" y claro, si dejas un juego fracasar por nada y no haces nada para arreglarlo, obvio que no va a rendir, jueguen en Postal 2 original cuando salio y ver√°n que son la misma porquer√≠a e incluso hoy el 2 se sigue trabando si pisas mal un ca da ver o si saltas mucho. La historia de este es m√°s ingeniosa siento yo y algo m√°s pasiva. No vas a cagarte de la risa (porque nadie lo hace, solo es por el morbo del juego) con este o con los otros Postal. Piensa que ese es como postal brain damaged y no lo mires como una experiencia rara. (Adem√°s que quieres si es un juego del a√±o 2011).

Les dejo un link donde si quieren pueden leer como se quiso realizar el juego y de la palabra de los mismo autores como se penso (ojo, vas a tener que comprarlo y esta en ingles): https://play.google.com/store/books/details/Postal?id=INzaDwAAQBAJ&hl=es_VE&pli=1
column9:
Postal 3 is, for many, or for the self-proclaimed "gamer" video game critic on YouTube, "another Postal game, or very different from Postal." And of course it is, I won't deny that, but it's a good Postal game as a game, not as a continuation of the franchise's story. When you start the game, it runs like SHIT, you run like an idiot, and the movements are clumsy and awkward. If you're going to play this game or want to give it another chance, download the FIXED or patch created by the community (available in the discussion area). The game is something else, and it allows you to enjoy it 100% better.

I find it stupid that the same developer can't fix their franchise, and I'll leave them dying arguing that "they didn't do it" (with their logo in the game). For those of us who are older and saw the reviews for this game, they used to say "mostly negative." And of course, if you let a game fail for no reason and don't do anything to fix it, it's obviously not going to work. Play the original Postal 2 when it came out and you'll see that it's the same crap, and even today, Postal 2 still crashes if you step wrong or jump too much. The story in this one is more inventive, I feel, and somewhat more passive. You won't laugh your head off (because no one does, it's just the morbidity of the game) with this or the other Postal games. Think of it as a bit like "Postal Brain Damage," and don't think of it as a weird experience. (Besides, what do you want if it's a game from 2011?)

I'll leave you a link where you can read how the game was created and, from the authors' own words, how it was conceived (be careful, you'll have to buy it and it's in English): https://play.google.com/store/books/details/Postal?id=INzaDwAAQBAJ&hl=es_VE&pli=1

This game is among the worst games of all time, and it definitely doesn't deserve it. The hatred is likely due to the terrible optimization, word of mouth from people who haven't played it, and the overall lack of humor.
It's clear that the people working on this game wanted to make a truly fun product, but due to the crisis and confrontation with RWS, the game was released completely unfinished. This is evident in the out-of-nowhere characters like "Uncle Dave," and in general, if you watch the videos of the first reveals, the vacuum cleaner had far more features, the game had many more animations, etc.
Honestly, this game is like a portal to 2011, where Maddison was reviewing it. There's something about this game that I think is a teenage spirit, as it's just as stupid, ridiculous, and haphazardly made, where they tried their best at the beginning, but by the end, deadlines came and they finished it as best they could. I'll give the game a 4, and yes, I got the platinum in it.
P.S. The Dude's design is the best of all the games, and Part 4 is still worse than Part 3, even though they worked on it and had carte blanche in terms of deadlines.
And for 40 rubles, I think it's worth buying, since patches were recently released for it after 13 years.

[b]A very mixed bag of a game[/b]

I'll start with the downsides:
- Sound lag, which was very annoying for the first few hours
- The shooting is an acquired taste, but I definitely didn't like it
- If you press Win, just say "gone"
- Once, after a cutscene, the game froze completely, as did the PC in general, which was unpleasant
- Minor bugs with NPCs

The positives:
- Once you've got it down, it's a good time. You can have fun with it
- You can also enjoy it; I was thoroughly hooked for the last couple of hours

Overall, although there were some unpleasant moments, the emotions were mostly positive.

column8:
Live a week in the life of "The POSTAL Dude"; a hapless everyman just trying to check off some chores. Buying milk, returning an overdue library book, getting Gary Coleman's autograph, what could possibly go wrong?

Blast, chop and piss your way through a freakshow of American caricatures in this darkly humorous first-person adventure. Meet Krotchy: the toy mascot gone bad, visit your Uncle Dave at his besieged religious cult compound and battle sewer-dwelling Taliban when you least expect them! Endure the sphincter-clenching challenge of cannibal rednecks, corrupt cops and berserker elephants. Accompanied by Champ, the Dude's semi-loyal pitbull, battle your way through open environments populated with amazingly unpredictable AI. Utilize an arsenal of weapons ranging from a humble shovel to a uniquely hilarious rocket launcher.
Collect a pack of attack dogs! Use cats as silencers! Piss and pour gasoline on anything and everyone! YOU KNOW YOU WANT TO!
Key Features
Aggressive vs. Passive: POSTAL 2 is only as violent as you are.
One large non-linear world.
Explore the world and accomplish your errands at your own pace.
Interact with Non-Player Characters
Survival Mode: If you choose to play as a pacifist, you will still have to deal with the NPC's who may also go POSTAL!
Based on the Unreal Editor: Easy to use and very powerful, with many mods already available from the community.

column8:
POSTAL 3 is definitely the black sheep of the series. After my playthrough I can say that the game is a mixed bag full of cool but poorly executed ideas. Compared to POSTAL 2, the game is now third person shooter and uses a regenerative health and cover system, this game goes for a more linear approach to its game play, with some open world type missions sprinkled here and there (You don't get to have full on free roaming until you have done a playthrough). I don't mind the more linear approach but found the levels on offer to be kinda boring and filled with dumb enemy AI to fight.

The game has a morality system, which in theory seems like a cool idea as it allows the player to go down either two paths (Good or Bad) which offer different takes on the story and different levels to play. The only problem is if your playing on the good path for example, and you say accidentally kill a civilian in cross fire your morality meter will go down, the issue is even though the game says you can refill your morality by performing good acts, like doing non lethal take-downs on enemies, It just doesn't refill I found for some reason (I don't know what I was doing wrong?) causing you needing to reload a save if your meter gets too bad if your going for the Good ending.

The morality system also kinda ruins what makes POSTAL so good to begin with, as it restricts a player from fully playing around with the games mechanics and arsenal as if your going for a good ending, your going to need to play more carefully and stop yourself from doing anything that might cause you to lose morality, which for me takes away a lot of the freedom that POSTAL 2 gave you with its gameplay.

The story and humour of this game is on point with the series, It is everything that you come to expect from a POSTAL game and is not for those who can't take a joke and get offended easily. Corey Cruise does an amazing job filling in for the voice of the POSTAL Dude and has a great take on the character and is in my opinion on par with Rick Hunter's performance as the Dude.  

Since this game has been getting new updates and fixes recently, I have only experienced a few crashes here and there, and for some reason a lot of the main game achievements didn't unlock for me.

It took me 4 hours to get through on the Good path and there is replayability to go through the game on the Bad path which offers different missions, story and ending. There is also a free roam mode that unlocks when you finish the game, which allows you to explore the town of Catharsis and lets you loose and experiment with the games mechanics without the restriction of the morality system.    

Conclusion:
Despite my issues with the game, I found it to be an enjoyable mess with some cool ideas that were just not cooked fully. Personally I don't think the game is as bad as everyone says it is (though I did get it for cheap). I recommend to get it on sale for those who enjoy the POSTAL series and don't mind putting up with some jank and some questionable design choices.

Fue un regalo de parte de un amigo cercano, lo puse en mi wishlist para comprarlo cuando estuviera en oferta y tratar de no dejarme llevar por los malos comentarios que muy seguidamente veo de este juego, y es que si, soy muy fan√°tico de la saga Postal, jugu√© un poco el 1 y el 2 me pareci√≥ la c√∫spide de la franquicia, y me dije a m√≠ mismo "si Postal 2 hizo excelente todo su apartado, Postal 3 debe ser igual de bueno cu√°nto menos".

Y es que no entiendo c√≥mo un juego desarrollado con Source engine puede ir tan mal, el Gameplay es torpe, los movimientos de postal guy son errados, rob√≥ticos y culeros, las armas est√°n muy mal trabajadas y son inc√≥modas de usar, y ni hablemos de los pu√±etazos, que parece que de 20 golpes que lances contra un peat√≥n, a lo mucho 1 o 2 le van a llegar, como si su hitbox fuera un peque√±o rect√°ngulo dentro del modelo 3d, el da√±o de las armas lo mismo, los npc parecen esponjas de balas, tienes que disparar casi todo tu cargador de pistola para matarlos...

Yo quiero mucho a Postal, pero este definitivamente no da la talla, y es entendible considerando que Running With Scissors no estuvo al 100% involucrado en su desarrollo.

Le doy su respectivo 4/10, es que no sirve ni para sacar risas con su humor jodido de preescolar
column9:
It was a gift from a close friend. I put it on my wishlist to buy it when it was on sale and try not to get carried away by the negative reviews I often see about this game. Yes, I'm a huge fan of the Postal saga. I played a bit of the first game, and the second game seemed like the pinnacle of the franchise. I said to myself, "If Postal 2 was excellent in every aspect, Postal 3 must be at least as good."

And I just don't understand how a game developed with the Source Engine can be so bad. The gameplay is clumsy, Postal Guy's movements are awkward, robotic, and crap, the weapons are poorly crafted and awkward to use, and let's not even talk about the punches. It seems like out of 20 hits you throw at a pedestrian, at most 1 or 2 will hit them, as if their hitbox were a small rectangle within the 3D model. The weapon damage is the same. The NPCs look like bullet sponges, you have to shoot almost your entire pistol clip to kill them...

I love Postal, but this one definitely doesn't measure up, and it's understandable considering Running With Scissors wasn't 100% involved in its development.

I give it its respective 4/10; it's not even good enough to get laughs with its messed-up preschool humor.

column9: Sucks!

It's not the best evolution of the series, but I did like some things. The game is built on the Source engine, so at least the shooting, ragdolls, and everything related to physics are enjoyable. Unfortunately, the open world was removed, and the story is now simply told through short, individual missions. Without an open world, all the inhabitants simply wander back and forth during these missions, and it no longer feels like a living world, or like you're in it and influencing anything. Violence has become senseless and unpunished, the inhabitants barely pay attention to the main character, there's no difficulty setting, and the police either don't respond to anything or can't do anything. The humor has been simplified or almost completely disappeared, and everything that happens during missions is an absurd mess. Also, due to the wild gunfights, the game slows down sadly, with frame rates dropping. However, I did like the beautiful locations, cool weapons, and music. I really liked the main character's appearance and his cool leather coat. It was also nice to see everything happening from a third-person perspective - all the animations and movements look good.

I've literally played around 15 minutes of this game and it REALLY is that bad. Even though this game cost me less than a single pound, I still feel as if I wasted my money. The constant screen shake damn near gave me motion sickness, many scenes are missing sound, certain weapons just outright don't work, the cut-scenes literally take up almost the entirety of the introduction and the list goes on. column8:
Malheureusement ce Postal 3 aurait pu √™tre bien, mais est juste rempli de d√©fauts, m√™me avec des mods (qui ne fonctionnent m√™me pas d'ailleurs) le jeu reste.. franchement pas fou, c'est mou, pas d'open world, le syst√®me de sant√© est plat au possible, les combats au cac sont une diarrh√©e ambulante, la cam√©ra n'en parlons mm pas.. bref y'a bcp d'autres probl√®mes, mais y'a quand m√™me un peu de positif, le Postal Dude est plus beau que jamais, l'ost est vrm pas mauvaise (m√™me excellente) des armes plut√¥t vari√©es.. et c'est tout.

Honn√™tement je savais que P3 √©tait mauvais, mais vraiment pas √† ce point, mais, je le vois plus comme une prise de risque, une tr√®s grosse m√™me, car si on regarde tout les jeux Postal, ils sont tous diff√©rent (except√© redux qu'est un remaster du premier jeu) donc je ne peux que saluer le courage des devs d'avoir sorti un jeu aussi mal foutu, mauvais, et un poil cringe.
column9:
Unfortunately, this Postal 3 could have been good, but it's just full of flaws. Even with mods (which don't even work, by the way), the game remains... frankly not great, it's slow, there's no open world, the health system is as flat as can be, the melee combat is a walking diarrhea, and the camera, let's not even talk about it... In short, there are many other problems, but there are still some positives: the Postal Dude is more beautiful than ever, the soundtrack is really not bad (even excellent), the weapons are quite varied... and that's it.

Honestly I knew that P3 was bad, but really not to that extent, but, I see it more as a risk taken, a very big one even, because if we look at all the Postal games, they are all different (except redux which is a remaster of the first game) so I can only salute the courage of the devs to have released such a badly made, bad, and a bit cringe game.

YES, THE REVIEW IS POSITIVE. THROW STONES AT ME.
Basically, the idea is that the public's opinion of this game is largely compromised by dishonest reviewers from 2014. The game is great in its own way, like Trash with a capital T. It has some dumb trash humor. Courage Bombay does a good job of playing the dude. The BTV gameplay isn't much different from the 2nd game, except it's more corridor-based. But isn't it awesome? I think everyone was annoyed by the loading screens in 2. BUT, the game has its downsides. There are problems: you'll get lost many times and not understand what's expected of you. Feel free to use walkthroughs; they'll only save your experience. Ultimately, Akella makes some good trash that'll go down well with a beer.

column8:
[h3]PROS[/h3]

Humor. While nowhere near as funny as Postal 2, the game did make me smile a few times. It has a 2000‚Äôs decade sense of humor, and was made for people who enjoy video games. Not for the Twitch ‚Äúgamer gurls‚Äù and 300 pound pink haired land whales on Twitter that now LARP as gamers. I also enjoy the dated references, such as having a Sarah Palin and Cesar Millian the Dog Whisperer knock offs in the game.

[h3]CONS[/h3]

Feels like if MDickie made a shooter, hit boxes are way off, the game lags at times, and some missions are unbeatable.

[h3]OVERALL THOUGHTS[/h3]

So I finally played the infamous Postal III, and yes it is really that bad, and no I do not recommend it. That being said, I did enjoy messing around with it, and feel like it was worth the 99 cent sale price I paid for it. As I understand, Postal III was outsourced to a Russian company that was going under and firing developers as it was being made, so because of that it feels more like an unfinished beta version than an actual game. If you are familiar with MDickie games, it feels a lot like if MDickie were to make a shooter. It‚Äôs just sad because Postal 2 is one of the funniest and most comfiest video games I‚Äôve ever played, and Postal III is just a mess. If you‚Äôre a diehard Postal 2 fan then 99 cents is a fair price, just understand that this is a broken game, and you‚Äôll probably want to install a few mods. I‚Äôll list some mods down below.

[h3]QUALITY OF LIFE FIXES & MODS[/h3]

[b]CONTROLLER:[/b] Go into the config file and change ‚Äújoystick=0‚Äù to ‚Äújoystick=1‚Äù this will make your controller instantly work, with the exception of selecting weapons, that part is a bit touch and go, and you‚Äôll probably still need to use your mouse wheel for that.

[b]VCAM:[/b] Improved third person camera, and gives the option for first person camera.

[b]NO SPLASH SCREENS:[/b] Eliminates a couple of the 40 splash screens at the start of the game.

[b]OMEGA PUNCH:[/b] Gives you a one hit kill, with how bad the hit boxes are, it makes the game a bit more fair.

[b]CLASSIC DUDE:[/b] The Dude is dressed in his Postal 2 attire.

[b]SIMPLE DOT CROSS:[/b] A less obnoxious looking crosshair.

[b]100% SAVE:[/b] Basically gives you a level select option, you‚Äôre going to want this.

column8: it exists

let's see, a game that was supposed to be a triquel in postal series, but failed so miserably even rws hates it a lot. overall a game wasn't that bad, it just wasn't really postal-like, should've been called "postal: stories" or something because of how liniear it is and that it gives you a "choice" that feels fake since all you do is complete missions. i personally tried completing a good path, didn't fall of it, still didn't get an achievement. but overall i had some fun. the overall gameplay is not bad, but melee attacks suck and you only get a proper weapon on 3rd mission - a taser. postal 3 also features a broken karma system that actually won't work. i don't know what else to say, so let's get to pros and cons.
Pros:
-A 3rd postal no matter how you look at it
-Good music
-Pretty cool dude's voice
-Some satisfying gun physics, which most likely come from half life 2, since it's based on source engine too
-Some janky humor that made me chuckle a couple of times
-Pretty cool main menu
-Moderate difficulty
-Powered by Source
Cons:
-The goddamn bystander ai is horrible, they will always try to into the crossfire and take away your sweet good karma
-Too linear
-Missions about killing like 30 people are too boring
-Melee combat is so weak and inacurate that it's pointless
-No extras to do besides achievements
-So no replayability value
-No new weapons besides the catnip spray and pepper spray, and machine gun, but it's inacurate and weak too
-Dude talks too much
That's about it i think

-Good music
-Pretty cool dude's voice
-Some satisfying gun physics, which most likely come from half life 2, since it's based on source engine too
-Some janky humor that made me chuckle a couple of times
-Pretty cool main menu
-Moderate difficulty
-Powered by Source
Cons:
-The goddamn bystander ai is horrible, they will always try to into the crossfire and take away your sweet good karma
-Too linear
-Missions about killing like 30 people are too boring
-Melee combat is so weak and inacurate that it's pointless
-No extras to do besides achievements
-So no replayability value
-No new weapons besides the catnip spray and pepper spray, and machine gun, but it's inacurate and weak too
-Dude talks too much
That's about it i think

column8: its really not even fun
column9: its really not even fun

This game is somewhere between crap and just a game. I don't understand why everyone else is having such a bad time, but for me, everything was fine for the past 17 hours. At most, some minor bugs (not game-breaking) and voiceover issues, and even those are solvable. I bought it purely because of the discount and because I'm a fan of Postal 2. The story honestly didn't work for me. But the most annoying thing for me here are the achievements. It's complete bullshit. How could they code that a terrorist is a rhinoceros, a grandpa or grandma is someone in a fight on the 2nd patrol, and how can you finish the game using only a pistol or melee weapon?
P.S.
If you, like me, want to quickly get all the achievements in this game, then 1. Search YouTube for "How to easily get hard achievements in Postal 3" and watch the video; 2. Download either ArtMoney or CheatEngine, they are needed to get achievements based on quantity (if you want to get them quickly, of course, I think it‚Äôs not hard to figure out how to use these applications to get achievements), 3. See the achievement guides.

column8: POSTAL III. NO lo juegues. Me lo agradecer√°s mas tarde. Abrazo. 2/10
column9: POSTCARD III. Don't play it. You'll thank me later. Hugs. 2/10

A terrible and disgusting game in every sense, it feels like an indie hack-and-slash game made in Unity in 5 minutes. The thought of dropping the game immediately comes during the tutorial, due to its clunkiness (also due to the insane background music) and the endless video cutscenes every 10 seconds, although this continues throughout the entire game. One minute of running around a location - a cutscene, another two minutes - another cutscene, and that's it.
The levels are short and repetitive, a mess of endlessly spawning characters around the hero.
The game is MUCH worse than the second game.
- horribly laggy, everything constantly jerks: running - jerks, shooting - jerks, approaching any object - jerks.
- some weird artifacts in the voice acting, causing deafening interference
- game crashes.
A worthless, delusional plot, filled with flat jokes. The caustic satire was a real eyesore.
10 out of 10 dreary bores with terrible technical execution

column8: este juego es una mierd@, literalmente el juego es tan injugable que no puedes ni siquiera jugarlo muy comodo ya que esta replieto de bugs y mas encima la jugabilidad en tercera persona es un asco. literal, parece como si le activaran el comando de la tercera persona, y lo peor es que fue hecho con el motor source,por lo que me pregunto, por que no mejor lo hubieran puesto en primera persona? pues este juego no se puede jugar de esa manera, ni siquiera haciendoles ciertos ajustes. mas encima la punteria no sirve para nada por lo ya mencionado, si quieren una mejor experiencia de juego yo les recomiendo jugar postal 2 y su dlc paradise lost e incluso hasta el postal 4 y brain damage.
column9: This game is crap, literally the game is so unplayable that you can't even play it very comfortably since it is full of bugs and on top of that the third person gameplay is crap. Literally, it seems as if they activated the third person command, and the worst thing is that it was made with the source engine, so I wonder, why not have they put it in first person? Well, this game can't be played that way, not even with certain adjustments. On top of that, the aim is useless for the reason already mentioned, if you want a better gaming experience I recommend playing postal 2 and its dlc paradise lost and even postal 4 and brain damage.

column9:
Wow! This game IS as bad as they say it is.

I haven't even beaten the first mission (because it's incredibly difficult because of how the game "works"), and I can already see why everyone hates this game so much.

- Vacuum cleaner shots don't go where you aim.
- Hitting enemies feels like punching air.
- You can get stuck in every possible spot.

If I played longer, I'd probably find more bugs (and I'll probably try to beat this crap someday, but I don't know yet).

The game also has one positive: the soundtrack, which is actually pretty good in my opinion.

column8:
So far, I've played about 4 stages of Postal 3
Buggy and slow gameplay, crappy actions, delayed and very stupid attack reaction, ugly NPCs, except for Postal Dude!
Crude graphics for the time, goodbye to the freedom of Postal 2 in Postal 3!
Postal Dude, the reincarnation of evil being good... is the height of unacceptable!
I intend to finish it but I want to understand what the real Postal 3 is!!?
Much inferior to Postal 1 and 2.
But that doesn't stop you from playing it to have fun
To those who like and want Postal 3 or not!

column8: so finally got a chance cause this holidays discount to try postal III always love the series and i was always curious about it and with this current price i say wth lets try cause i heard it was really bad and honestly it was pretty decent i got some fun of it something i really like how the health system works give you a more easy time if you wanna go pacifist the postal voice is allright i liked the 3rd person and it have a pretty nice campaign mode took me near 6 hours much more i would expect from a postal game lol honestly i am happy i try it and beat it was a christmas miracle.

If you forget about a couple of bugs, crashes, and the closed, linear world. And leave aside the life-size puppet of questionable sexuality, the equally questionable mission to the Rodeo, as well as helping a porn star, chasing very strange men on Segways, and rescuing Champ... My mind can't comprehend how stoned you have to be to make a game like this, but I imagine you'd have to be just as stoned to even design something like this. So the reason for the bugs is more than clear. The game is a priori not worth more than 40 rubles.
47 wanked handkerchiefs out of 13

column8:
[h1] INGIOCABILE E NOIOSO [/h1]

In terza persona rispetto al precedente capitolo, questo nuovo stile non si adatta per nulla bene al gioco. Macchinoso, pieno di bug, crash vari, fastidioso acusticamente poich√© verrete bombardati in continuazione dalla musica durante il gioco. Non ha nulla di positivo, assolutamente nulla. Dura pochissimo (non l'ho nemmeno completato poich√© mi ha annoiato dopo pochissimo per via della sua macchinosit√† e lentezza), e per quel poco che dura non vale quello che costa.

Lo avete trovato in saldo a 1 euro come me? Bene, non vale nemmeno quell'euro, fidatevi, 
[u] non c'√® nessun buon motivo per regalare quell'euro a questo scempio. [/u]

Voto: 0/10
column9:
[h1] UNPLAYABLE AND BORING [/h1]

This new third-person style, unlike the previous game, doesn't really fit the game at all. It's cumbersome, full of bugs, crashes, and the sound is annoying because you're constantly bombarded with music throughout the game. There's nothing positive about it, absolutely nothing. It lasts very little (I didn't even finish it because it bored me after a short while due to its slowness and complexity), and for the short time it lasts, it's not worth the price.

Did you find it on sale for 1 euro like I did? Well, it's not even worth that euro, trust me.
[u] There's no good reason to give that euro to this piece of shit. [/u]

Rating: 0/10

column8:
Here's like all of the good stuff about this game: The gore was pretty fucking good, the music were bangers, the weapons were fucking great, the drm got removed while fixing more stuff, slave boy, at the ending where your fucking insane and theres visible balls and boobs on the projector thingy, and its a source game so that's pretty cool, I guess.

And here's all of the shitty stuff: The source engine, the source engine has some limitations, and also making the game not a free roam around an entire town while doing important shit game like postal 2, the fucking bugs are fucking horrible, and the missions having a like escort with the shitty ai, as well as having missions where you have to choose which side to be, like if you wanna be a good guy or not, and having the shitty teammates ai run into your fucking bullets, making you have to fight both sides, this was also really fucking annoying in the prison map with al.

Now for the thing everyone has been waiting for, my ultimate rating of this video game: Yeah its not so shit, but also not being so good which gives it a 6.5/10 for me.

column8:
[h1]Questo gioco √® la sofferenza definitiva[/h1], se volete regalare (ad 1‚Ç¨) una sana sofferenza basata su un utilizzo veramente sbagliato di un engine (Source) questo sar√† il regalo perfetto. Postal 2 √® stupendo, ma Postal 3 ha un problema immenso, fu sviluppato dalla "Trashmaster" e rasentava la tortura coreana. Gameplay ripetitivo, gunplay noioso come pochi, musica sempre attiva e assordante, storia totalmente inutile messa l√¨ tanto per creare il pretesto per dire al giocatore "Adesso spara a queste persone invece che a quelle". E engine usato talmente male, che ad un certo punto mi √® crashato il gioco dicendo che aveva finito la memoria utilizzabile.
Se volete farvi un regalo comprate Postal 2.
Altrimenti, nel caso voleste fare un regalo sgradito ad una persona che odiate, questo gioco √® semplicemente perfetto.
column9:
This game is the ultimate suffering. If you want to give the gift (for ‚Ç¨1) of healthy suffering based on a truly flawed use of an engine (Source), this will be the perfect gift. Postal 2 is wonderful, but Postal 3 has a huge problem: it was developed by "Trashmaster" and bordered on Korean torture. Repetitive gameplay, boring gunplay, constantly playing and loud music, a completely pointless story thrown in just to create an excuse to tell the player, "Now shoot these people instead of those." And the engine was so poorly used that at one point the game crashed, saying it had run out of usable memory.
If you want to treat yourself, buy Postal 2.
Otherwise, if you want to give an unwanted gift to someone you hate, this game is simply perfect.

Le doy un 4/10 siendo generosa
En realidad solo se lo recomendar√≠a a los fans de postal aunque creo que solo lo jugar√°n porque lo volvieron a poner en steam despu√©s de mucho tiempo fuera del mercado XD.

Es tal cual como dicen, super duper repetitivo y muy bugeado (tenes que hacer las misiones tal cual son, si queres explorar o experimentar entonces vas a quedar bugeado) hasta las animaciones son basura.

Hay algo nuevo que pusieron y es que depende de como te comportes en las misiones (haciendolo como buena o mala persona) entonces te pueden dan la oportunidad de ser polic√≠a (en donde tambi√©n ten√©s misiones y si lo haces mal entonces te despiden del trabajo volviendo como un civil).

Lo bueno es que es un juego barato, as√≠ que por eso solo se lo recomendar√≠a a gente que quiere jugar toda la saga, JAMAS se lo recomendar√≠a a alguien nuevo XD.
Me gustar√≠a igual que mejor le hagan un remake, se que con este juego los devs tuvieron muchos problemas y por eso es tan malo, pero se que no lo har√°n ya que este juego es el verdadero meme de la saga.
column9:
I'm giving it a 4/10, being generous.
Actually, I would only recommend it to Postcard fans, although I think they'll only play it because they put it back on Steam after a long time off the market XD.

It's just like they say, super duper repetitive and very buggy (you have to do the missions exactly as they are; if you want to explore or experiment, then you'll be bugged). Even the animations are garbage.

There's something new they added, and depending on how you behave in the missions (doing it as a good or bad person), they can give you the opportunity to be a police officer (where you also have missions, and if you do poorly, then you get fired from your job and return as a civilian).

The good thing is that it's a cheap game, so that's why I would only recommend it to people who want to play the entire series. I would NEVER recommend it to someone new XD.
I would also like them to do a remake. I know the developers had a lot of problems with this game and that's why it's so bad, but I know they won't do it since this game is the true meme of the series.

column9:
The best way, and the only way I would recommend for playing this game, is to imagine that a single person in a basement created it while bored and accidentally created a relatively decent game by those standards. But if you're a fan of Postcard, you'll experience firsthand what it's like to go crazy when you try this piece of crap.
I recommend it, especially to my enemies.
Suck it, Sebastian.
Edit: It's a shame that the tremendous songs in this game were wasted. Urine Ditch is simply a joke. I hope someday they can repurpose them, but in a good game.
Whoever platinum-platforms this shit is a god.

An unplayable piece of crap from Trashmasters, with terrible technical execution. I was very "pleased" with the Russian voice acting, which hopes to be similar to that of Postal II. RWS has the same attitude toward this piece of crap as Sergei Mavrodi has toward traditional Vietnamese cuisine.

I've only been able to endure 4 hours so far.
It felt like the game was made by a one-armed, blind, drug-addicted person with a tremor.
I wanted to hang myself every second I spent playing.
Overall, I liked it.
I've seen worse things
20.5 gigabytes of crap for 40 rubles? It doesn't sound like much, of course. But when you realize that this crap can be parsed into assets for SFM, it's a real bargain.

I first played Postal 3 in 2011, practically at its release. Back then, the police captain was stuck on the floor, unable to reach the required point. The project was unbeatable. It was a crude game, I thought; they'd fix it someday.

2023. The game freezes at the police station. There's a solution: disable the Russian language in the settings. Wow, the game doesn't freeze anymore! And... the captain can't get to the right place again.

What a shame...

P.S. The gameplay is incredibly monotonous, but sometimes you can laugh at the stupid dark jokes. And blowing heads is fun. I would have completed it if it weren't for the technical issues.

[h1]God, I'm so sick of writing this. A 5-year-old kid is screaming behind me with his shkibidi toilets, and I've already melted my brains over THIS[/h1]
[h2]But for you, I gathered my strength, so here's a read describing my pain[/h2]
[h3]which is definitely of no use to anyone, because normal people don't play this kind of game[/h3]

Keep in mind that THIS is only playable by true fans, because only we can tolerate such abuse.

Initially, I thought all this hate [i]for that part of the post that must not be named[/i]was just jokes caused by game problems that have already been "fixed"... How wrong I was.

[h2]+[/h2]
Cool hand-drawn cutscene at the beginning, and all the illustrations in general
MEGA-COOL-AWESOME MAIN MENU, THIS DUDE IS SO GOOD, YEAHHHH
Cool soundtrack

[h2]-[/h2]
The soundtrack gets boring after 0.209038k42 milliseconds
Boring, dumb, repetitive tasks
Extremely uncomfortable and awkward. Players who completed P2 don't have time to get used to the new engine, new controls, new shortcuts, new mechanics. Because when you first start a mission, YOU'RE IMMEDIATELY ATTACKED BY DOZENS OF ENDLESSLY SPAWNING ENEMIES WHO KILL YOU IN ONE HIT, AND YOU KILL ONE GUY WITH HALF A MACHINE GUN AMMO.

Because of the previous problem, you either play through equally difficult missions 30 times, or all in a minute, and you don't understand a thing.

As for Russian localization, the idea of ‚Äã‚Äãdoing not a dub, but simply adding voiceover ON TOP of the original soundtrack was super-mega-STUPID, because in the cutscenes, Cory Cruz, the extras, and the Bombay swagger merge into something incomprehensible, where you simply can't distinguish half the words.

And of course, there's subjectivity, like "this isn't a true post, it's complete and utter trash" and the dude's stupid P3 design.

[h2]so, the verdict[/h2]

Play strictly at your own discretion. The main thing is to know what you're getting into and not [i]regret[/i] the 40 rubles you spent on this obscure product (for those who bought it at the full price, I suggest creating a separate "rich masochist" achievement).

Although, what [i]regret[/i] can you talk about sleeping in the fanbase?
After all, we
[b][i]regret nothing[/i][/b]

column9: This game sucks.

This game isn't the best in the series, but it still has its charm!

I've been playing this game since its release! I thoroughly enjoyed the second game, and I was happy to learn there was a sequel, and after playing it, it left a good impression! But back then, I didn't know the game had received some pretty bad reviews, and I didn't realize it wasn't as good as my childish mind thought at the time. But first things first:

Plot: Following the plot of the second game, we find ourselves in another town where the Dude is trying to find some money, but always ends up with nothing. But one moment could completely change his life, where he's given a choice: which side to side with!

Gameplay: It's the same, only now the camera is third-person! The variety of weapons has increased. New weapons have appeared, of which the only one I can highlight is the badger (Actually, I wouldn't say there's that much variety; I just forgot a bit)! The game now features a choice that will decide the Dude's fate and the rest of the game. Nothing else new...

Music: I'm dumb, so I'll skip it!

Result: The game had great potential, but the developers screwed it up! The voice acting has changed, and now, for the most part, it's just the same voice (I think...), and the Russian voiceover is mixed with the English, so it's not always clear what he's saying! The game has terrible optimization, and a normal build can be broken! Because of the failure of this part, the developers simply decided to make it so the plot of this part doesn't exist, since DLC for the second part was released! I can't say the game is good, but I can't say it's bad for myself, because my childhood memories are already kicking in, and fond memories prevent me from doing so... Yes, I understand all the shortcomings of this installment, and I agree with the negative reviews! But I'll still love it, because I'm a shit eater!!!

7 Thanks to the Russian developers, although it's not a good game, it's a great children's playthrough out of 10!

Yes, in case anyone didn't know, this installment was made by Russian developers! Personally, I only just found out...

column8: I sure love how the police chief is scared of getting shot at, or how he randomly decides he wants to shoot you, or how he just starts going back instead of following you, or how alt-tabbing will completely mess up your game, or how there's no free-roam, or how the achievements simply don't unlock, or how there's no money, no vending machines, no nothing. I thought Postal 4 was bad, and then I played this horrendous torture method straight from the seventh layer of Dante's hell. I've already seen a pigeon shit and it's white, gooey feces were better than this game. If this game were part of a movie, it would be the kids on Stuart Little that got rejected over a literal mouse. I thought Hitler killed himself because he lost the Second World War, but no, he killed himself so he wouldn't see this absolute disaster of an attempt at making a coherent game. Not even the writers from Family Guy could have made something this bad.

column8:
Nice implementation of the jump function, that jump function really comes in handy. Also, nice choice of using finite enemy NPC spawns during boss battles as to not encumber you while fighting the balanced, and in no way unnecessarily OP bosses who don't spam super weapons and totally don't crash the game on modern hardware with too many explosions and too many assets on screen at once.
This game is only $1.01, that's less than the cost of a shrinkflated candy bar in current year's economy, so what have you got to lose aside from a few hours of your life and 1/3 of a Snickers.

column8:
What happens when you outsource your game to become pre-alpha slavjank on Source.

It's [i]playable[/i], but there's an overdose of "kill X enemies" and escort missions. The cutscenes for the police station level's endings are swapped. The morality gauge does not work as intended (as in the intended mechanic of regaining karma via non-lethal takedowns does not work - once you're in the red, you're stuck). You can't get the proper ending unless you go down the good path and the devs chastise you for it. In a Postal game.
It's extremely linear, very repetitive with little replay value besides going through both the good and bad paths. The only good thing I can say about this game is, some of the licensed music choice is pretty good, and Corey Cruise's performance as the Dude is great. In stark contrast to extremely annoying and loud sound effects (especially the scream jumpscare and the absolutely overused whip sound effect for transitions).

Don't even bother. Go play Postal 2 instead. Unless you don't mind 5 or so hours of masochism just to experience what this mess has to offer.

column9: When people said this game was a total disaster and a waste of money, they were absolutely right. I wanted to try it out to see if it really deserved all the hate, and I had a pretty bad time with the constant crashing and lag, plus the awkward mechanics and controls. I don't know if it's playable on console, but as far as the PC port goes, it isn't. The best thing you can do is buy Lost Paradise, since it's a direct sequel to the second game, and the entire story of this game is a dream (meaning it's not canon).

I just fucking beat the game to the good ending, but then I decided to blow everything up, damn it, it's a shame my wife went back home to dad, otherwise I would have taken that juicy chick from the Scissors company, but as it is, I don't give a shit, in a day I'll forget how I played this, the game lasts a couple of hours at most

I recently finished my favorite childhood game, Postal 2. It's a 2003 game, not perfect‚Äîlots of bugs, crooked NPC models, and a lot of other stuff‚Äîbut it was great. After playing this part for an hour, I was nothing but disgusted, as all the lines from the second game were different... They were completely rephrased, and the funniest thing is, the voice acting is now monochromatic.
The very concept of the game is ruined. Terrible controls, third-person view‚Äîwhat's the point? The background noise and static.
I could only endure this part up until the shopping mall, where you have to fight off "fanatical" police officers. Endless hordes of them spawn right before your eyes. In the mission where you have to protect the woman who was signing autographs, if you start killing the "mothers," you'll have to fight off the police too. While chasing the "Moms," we start killing cops. You need to kill 15 "Moms," but at that point, cops will get in the way, and you'll have to kill them too, but the number you kill won't count, since you should have killed the "Moms" first...
The game's broken code, the endless hordes, the guy's awkward phrasing. It all really pissed me off! I don't recommend anyone buy this part of Postal, even if it's cheap. Better get the second one, it's amazing.
Fucking crap, I hope it gets better than Part 2, I won't be playing it.

[h1]Postal 3[/h1]
I received the game as a gift, and I haven't been able to complete it the right way ([spoiler]so far[/spoiler]). If you're a normal person, it's not worth your 250 rubles, so don't play it. If you're as crazy as me, you might like it.
[h2]The Good, the Bad, the Dude[/h2]
The game has a karma system, which doesn't work as advertised. I liked the idea, but the wonderful Improvement Mod removes it completely. This is more of a mod issue, but still.
[h2]Catharsis![/h2]
The game doesn't have an open world. There's a free-roam mode that unlocks after completing the game, and it requires loading screens. There are no NPCs here, the missions are repetitive and monotonous, and the only weapons you'll use are the Hammer Gun [spoiler]or the Badger, which is in the game[/spoiler]‚Äîwhich isn't even in the game, it's added via a mod! The Hammer Gun has infinite ammo and puts enemies to sleep almost instantly, and for medium range, the Taser is perfect. Oh, and you won't figure out how it works in the mission with Jen, because you have to HOLD the primary attack key, not press it. Where will you find that? In the manual! No one will read it! The game shows you a cutscene saying you can regenerate good karma. That's not true! How do you know that? That's right, [spoiler]from Hitler![/spoiler] from the manual!
[h2]Cyberpunk 2011[/h2]
I won't talk about bugs and crashes. If you love optimization, stable FPS, crash-free gaming, and the absence of [strike]micro[/strike] freezes, run away from this game and leave your heels sparkling!
[h2] Conclusion [/h2]
I have a classic love-hate relationship with this game. I still liked it. I don't think you'll like it. But who knows...
[h1]BONUS!!![/h1]
By the way, ShepardOF B>TF2Shit is a dangerous sociopath who rarely leaves his house. He promised to give me a collector's edition of this product for New Year 2024. I'll post it if I get it. ShepardOF B>TF2Shit, if you're reading this, I'm waiting for the collector's edition, otherwise I'll make you go outside on more than just Sundays!

column8:
The weakest moment in my life occurred the day I played this game for the first time.
As I saw the hatred of the fandom and RWS for this game, I wondered if their comments were hyperbolic.  It had crossed my mind that maybe this game wouldn't be as bad as they said. I hoped that this game would have at least one positive attribute.¬†


It took me only eighteen minutes of the tutorial to realize how disdain feels.¬†
Silver linings were not to be found. Imagining how painful reaching the first chapter must be is beyond my comprehension. By crashing itself, the game had ended my torment. As I lay there in utter ambivalence, my eyes staring at my backdrop, I couldn‚Äôt help but feel as if this game had purloined a part of my soul. I turned off my computer and slept. I had lost my will to drink, eat, play games, do work, and breathe. I have to applaud this game for the only thing it did right.¬†

It made a grown man weep.¬†

On one side it is horrible, on the other side it is horrible but amusing.

Really, the gameplay SUCKS.  But if you like Postal it is not the worse way to spend $1.  Only played for a couple of hours, not sure I'll play longer.  Maybe I will...who knows.

One thing I wish some Dev (whatever Dev of the week) would fix is the automatic saving.  The game is so bad (to the point of being unfair at points) you can lose 99% of progress in a level just to have to repeat all the nonsense over.  The gameplay sucked the first time but the jank was fun when it was novel.  Once that newness wears off all you have is crap you have already done and don't want to do another 3-4 more times just to get to the fresh crap.   That is where I am at currently.

column8: This is the best game available to buy on steam to date
column9: This is the best game available to buy on steam to date

Worse than the second game, but somehow better than the fourth, which I didn't have the nerve to complete.

And that was my second playthrough of this vile piece of code, which, for some reason, the Akello team decided to re-upload to Steam without Star Force.

Well, if you look at it without any jokes or anything, the game is, of course, pretty trash, basically what it was and remains. The patch that removed Star Force reportedly improved performance slightly, but the FPS, which never goes above 130 and still drops below 50, doesn't make the picture much better.
=
As for the graphics, well, it's okay; in my opinion, it's much nicer than the fourth game with its intensive post-shaders and overly polished models, which somehow look worse than the ones here, although not everything is perfect there.
=
Gameplay, well, there's nothing much to say about it. The karma system is rubbish‚Äîyou can lose it but not get it. I don't know how I managed to complete the second playthrough as a cop. The "heroic" path is the most boring, and if you're planning on playing, forget it‚Äîit's not worth it. And there's a slightly more varied bad path where you don't have to worry about a bot jumping in front of you again.

The guns are fundamentally pretty sloppy, except for the pistol and assault rifle. Everything else isn't particularly usable. For example, the shotgun's damage is ridiculous, like shooting enemies with salt. The machine gun is so sloppy that hitting closer than 3-4 meters is a stroke of luck, even with aim. The rocket launcher is powerful but useless, as I only found it towards the end of the game. You explode when you press the left mouse button, as you have to hold it down like in the second game, although that's pointless‚Äîthe right mouse button launches the rocket straight ahead and everything's fine. Melee combat is completely useless because the hitboxes are clearly broken, and you have to get right up close to the bots to slash an enemy. Other junk like cats, vacuum cleaners, spray cans, and so on are useless and can be used for fun, but they're not particularly usable in practice.

What else is there to write?
The plot was written by a drug addict who clearly couldn't decide whether he was making a game for Americans or Russians. There are plenty of jokes that both sides won't understand, and even those that do aren't particularly funny.

The voice acting is monotonous and trash, as are the guy's lines.

The music is generally praised, but it's not super good‚Äîit's just okay.

To summarize, the game is garbage, although it had the potential to be the best in the series, but it feels like the developers either gave up halfway through or didn't give them the time or money. I saw there were mods that fixed a bunch of things, but I played through them without them, because the only thing that could make this game better would be leaked source code and a bunch of idiots who would make a decent game out of it.

3.5/10 - It's worth adding to a fan's collection, or if you want to play a poorly made game to make other half-baked products seem better than they actually are, you can do that too, although this game can probably surpass some of them, which is unfortunate.

I had to see for myself and spent a dollar for this game

They got everything wrong

Clunky third person mode, cheesy dialogues; and on the technical side, horrible optimization and frequent crashes

From a sinister and traumatizing Postal 1, trough a funnier and satirical sequel to a goofy and "cringy" third installment that made itself a meme for its mediocrity 

The people who designed this game did not understand what they had into their hands

column8: I FUCKING HATE THIS GAME
column9: I FUCKING HATE THIS GAME

Well, I bought Postal III on Steam... And what can I say? It's just a normal game.
Of all the bugs, I only encountered two: Helmet Sucker wouldn't follow me into the bunker, and the game crashed when killing Taliban in the mission "Homeland in Danger!" I had to skip. I didn't experience those critical crashes with a human shield and grenades; either someone started a story about that, or I'm just that lucky.
The game looks beautiful; the only thing that catches my eye are those cartoonish NPCs. Dude is well-made. What's also noticeable are the blood marks (blood on the NPC models), which look crooked on the models, and the sounds from Half-Life 2, which are ear-wrenching everywhere. The AI ‚Äã‚Äãis a bit slow, yes. When I was doing a mission in the Ghetto, a random NPC approached me and started hitting the Dude (if I'd killed him, I would have lost Karma), but then a cop protected me. Still, the AI, while fair, does its main job.
Of all the firearms, the only ones that work are the M16, Shotgun, and M249. The pistol deals almost as much damage as the pistol from Postal 2, but it also fires slowly and deals little damage.
Of the melee weapons, the only one that works is the machete, as it's easier to hit NPCs with it than the sledgehammer and axe, which also have a slow animation. Cats can only be found in the wild and in the cat-catching mission. I never used them because they don't want to latch onto NPCs, and they're generally useless.
Of the other weapons, everything sucks. It's hard to douse someone with a canister, and gasoline doesn't always ignite. The stun gun is only good for two missions. Pepper spray doesn't always set NPCs on fire. The guy pees quickly, and his urine regenerates slowly, so it's best to stay away from fire. The vacuum cleaner is only good for one mission; it's useless otherwise.
Those who complained about the voice acting‚Äîwell, damn, the game actually parodies old action movies with monotonous voice acting like Gavrilov or Voldarsky (may he rest in peace).
The locations are beautiful, but even more beautiful ones were cut because the engine was simply running out of steam. Take the waterfall at the Ecologists' base, for example.
What's interesting is that the game can be run on Xbox 360. Not bad, huh?
You can also run maps from games made with Source (there's even a guide on this topic).
So, to sum it up. I had a lot of fun playing it and playing it. In my opinion, the game was ruined because of player expectations. People wanted the same trash as the second game, wanted a day-by-day progression, and they complained about the linear narrative (though Apocalypse Weekend had the same thing, and no one complained). Yes, the game is built on bugs and an Indian cemetery of developers who were kicked out into the cold after the game's release, but I really enjoyed it, and I recommend you check it out.

column8: Postal 3 but fixed.

column9:
[h1] As good as the second Postal was for its absurdity, madness, and trash, the third is just as bad. [/h1]

Let's clarify something right away. The game was made by a different team. And the game itself was in production hell. It changed teams, publishers, concepts, and engines. Let's just take that into account and remember.
But my main disappointment with the game is the new creators' complete lack of understanding of the idea behind the second Postal. Absurdity, madness, and trash must have a limit. No, not a limit to what's acceptable, but a balance between too much and too little. When there's too much absurdity, it becomes a mess, a mere jumble of everything. And when there's too little, the absurdity becomes a light, clumsy, and inappropriate joke. For example, consider the themes of politics and sex. The absurdity elevates these themes to a peak, highlighting the more contrasting elements. These elements, in turn, create an absurd situation. The second part was very adept at both pseudo-politics and depicting the depravity of the masses, which is not generally discussed in society. But Postal 3 falls short on the political front (it's no surprise that by 2011, certain regulations had been introduced to control censorship in video games), and it overdoes the sex theme, like an overexcited twelve-year-old watching videos on specialized websites 24/7. This applies to all themes: consumer society, religion, murder, soulless capitalism, and so on.
Whereas Postal 2 had balance and the absurd themes themselves led somewhere, Postal 3 sometimes overdoes it, sometimes failing to adequately explore the themes, which in turn lead nowhere, but are simply there.
The other downsides are trivial: the graphics are average even by 2011 standards, the gameplay is painful, the musical score would have been better absent, dialogue for the sake of dialogue, etc.

1/10

column8:
I've committed a sin. Please forgive me for "trying" this game out. Regardless I'm aware what I'm really in for.

With that being said, few hours in and it is suuuuure is a treat and quite the horrible kind. Although believe me when I say this: it's not bad bad BAD bad. But it is really bad enough to give negative review.
Cutscenes are very annoying combined with starting tutorial as if they really thought cam shots would've been super unique and cool. Presentation is just bad in general, with weapons and its gunplay, gameplay in general is way confusing and keybinds are a huge fuzz to deal with. POSTAL dude's jokes and puns are outrageously bad... like the only 10% of the voicelines are good if I'd bother listening again.
Campaign is a short 2 hour example in short knowing how budget of this game- well. It's POSTAL III.
It's even more laughably bad that there's even achievements included and they're only there to "drag" you more to keep on playing. Because from the looks of it they ask long and tedious task which is once more a bait to keep you playing this. What else is there? Oh yeah, remember POSTAL 2? Well for some reason the whole plot and story is a followup to that from Lost in Paradise but not even close being canon since you play as POSTAL 1 dude instead for all questionable reasons. Sprinting in this game is headache inducing.
Remember that powerful kick from POSTAL 2? It's nerfed to the ground. Every weapon and feature you knew and loved from POSTAL 1 and 2 are downgraded to the brim here.

It's not even surprising that this game got also removed from the shelves and came back for some reason due to how bad it is. And the ONLY props I'd give coming from me is the segway being fully controllable. Thus jigglebone physics on clothing and models are OK. But that's it.
Play this if it goes really really cheap and interested to try this hot pile of garbage. Don't bother giving full amount. It's really not worth the interest.

Please buy official games from Running with Scissors and support the actual devs. This game was a sham and stolen most of its coding and such since this was ran by a bunch of Russian users or so.
In short, buy POSTAL 4 (which is the real POSTAL 3 and canon one).

column8:
Postal III is a completely different experience from every game aside from Apocalypse Weekend due to it's linear form. Postal III is a very brutal and humorous experience on what it is like in Catharsis, Arizona. This game really shows what it is like to be a cool dude in a bad place.

Pros: The gun-play is AMAZING!!! The game uses familiar locations throughout the game so the company can use more time working on the other parts of the game. The game completely revamps the way you heal by adding a cover healing system. The game runs perfectly well with hardly no crashes whatsoever. The way to access the game before DRM fix was totally not a pain in the ass. The screams at the end of almost every cutscene freak me the heck out every time.

Cons: Everything listed above is totally not the opposite. Not enough Krotchy.


Jokes aside, the game isn't the worst thing in the world, but it is pretty shit. It looks fine and Corey Cruise did a good job.

Postal 1 is a psychotic twin stick shooter with fun to be had. Postal 2 is an open ended choice game with only one sane person in Arizona. Postal 2: Apocalypse Weekend is fun extra content for Postal 2. Postal III is complete and udder dumpster trash with problems not even a therapist can help. Postal 2: Paradise Lost is Postal III but good and not Postal III. Postal Redux is a modern and fresh remake of the first Postal game. Postal 4 is a buggy mess with still some fun to be had. Postal Brain Damaged is fun FPS that stars the Postal Dude and the Postal Dude's brain. POOSTAL ROYALE is a joke. The Postal Movie is a cinematic masterpiece with goofy humor.

Postal III is a buggy mess with the only good part is the voice actor Corey Cruise. If you are a Postal fan, you don't need to play this game. The only way I would recommend this game is for people to get the complete Postal experience. Postal III is a 3/10 in my books.

column8:
Secuela del famoso Postal 2, un juegazo de su epoca, debido a su locura y a que en parte era mundo abierto y habia muchas cosas por hacer.
Desarrollado por un estudio ajeno a los originales, aun que coproducido y ayudado por ellos.
Le quise dar una oportunidad ya que me jugue los 2 anteriores y el 2 en concreto me encanto, recientemente los desarrolladores tuvieron que actualizar el juego y quitarle el DRM ya que valve lo elimino de la tienda por que era injugable.
Aprovechando esto empec√© y vaya experienda mas aterradora, es la primera vez que veo un juego en source tan mal optimizado, he tenido zonas que jugaba a 30 fps.
La historia es estupida y no tiene nada de gracia, debo estar haciendome viejo por que me parecia todo humor infantil por que dice pedo caca culo y fuck.
3 horas de triste gameplay, menos mal que me costo 1‚Ç¨ el juego, aun que tiene 2 finales.
Gameplay ortopedico, armas con mucho recoil y poca variedad.
El juego tiene muchisimos bugs y se crashea costantemente, los logros estan rotos no se pueden obtener.
No se, esta todo mal, jam√°s lo recomendaria.
column9:
Sequel to the famous Postal 2, a great game of its time, due to its insanity and the fact that it was partly open-world and had a lot to do.
Developed by a studio unrelated to the originals, although co-produced and assisted by them.
I wanted to give it a try since I played the previous two and loved the second one in particular. The developers recently had to update the game and remove the DRM because Valve removed it from the store because it was unplayable.
Taking advantage of this, I started it and what a terrifying experience it was. It's the first time I've seen a source game so poorly optimized. I've even had areas that I played at 30 fps.
The story is stupid and not funny at all. I must be getting old because it all seemed like juvenile humor because it says fart, poop, ass, and fuck.
3 hours of miserable gameplay. Thank goodness the game cost me ‚Ç¨1, even though it has two endings.
Orthopedic gameplay, weapons with a lot of recoil and little variety.
The game has tons of bugs and crashes constantly, the achievements are broken and unobtainable.
I don't know, it's all bad, I would never recommend it.

column9: I have a bug in the mission where you have to protect a woman in the mall, the dude keeps walking backwards and doesn't go in other directions, if anyone knows how to fix it, give me a shout

I love Postal, but this game is very different from other games in the series.
When you enter the game, you're greeted by a rather beautiful menu, which I personally liked. The game itself features a nice soundtrack that plays throughout the missions, making it pleasant to listen to. I liked the good and bad path mechanics, as they change the missions and endings. The cool thing is, your path can change right during the mission. However, this game has quite a few bugs, stupid AI, and audio issues, but they can be resolved by entering the command snd_rebuildaudiocache in the console. It helped me. There are some unfunny jokes at times, and the optimization isn't great. Overall, the game isn't as bad as other reviews have made it out to be. My rating is 7/10.

column9:
The level of freedom is significantly reduced compared to the previous game, and players are forced into missions before they've fully experienced the excitement. This is similar to Far Cry 5. The third game has essentially become an FPS, with a short main storyline, sparse maps, and a high degree of repetition.

BGM, 9 points.

Control, 7 points.

Plot, 4 points.

Difficulty, 3 points.

Level of freedom, 8 points.

Overall rating, 5 points. This is simply not as good as the previous game. Players invested a lot of time and anticipation, but it didn't satisfy them, hence the negative review.

Cons: You can't skip the credits and the third-person view is useless.
Pros: Everything.

column8:
En espa√±ol: Esta increible! si, tiene sus bugs o aveces de la nada se sale. Pero la verdad para mi es disfrutable las misiones son entretenidas con su humor negro, y ir recolectando cada vez mas armas es genial. Las fisicas de el juego me gustan muchisimo los desmembramientos y el sistema de disparos. La IA aveces puede ser un poco imbecil pero lo importante es la historia. hasta ahora lo juego en facil. quizas en mas dificultad mejora, los graficos para el a√±o en el que salio se ven muy bien. y haciendo bien una guia que aparece en steam sobre la optimizacion te queda funcionando casi perfecto. nunca entendi por que tanto hate hacia este juego, monton de videos diciendo que es el peor juego, para mi no es asi. y lo estoy disfrutando muchisimo. espero usted tambien sepa verle lo bueno.
La version de steam no tiene la ultima actualizacion, recomiendo la version de la plataforma ZOOM. Por lo menos por el momento hasta que actualizen esta. 


In InglishIt is incredible! Yes, it has its bugs or sometimes it comes out of nowhere. But the truth is that for me it is enjoyable, the missions are entertaining with their black humor, and collecting more and more weapons is great. I really like the physics of the game, the dismemberments and the shooting system. The AI ‚Äã‚Äãcan sometimes be a bit stupid but the important thing is the story. So far I play it on easy. Maybe with more difficulty it improves, the graphs for the year it came out look very good. and by doing a good guide that appears on Steam on optimization, it works almost perfectly. I never understood why there is so much hate towards this game, a lot of videos saying that it is the worst game, for me it is not like that. and I'm enjoying it very much. I hope you also know how to see the good in it.
The steam version does not have the latest update, I recommend the ZOOM platform version. At least for the moment until they update this one.
column9:
In English: It's incredible! Yes, it has its bugs, or sometimes it just pops out of nowhere. But the truth is, for me, it's enjoyable. The missions are entertaining with their dark humor, and collecting more and more weapons is great. I really like the game's physics, the dismemberment, and the shooting system. The AI ‚Äã‚Äãcan sometimes be a bit stupid, but the important thing is the story. So far, I'm playing it on easy. Maybe it improves on higher difficulties. The graphics look great for the year it came out. And if you follow the optimization guide on Steam correctly, it runs almost perfectly. I never understood why there's so much hate towards this game, tons of videos saying it's the worst game. For me, that's not the case. And I'm really enjoying it. I hope you can see the good side of it too.
The Steam version doesn't have the latest update; I recommend the ZOOM platform version. At least for now, until they update this one.

column8:
I regret buying and playing this atrocity.

I've played Postal 3 so that you don't have to. It's not bad, it's worse. Postal 3 is the worst 3rd person shooter I have ever played. I've played and love Postal 2 since I was 18 years old, I am still playing and I still really like Postal 2, Postal: Redux and I'm starting to like Postal 4. As a guy who loves the Postal series, I am offended by this game because of how bad and unfunny it is. After playing less than 2 hours of this atrocity, I am getting a refund and going back to Postal 2, Postal: Redux and Postal 4 right now. Here's why:

The Good: The menu screen music is decent, Postal 3 Postal Dude's VA (Corey Cruise) is a great VA (Too bad he's in this game), and that's it.

The Bad: Everything else in this game fucking sucks! The gunplay is terrible, the animations for a 2011 game are bad, the sound design is abysmal, the melee system is horrible, the AI is fucking stupid, the jokes are not funny, the level design is terrible, the controls are clunky as hell, visually the game looks bad for a 2011 game, the morality system is poorly designed and doesn't belong in a Postal game, and the cutscenes are godawful.

Overall, this game sucks and it is the worst game I've played this year. Yes, it's worse than Starfield, Redfall, COD: MW3 (2023 reboot version) and DMC2 (Those games that I've played this year are also terrible).

Final verdict: 0/10 Sinful (At least it's not the disgusting and vile game called The Suicide of Rachel Foster (Don't buy that disgusting game! It's worse than Postal 3.))

column9: Think of me what you will. Maybe I'm a bit of a masochist, but I just enjoyed Postal 3. Sure, it's buggy as hell, it crashes all the time, the optimization is terrible, the sound design will often make your ears hurt, the melee weapon controls are terrible and the firearms aren't much better. But otherwise... I just enjoyed it. The story was pointless nonsense, but it kept the Postal atmosphere and some moments, like the meeting with Uwe Boll, were truly legendary. The cutscenes were great, the timing of the lines made me laugh out loud a few times, Corey Cruise was excellent as Dud and the soundtrack was chosen brilliantly. The karma system and two different storylines were interesting and would deserve a return in another game in the series and overall there was a lot of effort wasted by the collapse of Akella and the incompetence of their leaders. Thanks to the length of the game, I was also motivated to play the second, and paradoxically much better, version of the story as a "decent citizen", which I decided to complete without killing, which of course the game did not count and I did not get the achievement, but that was probably to be expected. In its time and at full price, Postal 3 certainly deserved the reputation it now has on the internet, but nowadays, and at such a low price, I have to say that... [b] I regret nothing [/b].
It's all SpongeBob's fault

I liked the game. Yes, there are some minor bugs, but they don't hinder the gameplay or detract from my appreciation of the Postal series. In my opinion, it's better than the second installment of the Dude's Adventures. At least it has an interesting story (more or less). I remembered there's a sound issue in the Russian version, but it's easily fixable; you'll find solutions in the "community content." I was pleased with the voice acting of Kurazh-Bambey. I bought it on sale, and the price is well worth it; you might even pay a little more.

column8:
I love and hate this game at the same time. It's fun, but I hate it with a burning passion. If I had to describe this game, it's like that toxic ex boyfriend/girlfriend that you hate, they know you hate them, but you come back for more, because you're a masochist. This game can be fun at times, but I catch myself with a headache because of the utter ridiculousness it has to offer. I have a love/hate relationship with this game. At times it doesn't even feel like a Postal game. 
Do I recommend it? 
I do, because some things have been fixed from what I heard. And it's fun if you like a challenge and want to have a different Postal experience. Also, the music is pretty good. Caught myself vibing more than playing here and there,
All in all.
I regret everything.

column8: I hesitated for a long time on this game but picked it up recently for $1 which was more than worth the price. This game does get a lot of hate but I guess it was much more of a buggy than it is now. RWS has been actively fixing it lately so definitely a good time to try it out. I did noticed a few bugs and some microstutter for a few seconds every now and then but it's still completely playable. Postal 3 is just as messed up (humor/gore) as postal 2 but more linear rather than open world. it's a little short, around 7 hours but still a lot of fun and one I'll play again.

column9:
Horrible. I knew it was terrible before buying it, but I wanted all the postcards. I had to skip it.
Poorly optimized, boring, horrible controls, everything was bad.

If it weren't for the botched achievements, I might even give it a thumbs up, because for one or two playthroughs it's not that bad (especially if you skip all the cutscenes like I did). But this is the most crooked grind I've ever seen. The rhinos are absolutely terrifying, the crookedest rhinos, they just get stuck everywhere and don't crash into anything. The first time I played, I spent an hour with one of those rhinos, and I had to kill them 235 times. Luckily, I made a successful save, so I only had to reload it 235 times.
DELETE THE RHINOS!!!
It's short, buggy, awkward, not funny (well, maybe a little), boring, empty, laggy, and deafening with a screeching sound instead of the guy's lines. But in any case, it's 1000% better than POSRAL 1.

So is the devil as black as he's painted?
The game is riddled with bugs, control issues, crashes, dumb mobs, weird dialogue, terrible scripting... and how does this miracle even "work" on the source? It's like some kind of hodgepodge of who knows what. And unfortunately, all this causes more irritation than any variety or fun.
On the plus side, I can mention the cats that claw at your hands and the thighs of your enemies, screaming and gnawing. You don't usually see that in other games.
But I don't care, they're not releasing much better games now, with the same problems... At a 90% discount, it'll do just fine with a glass of kvass.
