column8:
Ah yes, Postal 3. I still have the physical copy that sits proudly next to my 10 year anniversary cereal box of Postal 2. Yet, why all the hate? Where's the love for this title? Well kids, sit down and let me explain. Postal 3 was not developed by the same team as Postal 2. Postal 3 was outsourced to another company where it was worked on. Early releases showed something very promising and even top the previous title. However the months turned to years and soon Running With Scissors started asking where the product was. Finally one day with no time left, and a crowd quickly dying, Postal 3 was released unfinished. 

Yes kids, this title that has a good idea behind it and humor that pars with the movie and tops the previous title will never be seen in its entirety. When Postal 3 went out it quickly became known that the product was not finished. Glitches, broken achievements, missing features, the list seemed like it wouldn't end. Then eventually when Postal 3's title was trashed, Running With Scissors came out and put a very very far distance between themselves and the game, disowning it completely and Postal 3 fell into obscurity without love.

However the title does have its defenders like myself. When I first played Postal 3 ten years ago I felt that despite it being released in a late Beta stage it still did what it set out to do. To make you laugh and have fun. That is what I did, I laughed and I did have fun. There were some aggravation and even crashes, but I completed it and I did not regret it.

Postal 3 takes place shortly after the events of Postal 2's continuation Apocalypse Weekend. Now in a new town, Dude tries to scrap his life together for better (or worse) depending on your play style. Yes, this title does something unique, your actions effects certain events, and many events there are! Will you help your fellow town folk or create a repeat of Postal 2? The choice is yours! 

While having a choice, or moral system in place, Postal 3 has some interesting new weapons, enemies and the location is even fun to explore (note: you must complete the game to unlock free play from the level select) Postal 3 uses the (even at the time) horribly outdated Source engine from VALVe. This causes glitches on modern hardware that can be fixed up with some ease. Sadly this will not fix many issues such as some hit box detection, other glitches and broken achievements. 

Remember, this was released in a late Beta stage, so you can imagine some of the frustration you're going to run into. However if you look past that and look at the core idea of Postal 3, and take it in all its glitchy goodness, you will find a very fun and often funny title. Yes Postal 3, you are not unloved, you are just misunderstood. 

Folks, Postal 3 might not work for you, you may have to get patches, but I do beg you to look into it more. There's lots of laughs to be had in here. Is it better than Postal 2? Certainly not, and I don't think R.W.S. should have distanced themselves so quickly. Give it a chance, slow down and take it at face value as a late Beta game. Postal 3 is one of the most overlooked titles and it should be revisited. R.W.S. in 2019 released Postal 4 into Early Access so consider that a remake of Postal 3 if you will, but I do say more people should revisit this.

column8: I loved Postal 2 so much that I got the Postal 3 collectors edition on the day it was released. The "collectors" edition consisted in a standard plastic box with one single sheet containing the steam code and a DVD with the game files. If this is a collectors edition then I'm Brad Pitt. OK, let's play the game, I told myself: 3.8 frustrating hours until I uninstalled this piece of garbage and forgot about it for years until I found it randomly checking my steam library. Back in the day I never gave it a proper review so I'm here now. Actually I have anything more to add to what has already written about it (even Running With Scissors recomend not to purchase this, I wish they told me back in the day!) but the shitty phisical edition that is the icing of the cake in this utter disaster.

I don't understand all the drama people are making about how bad the game is.
But you MUST download a patch for the game.
Otherwise, it will crash and freeze several times. So download it if you don't know how.
Go to: https://yadi.sk/d/rIk1MPLF37Lp3f
Copy this link, but don't forget to remove the space after the .
Click the white download button.
And use the "p3" version.
Go to the game files and paste the patch's p3 in the same place as the original p3 (DO NOT DELETE THE ORIGINAL P3).

column9:
[h1]Rating 2/10, [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/34526713-Gaming-Professors/]Curator[/url][/h1]

Postal 3 is unfortunately a bad game, from which even the original developers of Running With Scissors distanced themselves. Bad and unnecessary mechanics, constant game crashes, lags, bugs and a lot more are things that can make you disgusted with the game itself. Unfortunately, I can't recommend this title to anyone, but it's clear to me that Postal 3 certainly has its fans. You can buy this title on Steam for ‚Ç¨11.99.

Full review here: https://www.gamingprofessors.cz/postal-3-herni-recenze/

column8:
I must say that I did enjoy the game from start, till the end with just a few minor bugs, during which i had to just restart the game.
Well it's not as good as Postal II, both the story and the mechanics, as well as everything else.
It gives the idea that it was created handily or in hurry.. However it's not bad trying it if you really like all Postal games and there is an opportunity to get it with a big discount, which they offer from time to time (80% or something).

column8:
so bad its good.
heres what RWS had to say on postal 3
"Postal III is a third-person shooter in which you‚Ä¶ ehh‚Ä¶ uhm‚Ä¶

Alright I‚Äôm going to level with you ‚Äì don‚Äôt buy Postal III. Seriously, you‚Äôd regret it. Hell, you‚Äôd regret playing it for free. It‚Äôs a borderline-broken, boring, frustrating, unfinished mess, and there was nothing we could do stop it.

What happened is that we agreed to let a big Russian publisher develop and publish a third Postal game, which we would handle the design for. It was actually going well for the initial development time, but then the economy crashed especially hard in Russia and the project was handed to a smaller, less experienced team that didn‚Äôt have the skill or resources to make the game we designed, and they were forced to rush development to meet unreasonable deadlines. Corners were cut severely, dramatic changes to our design were made, and the game was put out in an unfinished barely-Alpha state. The game is simply unfinished and broken. And when it does work, the game is just boring and frustrating to play. The sad part is that the publisher made little-to-no effot to fix it themselves, nor did they ever give us access so that we could try patching it up for them. We are stuck with Postal III as it is.

You‚Äôre a responsible adult (we hope), so I‚Äôm sure you‚Äôre capable of making your own purchasing decisions. I just want you to consider all of the above, before you make the leap of regret into paying real hard-earned money for this title. We don‚Äôt own the game, we can‚Äôt support it and we don‚Äôt get anything from its sales, so if you decide to risk the purchase ‚Äì you‚Äôre on your own."

column9: I really like postcards, but this one is shit, the gameplay is terrible, the missions are bad, and it seems like it never ends before you get to the next objective. I hope they fix this in postcard 4.

Pros:
Patrolling is well done; I felt like a cop.
The voice acting by Kurazh-Bambey.Ru is good.
Soundtrack

Cons:
The game crashes very often.
Enemies you need to kill for the mission are often hiding somewhere.
The sound hisses and crackles, but this can be fixed by entering snd_rebuildaudiocache in the console.

AI: At the lowest level. (Even in the 90s, they wrote better AI.)
Pros of this AI: Enemies don't notice you at point-blank range.
Cons of this AI: The mayor, riding a Segway, can get stuck along the way.

column9:
After twenty hours, I finally beat this fucking piece of garbage! The reason I was able to play this piece of shit is because I bought the POSTAL XX 20th Anniversary Gift Pack on the RWS website. At the time, the website's recommendations told me to avoid this piece of shit. Ugh, guess what? I didn't believe it! (Inner thought: Damn! It's all POSTAL, isn't it? It's just a fun game, so what?) After playing it, I realized, WTF! Shit! Surprise!

1. Terrible controls and shooting: The direction keys kept messing up, and it was so random. I'd be stuck mid-fire when I'd start shooting. And he holds his gun like an African soldier.

2. "Super Smart" AI: Constantly running in the opposite direction or sprinting into a wall. The most idiotic level is the one where you're escorting the fat guy on a bike. You're driving and it's stuck in the same spot. You're almost there, but then it gets stuck underground. Or you're standing there getting shot at by the Taliban. You drive after it, and it's just going in circles. Fuck!

3. Nonsensical linear storyline and monotonous, repetitive missions: Honestly, I thought the good and evil choices at the beginning were pretty good, with different options leading to different paths. But the monotonous missions are ridiculous. It feels like I'm playing a bodyguard DUDE simulator or a "How I Used My Stupid Weapons to Destroy a Gangster Base" or "The Story of My Vacuum Cleaner and Toilet Paper." And it's just all gunfire, ... 4. The pitifully limited weapons and the aiming crosshairs that require a drunken streak: The stun gun is nice, but I can't really tell the difference between the M60 and the M16, aside from the reload speed. The melee weapon is completely useless, and that ridiculous pepper spray‚Äîit burns for ages, but the opponent doesn't react at all. And that wise look in my eyes seems to say, "You're an idiot!"

In short, I never want to touch this shit again. I look forward to the full release of POSTAL 4, and I want to warn future players not to play with this crap. If you're really interested, please visit Sanda!

column8:
[h1]Comentario Anal√≠tico: "Postal III"[/h1]

Este juego es un desastre estelar; fue desarrollado por otra empresa, desapareci√≥ y reapareci√≥ en Steam y en 2020 se filtr√≥ su c√≥digo fuente junto con el de Team Fortress 2 y Half-Life 2: Episode 2, provocando toda una parafernalia respecto a la seguridad de los servidores de TF2.

Plantea una din√°mica de juego muy distinta, ahora fragmentada en misiones en contraposici√≥n al mundo abierto de su predecesor, algo que no es malo per se y que, de hecho, se hace valer por el sistema de valoraci√≥n moral con el que podemos acabar desbloqueando distintas misiones. A su favor tengo para decir que Postal III entiende muy bien al sentido del humor que Running With Scissors expuso en Postal II.

Y hasta ah√≠ queda todo lo bueno que se pueda decir de √©l; todo lo dem√°s es una serie de escenarios apenas planteados para los tiroteos que all√≠ ocurren, con coberturas inservibles, enemigos cuyos disparos traspasan las paredes, jefes que exigen demasiada precisi√≥n como para correr a una taza de fotogramas tan baja, m√∫sica tan poco cohesiva que pareciera haber salido de distintas bandas sonoras, un espantoso men√∫ de selecci√≥n de armas (Que acaba siendo un espanto en caso de querer abrirlo durante un tiroteo) y escenarios carentes de conexi√≥n alguna.

Y el rendimiento no es su √∫nico problema t√©nico; correr consume una barra de estamina que en algunas ocasiones se bugea y deja de cargar por el resto de la misi√≥n, los NPCs corren en direcciones aleatorias durante un tiroteo y se ponen frente tuyo provocando que les dispares y pierdas puntos de reputaci√≥n, y eso cuando no est√°n repitiendo los mismos dos o tres di√°logos, los efectos de sonidos son aquellos por defecto del motor Source, la c√°mara es inentendible al sprintear, en ocasiones los enemigos no reaccionan al ser atacados y tienden a hacer spawn frente al jugador.

Y todo esto si ten√©s suerte y no te crashe√≥, lo que ocurre al tirar un objeto, hacer alt+tab, abrir el men√∫ de armas o simplemente al azar.

A nadie le sorprende que Running With Scissors acabe convirtiendo a Postal III en motivo de burlas, este juego fue producido por Akella y Trashmasters en medio de un conflicto legal, una crisis internacional y un desarrollo catastr√≥fico que fue saltando entre varios equipos inexpertos y mal pagados. Tengo en mi blog personal mismo un art√≠culo explicando toda la cat√°strofe que fue el desarrollo de Postal III, [url=https://valinypse.wordpress.com/2021/07/13/postal-3-desastre/]ac√° un enlace para los interesados[/url].

Hoy por hoy, el equipo de Running With Scissors recomienda a los usuarios en los foros de Steam no adquirir Postal III, estren√≥ una edici√≥n llamada "Every Postal but that one" que no inclu√≠a a este juego, publicaron una edici√≥n de vig√©simo aniversario del primer juego que inclu√≠a una key de Postal III bajo una advertencia que dictaba "WARNING: POSTAL 3 SUCKS, INSTALL AT YOUR OWN RISK", hicieron un directo jug√°ndolo en YouTube llamado "MikeJ and Civvie11 Stream AIDS for your Steam Account‚Ä¶ or POSTAL III‚Äú y su sitio web te tira un Rickroll en caso de clickear en "Postal III".

[b]¬øEn conclusi√≥n?[/b] Encuentro po√©tico que una franquicia caracterizada por el caos y el desastre cuente con un juego tan ca√≥tico y desastrozo que hasta a sus propietarios les de verg√ºenza.
column9:
[h1]Analytical Comment: "Postal III"[/h1]

This game is a stellar disaster; it was developed by another company, disappeared, and reappeared on Steam. In 2020, its source code was leaked along with that of Team Fortress 2 and Half-Life 2: Episode 2, causing a whole commotion regarding the security of TF2's servers.

It offers a very different gameplay dynamic, now fragmented into missions as opposed to the open world of its predecessor, which isn't bad per se and, in fact, is reinforced by the moral rating system that allows us to unlock different missions. In its favor, I have to say that Postal III perfectly captures the sense of humor that Running With Scissors showcased in Postal II.

And that's all the good things that can be said about it; Everything else is a series of barely planned scenarios for the firefights that take place there, with useless cover, enemies whose shots pass through walls, bosses that require too much precision to run at such a low frame rate, music so incohesive it seems to have come from different soundtracks, a horrible weapon selection menu (which ends up being a nightmare if you try to open it during a firefight), and scenarios that lack any connection.

And performance isn't the only technical problem; running consumes a stamina bar that sometimes bugs and stops loading for the rest of the mission, NPCs run in random directions during a firefight and stand in front of you, causing you to shoot them and lose reputation points, and that's when they're not repeating the same two or three dialogues, the sound effects are the default ones from the Source engine, the camera is incomprehensible when sprinting, enemies sometimes don't react when attacked and tend to spawn in front of the player.

And all of this if you're lucky and it doesn't crash, which happens when you throw an item, alt-tab, open the weapons menu, or just randomly.

It's no surprise that Running With Scissors ended up making Postal III a source of ridicule. This game was produced by Akella and Trashmasters amid a legal dispute, an international crisis, and a catastrophic development process that bounced between several inexperienced and underpaid teams. I have an article on my personal blog explaining the entire development disaster of Postal III. [url=https://valinypse.wordpress.com/2021/07/13/postal-3-desastre/]here's a link for those interested[/url].

As of today, the Running With Scissors team is recommending users on the Steam forums not to purchase Postal III. They released an edition called "Every Postal but that one" that didn't include the game. They released a 20th anniversary edition of the first game that included a Postal III key under a warning that read "WARNING: POSTAL 3 SUCKS, INSTALL AT YOUR OWN RISK." They've done a YouTube stream of it called "MikeJ and Civvie11 Stream AIDS for your Steam Account‚Ä¶ or POSTAL III," and their website Rickrolls you if you click on "Postal III."

[b]In conclusion?[/b] I find it poetic that a franchise characterized by chaos and disaster has a game so chaotic and disastrous that even its owners are embarrassed.
I thought the widespread hatred for this game was just some kind of joke. But God, how wrong I was. This game is unbearable garbage. Please, gaben, remove it from Steam.

No cleaner, no scrubbers, no mop, no gloves, just my bare hands and water from the toilet.

I finished the game and also played the previous installment. The third installment is playable, but you have to be prepared for incredibly dull gameplay, lame mechanics, and dry jokes from the main character. I can't say I regret spending time with Postal III, but I enjoy torturing myself with these kinds of games :)

However, it doesn't live up to the second installment, which had a fairly open world and freedom to complete tasks. Here, we have single maps that only pretend to be an open world, while the gameplay is very linear.

column9:
[i][h1]The essence of fun[/h1] [/i] I have to admit, I relatively enjoyed Postal 2, even if let's face it: it wasn't exactly high-flying. But then again, I was certainly young and a bit of an idiot, and there was something quite enjoyable about the debauchery of gratuitous violence.

Not only is this not a particularly messed-up game. Even though it dates back to 2012 on the Source engine (Half Life 2 / CS), we could already expect much better than something that looks more like an unfinished mod than anything else.

The introduction is pathetic and already makes you want to throw yourself out the window. The first mission follows the same path, and I didn't have the courage to finish the second, where I had to pick up cats while Chinese mariachis attacked me in endless waves until the required number of cats was reached. Except that to catch them, you need a consumable item, which I have no idea where to find.

The weapons aren't very fun, the gameplay isn't up to scratch (typically the gasoline spray that doesn't work well)...

[b]In short, Uwe Boll is often mentioned in the game's loading screens, which is understandable. Honestly, when you're that bad, you should change careers. [/b]

[b][i]More criticism? ->[url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/39925920] It's here ;)[/url][/i][/b]

column9: Honestly bad

An acquired taste, a good time-killer. The older games were better, but this one is so-so.
- Not a first-person perspective, which is unfortunate.
- Lags.
- Crashes.
- Achievements don't unlock right away, you have to do everything 100 times.

+ Good time-killer.
+ Good OST, soundtracks.
+ Fun to play.
+ The game can be completed in 1-2 hours (or even less if you speedrun it).

It's sad that this part of the game has such negative reviews.

The dictionary doesn't have a word to describe how much boring this game is. Since I already got some achievements, I'll torture myself playing this until I get the rest of them. column8: P√âSSIMO

Why does RWS try to distance themselves so much from this project when they themselves are why it exists in the first place? If you didn't like its direction, you easily could've told them to change it. You also were you know.... the devs of Postal 2, so why the fuck would you even outsource development of a sequel to a random Russian developer? 

This is a company that has absolutely no self awareness. They blame everyone else for their own mistakes. They got lucky with Postal 2 being so great, because Apocalypse Weekend and Paradise Lost are TERRIBLE. These guys have absolutely no clue as to why the original Postal 2 is so lauded and loved by people. It's extremely evident with how Postal 4 turned out as well.

These guys are literal scam artists and don't deserve any form of respect in this industry, simply for being as shady as every other publisher at the tip top. Yet these guys are at the lowest rung of indie that exists. It's insane.

column8:
This game should not even be allowed to be sold.  The contractors screwed up the game and didn't even finish it, by Running With Scissors' own admission, and they don't even consider it a part of the series.  They don't even consider it a game worth playing, and are trying to erase it from history.

Seriously, go to their website and click "Postal 3" under games.

https://runningwithscissors.com/

It's a link to a RickRoll.  I remember them being so embarrassed that this game exists, so why is it being sold still?

Look at their "Our Games" page:

https://runningwithscissors.com/product-category/our-games/

It's not even listed.  It used to be with a big X through it and a giant disclaimer of how awful and stupid the game was.

"RWS has decided to STOP selling POSTAL III from our store.  We believe it‚Äôs in the best interest of the Postal Community."

I decided to write this review during the "Open World" sale Steam had in May 2021.  This game is not open world, either.

column8:
This game could have been good but the devs fucked it up. Its worth noting that Running with Scissors had nothing to do with this and theres even a post in the Postal 2 discussions made by a dev saying not to buy this game. I wish I had seen that when I bought it all the way back in 2013. I've played 6 hours of it but I have never gotten passed the first section with the china men and cat thing (as seen in the 2nd and 3rd screenshots). The only thing I like about this game are the weapons and the fact that its on the Source engine. Other than that it just seems like a Postal ripoff thats realllllyyyy trying to be as edgy as it can while just making cringey jokes that fall flat on their face every time. Seriously dont buy this, its one of my most regretful purchases on steam and honestly even Postal 4 in the very very very early state that its in is already better than this.

2/10

column8:
Get the Postal 3 Improvement Mod, the Karma Fix and Gore Mod and this becomes a pretty decent game.

I got this out of morbid curiosity and I can't recommend it to fans of the Postal series, but if you treat it as a wall-mart knock-off of a GTA game you can still have some fun with it.

When it works, you are given a pretty fun arsenal to waste anyone in your way through a branching campaign that can keep you moderately entertained for around 5 hours per path. The game also looks good for a source engine game. Not spectacular, good. The AI, friendly or otherwise, is utter dogs**ht which can lead to hilarity or frustration, depending on your luck. 

The performance, however, seems to be the most inconsistent across computers. Mine generally runs it well bar some crashes on the final level or in free roam (mostly related to throwables). Feels more like a 5$ bargain bin title to me, though. Whether the 12$ price tag is worth it is up to you.

The game overhated in my opinion. It's not worthy of the Postal title but even without the recommended fan upgrades it's hardly the worst game ever. Hell, it's not even the worst game of 2011.
column9:
Get the Postal 3 Improvement Mod, the Karma Fix and Gore Mod and this becomes a pretty decent game.

I got this out of morbid curiosity and I can't recommend it to fans of the Postal series, but if you treat it as a wall-mart knock-off of a GTA game you can still have some fun with it.

When it works, you are given a pretty fun arsenal to waste anyone in your way through a branching campaign that can keep you moderately entertained for around 5 hours per path. The game also looks good for a source engine game. Not spectacular, good. The AI, friendly or otherwise, is utter dogs**ht which can lead to hilarity or frustration, depending on your luck. 

The performance, however, seems to be the most inconsistent across computers. Mine generally runs it well bar some crashes on the final level or in free roam (mostly related to throwables). Feels more like a 5$ bargain bin title to me, though. Whether the 12$ price tag is worth it is up to you.

The game overhated in my opinion. It's not worthy of the Postal title but even without the recommended fan upgrades it's hardly the worst game ever. Hell, it's not even the worst game of 2011.

The game will run fine. Buy all games only on sale, otherwise you'll regret wasting your money and time.

Tips:
1) If you want fewer crashes/stutters, set your graphics settings to minimum. This will eliminate bugs in the background scenes. However, it will still crash occasionally. The developers haven't paid attention to the game, so this is the most you can do.
2) DON'T SAVE TOO OFTEN! Otherwise, it crashes immediately upon loading.

column8: P3 has always been a strange postal game as its still very much a postal game as in comedy, story, cool weapons and being stupid. It was (still is but not as much) broken and it used to be barely playable. However the new update makes the game run well and crash way less. In fact after playing through the game twice ive only had 8 crashes total compared to the old version where you'd crash every minute. The game is actually fun at times and dose feel like a postal game and it also has an amazing soundtrack. I wish postal 3 didnt get abandoned because the game isnt really that bad it just needs a bit of fixing. At the state the game is in now its comparable to p4 as they're both unfinished and bad at points but can be really fun at other points

I completed the game in 4 hours. I didn't skip anything, but I also didn't find anything. It's a 50/50 game. I didn't like the IS and weapons.
The IS is the dumbest one here. During the missions with the 40-year-old slave, he was afraid of every shot. After a shot, he ran away and sat there for 4 minutes.
There are very few weapons here, I would like more.
But the localization is also terrible. When I was riding a scooter, he didn't say anything incomprehensible, like static.
AND THE BIGGEST MINUS IS THERE'S NO OPEN WORLD.
Of the pros, I don't know what to say. There's meat, yes, there are some funny moments.
I don't know what else to say.

column8:
I will be blatantly honest, POSTAL III is a disaster, from it being in fully third person to the game mechanics that make no sense. The crosshair isn‚Äôt useful at all, you need to frantically move your mouse to actually attempt to shoot the target, the story makes no sense, and theres no actual challenge, this is *not* a POSTAL game, this is some cheap knock-off. It just doesn‚Äôt feel the same without the Monday to Friday tasks, I will admit, I can say it was a little fun at some parts, but over all this game was a trainwreck, the constant lag to the very rare crashes (on my device at least) - This game has only crashed once in 30+ hours, surprisingly, I do like some parts of the game, such as the bad path and the good path, that was unique. But I can see why RWS would abandon this game, it‚Äôs not the POSTAL they created, Akella really screwed them over.

I do like Corey Cruise as the POSTAL Dude, though, I really only played the game to keep hearing his voice (no h–æmo). 

But yeah, I‚Äôll recommend this game, but I‚Äôll warn you now, this isn‚Äôt the POSTAL we all know and love. I have mixed opinions on this game, I love yet hate it, it‚Äôs a trainwreck yet a blessing, if you like constant lag and occasional crashes, go for it! But it may leave a bad taste in your mouth, don‚Äôt say I didn‚Äôt warn you, and don‚Äôt let this be your first impression of POSTAL, play POSTAL 2 first, but if you like isometric shooters, (that have nothing to actually do with the lore from POSTAL 2 to POSTAL 4) I‚Äôll say REDUX or the original from 1997

This isn't Postal 1997
This isn't Postal 2
This isn't Paradise Lost
This isn't Postal Redux
THIS IS POSTAL 3
I don't regret anything.

Postal 3 is a weird game, let's start with that.
Technically, it's just awful, but once you tinker with it, get used to it, and accept the game for what it is, believe me, you'll have a ton of fun.
Postal 3 also has one very annoying flaw. It's the "karma meter."
Basically, by killing people, you ruin your karma meter, so to speak, and it's not that simple.
In Postal 3, we'll often have to choose which side to side with and how to complete missions.
The thing is, with a completely red karma meter, we won't be able to access the rest of the game's missions or the good ending.
This is the game's biggest flaw, which, by the way, can be ignored; it's entirely possible to complete the game peacefully without killing anyone. The only question is, is this the same Postal?
In any case, the rest of the game is simply amazing, no matter how much they trash it, there's a ton of good stuff in it.
I was glad to replay it on the Steam version.

Oh man, this game is incompetent. I cannot help but be somewhat fascinated though, maybe it's the uniquely troubled development or how R.W.S. disowned this game or seeing the source engine at it's most unpolished. I sometimes find myself reinstalling just so I can remember what went wrong. Corey Cruise's performance as the dude is probably the best part, I'm glad they brought him back in later titles because he does do a good job.

Kudos to R.W.S though for patching out the dated ActControl DRM and attempting to allow the game to run on modern machines.

column8:
Postal 3 cambi√≥ totalmente la formula. 
Al juego lamentablemente le he visto solamente una cosa buena.
Esa cosa es el humor que maneja el juego y nuestro personaje. Tendremos grupos con sus estereotipos, como por ejemplo los frikis, las mujeres pol√≠ticamente correctas, chinos que comen gatos, √°rabes, √°rabes vestidos de mexicanos, comunistas, hasta aparece Chavez. Tambi√©n habr√° cosas bizarras, como los monos y gatos locos, nuestro perro que ataca a los huevos de las personas, √°rabes con sombreros de mexicano tratando de entrar a EEUU, etc. Postal Dude tambi√©n tira frases como en sus anteriores juegos, mi favorita es "le echo la culpa a los videojuegos" la cual usa luego de cagar a tiros a una persona. 

Ahora pasar√© a las cosas malas; para comenzar quiero decir que mataron totalmente la libre jugabilidad, la historia del juego es completamente lineal, sin embargo tendremos que en ciertos momentos elegir caminos (yo solo hice uno de ellos, el de ser polic√≠a), al lado del Postal 2 ese tipo de libertad es un chiste. 
El sistema de apuntado es muy malo, las balas no corresponden con la mira; la c√°mara es sobre el hombro, por lo tanto apuntaremos al estilo GTA, pero las balas van para cualquier lado, tendremos que tener una mejor punter√≠a que en Counter Strike y un poco de suerte para que las balas vayan hac√≠a donde vos queres. Hay ciertos momentos donde la punter√≠a es algo critico y terminas disparandole a la persona equivocada por culpa del sistema de apuntado.
La optimizaci√≥n tambi√©n es algo que no se logr√≥ para nada, el juego est√° hecho con el Source, sin embargo tuve unos importantes bajones de FPS.
El juego patin√≥ mucho, no solo no logr√≥ la escencia del Postal 2, sino que tambi√©n tuvo errores t√©cnicos.
column9:
Postal 3 completely changed the formula.
Unfortunately, I've only seen one good thing about the game.
That good thing is the humor that the game and our character use. We'll have groups with their stereotypes, such as geeks, politically correct women, Chinese people who eat cats, Arabs, Arabs dressed as Mexicans, communists, and even Chavez. There will also be bizarre things, like crazy monkeys and cats, our dog who attacks people's balls, Arabs wearing Mexican hats trying to enter the US, etc. Postal Dude also throws out phrases like in their previous games; my favorite is "I blame it on video games," which he uses after shooting someone.

Now, I'll move on to the bad things. To start, I want to say that they completely killed the free playability. The game's story is completely linear, however, we will have to choose paths at certain points (I only played one of them, being a police officer). Compared to Postal 2, that kind of freedom is a joke.
The aiming system is very poor; the bullets don't match the aiming target; the camera is over the shoulder, so we'll aim GTA-style, but the bullets go all over the place. We'll need better aim than in Counter-Strike and a little luck to get the bullets to go where we want. There are certain moments where aiming is critical, and you end up shooting the wrong person because of the aiming system.
Optimization is also something that wasn't achieved at all; the game is made with Source, however, I experienced significant FPS drops.
The game slipped a lot; not only did it not achieve the essence of Postal 2, but it also had technical errors.

column9:
I thought people were exaggerating; I thought it couldn't be as bad as they said. I gave it a chance... but I regretted it! It's terrible, it's crap, it's unplayable, it's irritating! And worst of all, it seems like it was made on purpose to be this way!!!!
The camera is weird, I can't explain it, but the aiming is terrible, and the game keeps crashing... My PC runs last year's game without any problems, and this one is almost 10 years old!!! To top it off, some of the trophies are broken.
The idiotic humor in Postal 2 is also present in this one, but it's worse. In Postal 2, it's a bad thing that's actually good, but in this one, it's terrible and unfunny... Okay, there are some funny parts, but it's not enough... The few good things in this game don't change the pile of shit that is everything else.
The game starts, and five seconds later, a stupid cutscene, you walk another second, another cutscene... If the game still made jokes about this, it would be hilarious, but it doesn't! The cutscenes are incredibly annoying and the humor is so unfunny it makes you want to cry it's so bad!!!
And it seems like the game throws you completely random missions, like discarded ideas thrown together haphazardly.
It might even be more playable with a mod that changes the camera and aim, but I can't be bothered to fix things that should be fixed with an update from the developers.

Fucking game... and I'm going to torture myself playing it again just to try to get the rest of the shitty trophies because I'm a loser!!

column9:
I'd like to write at least something in support of this game.
I started my journey with Postal 2. I absolutely loved it. I'd heard a lot of terrible things about the third game (even from the developers themselves). Everyone unanimously said the game was terrible. And at some point, I became interested in experiencing this "horror" for myself :)
I've completed the game twice (two paths), and you might think I'm a pervert, but I liked this part. The game wasn't that bad. I even enjoyed it, and it lifted my spirits.

Yes, it's not Postal 2 with its open world and sandbox gameplay. Yes, it has a lot of bugs (for example, frequent crashes when using a grenade). Postal 3's technical side is weak. The weapons don't always hit where they're supposed to. The intended actions don't always work. The weapon selection is extremely inconvenient (you have to rack your brain trying to figure out which button to assign to which for ease of use). And despite all the variety, unfortunately, there's little point in using different types of weapons, as the game can crash, or you simply can't use certain weapons due to their curvature. So, personally, I always carried only firearms (pistol, M16, machine gun).

Well, that's about the downsides. Now I'd like to elaborate on what I liked.

Unlike the second game, this one has a more coherent plot, in the style of a Uwe Boll film. The absurd events that befall the Dude, the intensity of the madness and depravity that unfolds in Catharsis, and the raising of still-relevant social issues. All of this together satirizes a corrupt society. Yes, the cutscenes aren't the best quality (especially the film effect gets tiresome towards the end), and the humor can be a bit flat (reminds me of school humor), but overall, it all made me smile, and sometimes even laugh out loud. :D The voice acting for Bombay Courage is a huge plus for Russian users. This guy can really add flavor to the characters.
The plot may seem vague (I don't deny that they probably didn't put much thought into it), but the end result is something on the level of Guy Ritchie, where at first you don't understand what's going on, but by the end, everything makes sense and comes together to form a coherent picture. In this case, it's a rather absurd picture, but that makes it funnier.

I'd like to point out the rather pleasing graphics. Excellent for 2011. I especially appreciated the feel of the gunfire. The recoil, the powerful sounds (yes, classic Source sounds, but presented in a unique way). How can you shoot away at someone with just one shot? Head, body parts. You really feel like you're shooting something powerful.

Bottom Line.
The game is indeed quite crude technically and a bit poorly executed in terms of presentation. But having seen worse games, I think Postal 3 is quite solid, considering its social satire and shootouts. Yes, it's not Postal 2, but I'd like to include this installment in the overall Postal canon.
I can't recommend this game to many, but if you liked Uwe Boll's film, I think you'll appreciate this one. ;)

[h1][b]DUDE, WHAT'S GOING ON?[/b][/h1] 
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2342031448
How many times have I heard that [b]Postal 3[/b] is a terrible game? There was so much discontent upon release and so many negative reviews. Even now, looking at the Steam ratings is horrifying.[/b] The game was handed over to Russian developers at the end of the Russian gaming industry, and you don't need a prophet to understand how dark it turned out. However, having bought it for next to nothing and completed it in four hours, I can say it's not that terrible; it's playable, even if it's terribly unpleasant in places. There are plenty of projects of worse quality, but this one is perfectly suitable for a quick introduction, just right for those who missed it. https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2342031384
The signature humor and trash are still there, but the technical work is particularly poor. It lags, crashes, the animations are incredibly clunky, there are a million bugs and all the ensuing consequences. From the very first splash screen, the developers' lack of experience is evident in almost every detail. Even though [b]source[/b] was chosen as the engine, how could they have ruined it like that (the number of bugs) is one big question. On the other hand, we got quite good graphics with nice textures and decent levels. Even after all these years, it doesn't look bad. The camera has moved behind the same [i]Dude[/i] and, in my opinion, it's even better. The game, however, has lost its open world. More precisely, during missions, you can still run around, shoot everyone, and commit genocide, but the accessible areas are very small, and most of the action takes place according to the story. I wasn't a big fan of running around the second game's large map searching for things, but here you really feel like you're in a cage. You're now led by the hand from mission to mission and asked to do disgusting things. Throwing napkins after masturbating, stealing Segways, protecting [i]Uwe Boll[/i] from haters, etc. The objectives are decent, and the cutscenes are sometimes funny, but everything boils down to monotony. This has greatly reduced the variety; there aren't many weapons or ways to torment yourself, and the length is laughable even by today's standards. True, all the key features are still there, like the cat as a muffler or the ability to douse someone with gasoline and set them on fire. You can still pee here, right? How many games have that? https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2342031297
[i]Denis "Kurazh-Bambey"[/i] was invited to do the Russian voiceover. You'll definitely like it if you like him, but the dialogue is monotonous, the sound is sometimes hoarse, and even this big plus for Russian players was ruined. The missions are decent, but they're not particularly exciting. Kill this, kill that, and it's often boring. Perhaps that kind of gameplay is simply over; running around and shooting at everyone isn't as satisfying anymore. Perhaps we, like the gaming industry, have matured. Despite the decent level design, the game is best played straight through and forgotten. The plot feels like it's squeezing out a chocolate bar, but it still manages to make you smile at times. If the ending had been more realistic and not complete nonsense, the overall impression might have been better. There's no story, no great dialogue, nothing here, as the game is more like a fan-made fanfic. It's not terrible, by any means; there are plenty of projects that are far worse, but you shouldn't look for anything truly amazing here. If you have a free evening and want to check out a major failure from ten years ago, it's fine.

[h1][b]RATING 3 - CRAP![/b][/h1]

column8:
As a player who enjoyed POSTAL 2, and owns POSTAL 4 early access, I feel confident in saying that this game is not at all what the fanbase wanted between these two games. It's not outright trash, as some say, but it's far from a good game. I played for 30 minutes, and ten were trying to figure out the controls, fifteen were gameplay, and the last five were watching shitty AI and questioning why I was still playing. 

I'm not calling this game bad, I'm saying it doesn't sit right as a POSTAL game to me. The gameplay, style, and UI are vastly different from my other two POSTAL games, and I dislike this, but I can see where other types of players may enjoy this game more than I did. It still has the wacky writing expected from RWS, but given the fact that they wrote, and partially produced, this game, and RWS still doesn't see a dime for its sales, I returned it, and I definitely did not forcibly grant myself all the achievements once I did so. :)

I won't be rating this, simply due to the fact that I'm upset that this game was destined for much better than what it got, and I'll likely start ranting about it's *complicated* development cycle, and how you'd be better off burning your money than buying this. If I did rate it, I doubt it would be above a 65, in my opinion. TL/DR: It's not outright garbage, but be aware of what you're buying.

column9:
‚Ç¨2.50 is the price I paid for Postal 3, and I can modestly say that's the most it's worth.

But! I'll be honest, to some extent, I found some aspects partially engaging and even captivating. For a franchise like Postal, the RPG element of good/bad progression with nonlinearity is an unexpected and clever move. Everything from the first to the last mission is a joke, and the protagonist's character is a little overly comical compared to the good old second game; on the other hand, Courage-Bombay is funny. It's difficult to talk about the gameplay, however, because it's tragic and there's nothing you can do about it: whether it's a battle with the military or anyone else, it's banal clickbait with painful developer flaws.

However, if the people who created this project had polished it up and completed it in a more adequate and professional manner, perhaps this game could have been a decent trash game, but as it stands, it's trash.

reVote 4/10

column8:
Is it as good as Postal 2? No
Does it have a few annoying bugs? Yes
Is it fun though? You bet!

Much like how Postal 2 was a very different beast to the original Postal; Postal 3 feels like a new game compared to Postal 2. The morality (if you can call anything you do in this game 'moral') system is quite jarring at first, but once you realise it gives you two different stories to play through, it ends up being quite fun.

Although not the best game in the world, Postal 3 is a fun romp.

Also, it worked well on Linux which is also a plus!

A waste of time and money

Arguably Trashmasters' finest creation. Andrey Belkin and his team outdid themselves and surpassed their previous blockbusters, "Shadowboxing" and "Swordsman." The deaths of Akella's other projects, "The Adventures of Captain Blood" and "Axley Rage," were certainly worth the release of this game. However, after the release of Postal III, Akella itself followed suit, and Belkin's worst nightmare‚Äîlosing his job after the release‚Äîcame true. In such a short time, the developers managed to release only two patches, and that was far from enough‚Äîthe game still crashes frequently, especially when throwing grenades, molotov cocktails, grappling hooks, and other junk. However, the skilled modders at WhackJob Interactive recently announced that they've managed to fix almost all of these bugs and glitches, so we're looking forward to their Catharsis Reborn mod, and perhaps a fix for vanilla itself.

column9: Game = feces

Bugs: some sounds were distorted, including speech; I couldn't complete the level with an escort until I realized I had to walk near the mayor, otherwise the script would break and I'd run into a wall; scripts break missions ‚Äì doors won't open, walls are invisible, the game crashes if the right NPC isn't in the right place; the counter doesn't work in some missions; the rhino runs up the stairs and often gets stuck in textures; constant crashes ‚Äì I crashed five times during the final boss fight.
You can't adjust the volume of sounds, voices, and video separately ‚Äì everything is in one slider. There's only one machine gun shot sound. The soundtrack is repetitive and annoying in missions that last much longer than the soundtrack itself.
Broken crosshair. Half the time, it shoots in the wrong direction, no matter what the camera angle.
A meager and useless arsenal. The weapons either don't hit hard, run out of ammunition, or are awkward to use. You spend the entire game running around with a machine gun or a stun gun.
There's no open world, just like in the Paradise Lost expansion.
Terribly bad, crap, my rating is 4 out of 10.

column8: POSTAL Paradise Lost, POSTAL Redux, POSTAL 4: No Regets... As they say Akella doesn't seem so bad anymore.
column9: POSTAL Paradise Lost, POSTAL Redux, POSTAL 4: No Regets... As they say Akella doesn't seem so bad anymore.

It's so funny to see how people trash Postal 3 and fail to notice that the fourth game is worse.

No humor, no satire, no plot, no optimization:
That's how you can describe Postal 4.

In the third game, the developers knew what they were doing, which is why I still love it.

Decent dismemberment, a good plot, interesting characters, a godlike soundtrack, and Courage Bombay's awesome voice acting in the spirit of old MTV movies.

Of course, there are some downsides, like crashes and dumb AI, but I've played through the game several times and still nothing.

And none of that is present in Postal 4.
What the developers have been doing all these three years, I don't know.
They themselves trashed the third game, and in the end, it turned out to be much better than the fourth.
Ironic.

If you have to choose between 3 and 4, choose 3.
Although I don't give a damn what you play, do whatever you want.
Well, I'm looking forward to Brain Damaged, from the new developers; I think they won't let me down.

column8:
The tutorial has boring, almost midi, sounding music that has 4 bars to it before it repeats the same 4 notes again. The rest of the music in the game isnt that great. Heres a level breakdown.

Mission 0 - Tutorial across a bridge - simple but the constant cutaways ruin the level and pacing.
Mission 1 - Collect tissues off the floor of a porn shop, use them on soccer moms - The aim is horrible and they do not fly.
Mission 2 - Collect 15 cats infected with HIV - Your given catnip and a small city block to explore this. Eventually being chased by owners of a chinese restaurant because they feel your encroaching on their territory.
Mission 3 - Body guard duty - Your told not to kill people but you need to in order to advance the story. Kill 15 soccer moms while cops are shooting at you then kill 10 cops - Waste of time.
Mission 4 - Kill cops or kill ectotologists - I killed the cops. Eventually cops turn into swat and a helicopter spawns. The hitbox for the helicopter or the aim reticle is off. I don't know which. Either way its a striaght fight of find the weak spot, shoot, hide to regen health, pop out to empty 2 clips, repeat. 
Mission 5 - Ectologists - Vacuum apples off of a tree for about 5 minutes then get assaulted by al qaeda. Kill 20 of them, accidently kill 1 ectologist, have to kill 19 more.
Mission 6 - kill 20 chinese restaurant workers.
Mission 7 - Repo 7 segways - Kill the people on them, drive them back. The longest part is running there and back.
Mission 8 - Escort a male sex slave out of city hall. Kill the paparazzi. The cinematics around this mission are longer then the mission.
Mission 9 - Open 30 (maybe 25?) cages, in groups of 3. Then run and kill a boss. Youll spend more time running to the boss down hallways then killing it.
Mission 10 - repeat map of 7, kill the other segway people (gay cowboys), then drive to the mall.
Mission 11 - Run through the mall and drop toys off. Thats it. Nothing special.
Mission 12 - Find the pharmacy, throw footballs over the fence, kill a few people - this took a while because the cutscene makes the footballs look like they are by the fence. They are not.
Mission 13 - Escort mission. Move to far away and fail the mission. Also you can accidently headshot the person. And then fail.
Mission 14 - boss fight - Decent challenge - The boss has grenades and everyone in the mall on his side. - The music sucks
Mission 15 - Vacuum poop, kill cops or ectologists, or both, then fight a bull. You need to get it to ram things and you cant run.
Mission 16 - The music sucks. It starts playing the second you walk close to the cave even without anyone around to kill. Its the first level with any decent gameplay length to it.
Mission 17 - I finished this one without firing a shot. All I had to do was run for the exit/

My play time comes from leaving the game on when I had company and again when I took a nap. The game is short and not fun. Dont get it.

Either way its a striaght fight of find the weak spot, shoot, hide to regen health, pop out to empty 2 clips, repeat. 
Mission 5 - Ectologists - Vacuum apples off of a tree for about 5 minutes then get assaulted by al qaeda. Kill 20 of them, accidently kill 1 ectologist, have to kill 19 more.
Mission 6 - kill 20 chinese restaurant workers.
Mission 7 - Repo 7 segways - Kill the people on them, drive them back. The longest part is running there and back.
Mission 8 - Escort a male sex slave out of city hall. Kill the paparazzi. The cinematics around this mission are longer then the mission.
Mission 9 - Open 30 (maybe 25?) cages, in groups of 3. Then run and kill a boss. Youll spend more time running to the boss down hallways then killing it.
Mission 10 - repeat map of 7, kill the other segway people (gay cowboys), then drive to the mall.
Mission 11 - Run through the mall and drop toys off. Thats it. Nothing special.
Mission 12 - Find the pharmacy, throw footballs over the fence, kill a few people - this took a while because the cutscene makes the footballs look like they are by the fence. They are not.
Mission 13 - Escort mission. Move to far away and fail the mission. Also you can accidently headshot the person. And then fail.
Mission 14 - boss fight - Decent challenge - The boss has grenades and everyone in the mall on his side. - The music sucks
Mission 15 - Vacuum poop, kill cops or ectologists, or both, then fight a bull. You need to get it to ram things and you cant run.
Mission 16 - The music sucks. It starts playing the second you walk close to the cave even without anyone around to kill. Its the first level with any decent gameplay length to it.
Mission 17 - I finished this one without firing a shot. All I had to do was run for the exit/

My play time comes from leaving the game on when I had company and again when I took a nap. The game is short and not fun. Dont get it.

ƒ∞lk oyun izometrik bakƒ±≈ü a√ßƒ±sƒ±, ikinci oyun FPS, √º√ß√ºnc√º oyun ise TPS olarak kar≈üƒ±mƒ±za √ßƒ±kmakta. [b] M√úZƒ∞KLER VE SES [/b]

M√ºziklerin berbat olmasƒ±nƒ±n yanƒ± sƒ±ra bir de olur olmadƒ±k yerde √ßalmalarƒ± √ßok k√∂t√º bir se√ßim olmu≈ü. Hi√ßbiri akƒ±lda kalmƒ±yor aksine kulak tƒ±rmalƒ±yor. Karakter seslendirmeleri Postal Dude'un ve birka√ß ana karakterin dƒ±≈üƒ±nda √ßok k√∂t√º.

column8:
So I originally bought this game as a joke (and also my impulsive need to own every Postal game). Honestly, I had a fun time with it. The soundtrack kicks ass, I found the gameplay decently fun albeit a tad repetitive and I will admit it got a few chuckles from me here and there.

It definitely has its problems. It‚Äôs extremely linear, you can‚Äôt free roam between missions (only after beating the game), it can crash seemingly at random (I've experienced numerous crashes due to throwing objects, though it doesn't happen too often) and I'm fairly certain the aiming is slightly off (it‚Äôs not hard to adjust to it though).

Personally, I think ¬£8.99 is a bit much, but if you ever see it on sale, and you're a fan of the other Postal games, I don‚Äôt really see the harm in giving it a try

column8:
What's not to like about this game?! It's freakin' AWESOME!!

Everything I love and hate about Postal 2 is still here and it's a completely new and streamlined experience. 

It looks good, it sounds good and it just as clunky, broken and weird as Postal 2 with the exception it's on rails and the ride is goood! The intro is twisted, nice and funny, first 28 minutes is spot on with the wisecracking wacky adventure and sloppy combat and with the third person view it's a lot messier. All good!!

Btw...

This being that clunky Source Engine that is literally drowning in misguided convars needs a little bit of smothering help to keep that smooth fps up:

In the folder: steamapps / common / Postal III / p3 / cfg / 

Edit these two lines in autoexec.cfg and set them to:

g_ragdoll_maxcount 8
g_ragdoll_important_maxcount 8

column8:
[h1] A celebration of trash at a price that's well within reasonable. [/h1]

So I have played a little Postal 2 after it was introduced to me via Civvie11. Then I started to really dig the game. Then Postal 4 happened and that was all well and good. 

Then came the discussion of Postal 3. All the negative reviews, all the YouTube commentary and satire just increase my curiosity and desire to reach a single conclusion;

" How bad can it possibly be? " 

The short answer is, " Not that bad at all "

Postal 3's biggest flaw is that it's labeled a Postal game. Understandable so considering RWS owns the Postal property, Madcow MikeJ voiced a character, Desi had a voice gig in it as well and, obviously, it's called Postal 3. However, this is NOT a postal game by any stretch of the imagination. 

Postal 3 is a buggy circus. A carnival of glitches and a celebration of trash that no one wanted but needs to experience at least once in their life. It's for those who laugh at Z movies for how bad it really is. It's for those of us who have an appreciate for trash entertainment. * Not to be confused with sleazy entertainment, which this game does have it's own sleazy moments *

GAMEPLAY: 

It's lame, but that's where its charm is. You don't buy a Postal game for outstanding game play. You're here simply to kill random people, pee on everything, blow it up, and then move on with your life. It's a sigh of relief for the working mans spirit. It's the opportunity to lash out without any penalty of law or social unrest. The ability to choose a path

 * Which was one of the biggest beefs Postal fans had with the game. One of about a million, that is * 

gives the player a chance to have some re-playability with this. Running errands, doing jobs, never getting paid and always finding yourself with the short end of the stick is the name of this game. Oh, and you get to kill from time to time when you're not leaning on your taser or pepper spray. Or you can just " Postal " and run wild on the bad path. The choice is up to you. I will say, the game play is pretty short. I did a run in 6 hours. 

I did like the variety of weaponry at your disposal. A few are useless, a few are novelty items and a few are your bread and butter * We can thank DOOM for that *

I've heard complaints about the aiming in this game, and that does stand true. The aim is off slightly but I, personally, had no issues popping off head shots in the game with an M16 or the pistol. 

STORY: 

Did you really expect one to begin with? What'd Carmack say about stories in games? Moving on. 

GRAPHICS:

It's decent and some things can look okay. Then again, Postal was never huge on graphics now was it? 

PERFORMANCE: 

This is where I have my biggest pet peeve, because this game isn't exactly what I'd consider " Demanding ", but it does love to act like it is. Stutters, frame rate drops, and enough crashes to send any insurance agent into a spiral of madness. 

Is it still playable? YES - It only crashed on me 4 times in a single play through. 

FINAL THOUGHTS:

As I said previously, this game's BIGGEST flaw is that it's labeled a Postal game. This is NOT a postal game. This is a Wal-Mart roll back bargain bin European rip off of a Postal game. This game is for those of us who enjoy a train wreck. This is for those of us who are inclined to sit through Plan 9 From Outer Space because of just how horribly bad it is. This game is trash, but that's its only saving grace.

I don't like the fact that RWS doesn't see a dime from this but what can you do, right? 

Is it fun? Yes
Is it entertaining? Yes
Was it worth the $12+ dollars I spent on it? Yes
Is it re-playable? I'd say so, considering you can choose a Good or Bad path.

They tried to capture the game's atmosphere, but the game itself was poorly executed.
The gameplay is poor, and there are tons of bugs.
The best option is to buy it at an 80-90% discount and see for yourself if it's worth it.

Postal 3 isnt a good game, but it can be fun. Should you buy this game? No.. You shouldnt unless you except a broken and glitchy game. column8: The games controls are awful and a pain to use. You can't switch over to a controller because it won't work and it makes it harder to beat the game. I have played through several levels and can say the game has a good story, but the difficulty of the game is too high due to you having a recharging health bar instead of the items. For a rating I give it 3 stars for the story and the original postal voice actor due to the dump change they did to the health system that makes enemies too hard to fight and the bad controller system. I only recommend for the story not the game play, but fair warning the game is probably going to take you 6 hours due to having to reload several times from being killed and there is no difficulty settings.

column8: do yourself a favor a burn this game to the ground and get yourself a copy of postal 4
column9: do yourself a favor a burn this game to the ground and get yourself a copy of postal 4

It's a shame I went against the train. Well, I read the reviews, didn't I? I bought it anyway, and what did I get? I got what I deserved:

1. No free movement around the world.
2. The camera jerks terribly when you're running.
3. The aiming is poor; you have to raise it higher for accuracy.
4. The voice acting is good, but it's a real ear-splitting experience.

Maybe some people will like it, but after the second game, I want to say out loud: There's no Chuck Haston here, I'm going to Paradise.

Conclusion: I could have lived with all the shortcomings, but alas, I couldn't. Perhaps I'll give it another try in the future.

column9: It's not as good as the 2nd but it's not a bad game. I don't understand why people criticize it so much.

Well then... I SHIT 3 - the world has never seen such crap))
About the cons:
1) Complete optimization.
2) Terrible controls - the vacuum cleaner, machete, and everything else only work when aiming.
3) Third-person view - not a bad solution, but it's just so damn inconvenient.
4) Voice acting - it's a matter of taste, but I don't like Courage Bombay at all, and combined with the creaking and background noise, it feels like I'm sitting on the toilet.
5) The choice of good and evil - yeah, a cool solution, but few people would want that in a trashy game, so I started not to at least use the BADGER-CHAINSAW to avoid eating a couple of passersby.
6) The plot is a bust... the jokes in the second game were much more colorful.
7) What annoyed me the most were the constant crashes. I'd play for an hour or half an hour, then it crashed, waited 5 minutes for everything to restart, and then, as usual, I barely had the nerve to complete all the achievements. Speaking of which...
8) The achievements are crooked - make them as written here, but I actually had something else in mind, and there were three achievement issues that required me to constantly reload my save.

The bottom line is that the series is legendary and very top-notch, but unfortunately, I can't say the same about the third game: 100,500 crashes out of 10 - there's no other way to describe it.

column8:
Five years ago, I gave this game a negative review, simply saying "this game made me consider trying smoking". That was a blatant lie. I have never touched a cigarette in my life. What was true, however, were my feelings regarding Postal 3 at the time. It was clunky, buggy, overall a mess and a stain on Postal's legacy.

I still feel that way. It still absolutely is clunky. It absolutely is buggy. It's absolutely a mess, and it's 100% a stain on the underwear that is Postal's legacy. That said...

...returning to this game half a decade later, I'm finding myself...actually enjoying it? As of writing this, I had just finished the good path and I just started the insane path, and I genuinely, oddly enough, had quite a bit of fun playing it. Not in the sense that it was a good game, more like watching a car crash in slow motion, or watching Jimmy Kimmel keep trying to be funny years past his prime: Poorly executed and kinda sad to see, but you can't pull yourself away.

Postal 3 may not be a good game, and it may be far from what made the franchise great in the first place,  but there's a certain audacity to it that I can't help but respect.








Also I got to blow Ron Jeremy's head off and that was a huge plus in the game's favor.

A Half-Life mod by amateurs would be fine, but at a high price, it's tough.

I'm usually pretty lucky when it comes to bugs in games, but this one I had several crashes or bugs in the current mission on several occasions, and in different missions.

It's a mess, It's a failure and It's what it is..
But, It's not the worst game ever, It's interesting, I mean.. This is what happens when a financial crisis occur and the publisher kick 4 development teams during the development of a game..
It turned into something different from what it was supposed to be, It has bugs and issues, But it's playable, or at least for me..
I can NOT recommend this game due to the selfishness and lack of support the publisher decided.
RWS even reached out to ask for the source code to try and help fix stuff, But they denied it, sadly the game is what it is.
Buy it at your own risk if you do, but i'd recommend a sales price, i got it for 5‚Ç¨.

I had fun playing it, But it's not a game for most people due to the issues you will encounter, and sometimes half arsed game play.

The good:
- Humour, it is so bad that it's good, It's really, really bad, on purpose of course.

- The soundtracks, most of them are good!

- Models, most of the models are well made and make the game postal styled.
Though, While the jiggle physics work fine on "The Dude's" jacket, The female chest jiggles act like strange springs.

- The level design is easy to understand and makes sense due to the linear gameplay.

- The different story path ways, It will also tell you on the level selection at what type of branch you went on.

- Weapons, while most of them I didn't bother to use in combat, They are fun.


The bad:
- Crash issues, expect a few crashes, I didn't have that many.
Don't bother using grenades, or save before using any, because on some levels they crash the game.
There's also some others i heard about, like alt tab crash, I didn't experience that,
But it's probably because i used these start options: -window -noborder

- The AI is dumb, like, really dumb, Also when you have someone follow you, you have to clear ALL enemies for them to follow you.
Save often, because sometimes they are necessary to reach a checkpoint but can get stuck (perhaps i missed an enemy then)

- Doors, I noticed alot of times doors would be stuck closed, so you can't progress, so you should keep different saves at all time after progressing a bit.

- Rocket launcher.. Primary fire explodes the rocket in your face, But secondary fire launches the rocket like it should, Is this intended??

- Clarity, Sometime's it can be unclear of what to do, or how to approach stuff, On one level i was struggling to find a "salad" place to deliver toys..
I noticed later the toys actually sit on your segway in a basket, so you have to actually use the segway and drive to the mall with it..

And now i can't be bothered to write more.
I'll just say, There are so many issues it might not be worth to even considering to buy it..
or buy it, I don't care what you do, It's your choice.

Edit: I could bother writing a little more:
By the way, Since it runs on the source engine, expect source engine surface/hit sounds and some other stuff, but at least the best part of this game is the engine, It makes it feel more solid than it is.

column8:
Muchos ya lo han dicho, pero lo voy a repetir NUNCA COMPRES ESTE JUEGO

Empezamos abriendo el juego, un ordenador de gama media os tardara entre 40 y 60 segundos en mostrar la cinematica inicial para poder empezar.
Le das a nueva partida y te tienes que comer un tutorial donde te ense√±an a andar y lanzar granadas (que necesitas dos de ellas para matar a UN PU√ëETERO ZOMBIE)
Vale, el sufrimiento se ha acabado, piensas, la primera mision es ir con un aspirador recogiendo pa√±uelos en una especia de sex shop con striptease incluido hasta que entran las tipicas madres que se quejan de todo e intentan destrozar la tienda y tu mision es encargarte. Bien, por fin empieza a ser un juego de postal. 
Aqui es cuando tu corazoncito se rompe. Se supone que tienes que usar el aspirador para disparar los pa√±uelos a las madres para que vomiten y se vayan, digo se supone porque APUNTAR ES IMPOSIBLE: hay una mira en el centro que solo funciona a media distancia a un rango muy concreto, si estas mas lejos los disparos se desvian y si estas mas cerca los proyectiles tienen voluntad propia y nunca aciertan. 
Bueno, pues los muelo a palos ¬°¬°¬°¬°ERROR!!!! cada vez que das un golpe el npc se cae al suelo donde si no tienes armas son invulnerables y tienes que esperar a que se levanten y repetir HASTA 15 veces que es lo que cuesta matar un maldito NPC, hasta los ni√±os del skyrim aguantan menos
Al completar la primera mision es donde dije basta la segunda mision es de coger gatos hasta que te atacan los chinos, es en estos gags cuando recuerdas que es un juego de postal, pero no pude seguir.
NI USANDO CHEATS se aguanta esta basura. si no quieres pasarte el juego e ir directamente al sandbox, hay que tocar un archivo config y ni eso lo salva. No hay policia, eres tu dando tortas a la gente hasta que te canses, NO PUEDES SALTAR, para ir a los sitios tienes que dar un rodeo al edificio cuando con un simple salto llegas

HAY UN COMUNICADO OFICIAL DE RUNNING WITH SCISSORS EN SU WEB DONDE PIDEN PERDON Y [b]LO EXPLICAN TODO ENTRE LO QUE RECOMIENDAN NO COMPRAR EL JUEGO[/b]

column8:
Honestly not the worst game I've ever played. The comedy is a bit dated and hasn't aged as well as Postal 2's and it lacks the subtle creepy atmosphere from the previous titles (something I was a big fan of). But once you've played all the other Postal games and you also happen to be a fan of Source Engine games, Postal 3 can be a fun time if you get it for cheap.

Playing with a controller using Steam Input actually makes the game very enjoyable, which is not surprising as it was originally designed for consoles, even though said console ports never actually came out.

Un jeu qui divise, et √ßa peut se comprendre. Je dis bien √ßa peut parce que tous les arguments que j'ai pu lire ne sont pas l√©gitimes.
Je n'ai jamais voulu acheter ce jeu √† cause des "on dit", et √† l'occasion des soldes je me suis dit why not ? Et au final ce jeu n'est pas si mauvais qu'il en a l'air ou qu'on le dit.
Ce n'est pas le 2. Ne le comparez pas au 2 c'est inutile il n'a rien de son gameplay.
En revanche c'est sa suite directe, et quiconque √©coute un minimum l'histoire racont√©e le comprend.
On peut dire que c'est inspir√© de Postal premier du nom, mais en 3D. Il est similaire au premier par rapport au fait que l'histoire est divis√©e en niveaux et l√©g√®rement par rapport √† quelques m√©caniques de son gameplay.
En parlant de gameplay, sur cet opus ce qui est dommage c'est que par moments on nous donne l'impression d'avoir le choix alors que non, pas du tout. C'est qu'un d√©tail mais voil√† c'est bon de le savoir.
Vis √† vis de l'humour, l√† c'est un peu compliqu√© parce qu'il y a bien des sc√®nes dr√¥les, mais ce n'est pas toujours l'humour que l'on connait du postal dude.
Les musiques sont assez bonnes et ne font pas trop mal au cr√¢ne.
Les maps sont semi ouvertes et assez grandes pour un jeu du genre.
Le jeu utilise le moteur source, et √ßa rend plut√¥t bien.
Pour les amoureux de l'univers Postal qui ne chipotent pas et qui en veulent toujours plus, ce jeu pourrait vous int√©resser.
column9:
A game that divides opinion, and that's understandable. I say it's understandable because all the arguments I've read are not legitimate.
I never wanted to buy this game because of what people say, and during the sales, I thought, why not? And in the end, this game isn't as bad as it looks or as people say.
It's not the second game. Don't compare it to the second; it's pointless; it has none of its gameplay.
On the other hand, it's its direct sequel, and anyone who listens to the story at least a little understands that.
You could say it's inspired by the first Postal, but in 3D. It's similar to the first in that the story is divided into levels and slightly in some of its gameplay mechanics.
Speaking of gameplay, what's unfortunate about this game is that at times we're given the impression we have a choice, when in fact we don't. It's just a small detail, but it's good to know.
As for the humor, it's a bit complicated because there are some funny scenes, but it's not always the humor we're used to from the Postal Dude.
The music is pretty good and doesn't make your head hurt too much.
The maps are semi-open and quite large for a game of this genre.
The game uses the Source engine, and it looks pretty good.
For fans of the Postal universe who don't quibble and always want more, this game might interest you.

column8:
Characters‚ÄîBoring
‚ÄîPostal guy is boring; all the characters are dull, forgettable, and not interesting. To this day I cannot remember any memorable characters except Ron Jeremy, Osama Bin Laden, Uwe Boll, and that's it.

Atmosphere‚ÄîLackluster
‚ÄîEnvironments differ for each encounter, but some areas recycle the same map over and over again but with different scripted events. It doesn't feel lively at all; just dull.

Gameplay‚ÄîBelow Average
‚ÄîThe core of any game is being able to play it, and in this category it's awful: the performance and graphics are really bad, aggravating, frustrating, and time consuming. Constant hitches with sound files, random crashing for no reason, the navigation of AI characters (jeez), and has one of the worst aiming mechanics for a rocket launcher that I have ever experienced in a game.
‚ÄîThe developers added multiple endings, pathways, and even a moral compass because THAT'S what we need in a Postal game; the more evil you do, the more evil you become. But that's not all, there's one level where if you let any terrorists across the border your meter starts filling up the evil path, so good luck there.
‚ÄîThere are also too many guns and they are not as fun to use as they should be despite the customization for all of them.
‚ÄîArresting people in the middle of combat is awkward.
‚ÄîSometimes when you want to join a side it's very difficult at first to tell who to shoot if you want to be a good or bad; an indicator would have been nice.
‚ÄîAllies can get stuck in doors or hallways that prevent your character from advancing in the game which is bad. There are some vehicles that you can ride, but you need them to protect VIP's in escort missions.
‚ÄîTrying to pour gasoline on someone and then set them on fire leads to teeth-grinding frustration

Enemies/Allies‚ÄîMediocre
‚ÄîAllies tend to rush into battle and not use cover
‚ÄîEnemies say the same dialog over and over again and they overlap their voices. May want to turn the sound down.
‚ÄîEnemies that are mandatory to kill move all around the place, and the monkey experiments and ones that throw beehives at you? Trying to shoot them is like playing spin the bottle on top of a rotating rotary fan inside of a spinning circus top.

Story‚ÄîSnooze fest
What story? Postal dude solves stuff with his own logic, helps some people, and either becomes bad or good. That's it. He just had to press that button...

Bosses‚ÄîMonotonous
‚ÄîThree boss battles in one? Thankfully it's the easiest, but good lord they are bullet sponges worse than The Division.
‚ÄîCharging bosses? Forget this. Wander around and let them chase you until they happen to fall over randomly while they pretend to hit a wall. Works 1/4 of the time.
‚ÄîThe TANK BOSS? Don't get me started. Worst boss ever. Side-stepping around the corner to fire felt like doing the cha-cha slide to "What Is Love?" on thin ice. Have fun shooting the ROCKET LAUNCHER!

Graphics‚ÄîUnderused
‚ÄîThe Source engine is utilized to the lowest common denominator; the lip movements are worse than Half-Life 2, and why make the screen so small in the main menu? To show off Postal Dude's ego?

Music‚ÄîReplace it
‚ÄîBoring, repetitive, yawn, dull. Might as well put the music from Postal 2 on as a replacement. eve the music cannot save this game.

Conclusion
This may be the worst Postal game ever created by an outsourced developer on the Source engine. Suspending your disbelief is paramount within the first 30 minutes or so; the absurdity of events that happen one after another during the tutorial sections are rather less fun than enjoyable. Running With Scissors should have nothing to do with this, and same goes for anyone who is looking to buy this game. Stay away from it. go buy Postal and/or Postal 4 to support RWS.

column8: After playing Postal II for a while and enjoying it, I thought I'd give Postal III a bash (without reading any reviews) as it was only ¬£1.79 on sale.  I have played for 20 mins.  It's not worth it.  I'd like my money back.  Why even release something like this?
column9: After playing Postal II for a while and enjoying it, I thought I'd give Postal III a bash (without reading any reviews) as it was only ¬£1.79 on sale.  I have played for 20 mins.  It's not worth it.  I'd like my money back.  Why even release something like this?

This is an unfinished Postal game. I have to say that this game is absolutely terrible. Having been a fan of Postal since the first and second games, I don't think this game can compete with the second. Plus, this game has numerous bugs and glitches, including frequent crashes. Of all the games I've played, I've crashed three times. I'll go over some of the problems and pitfalls in this game:
- Loading a save file will sometimes crash the game. You'll have to load the save file from the auto-save feature to fix it.
- Melee weapons are rarely effective.
- The AI ‚Äã‚Äãin this game is quite stupid. For example, in a mission where you have to carry someone to a certain location, if they bump into a wall, they won't move. You have to herd them to come. They'll also stop moving if they step on a picture or chair.
- Be careful not to bump into rhinos in the levels. If you do, you'll sink into the ground and leave the game map, forcing you to start the level over.
Enemies in the game tend to walk around when they're near you instead of shooting. Sometimes, when the Taliban are fighting bandits, they just stand there and shoot, even though they're armed.

The difficulty with playing as a good person is that during certain levels, civilians tend to run into the bullets, making this part difficult.

Some levels, enemies drop so many that they can't stop fighting.

You can lean against walls to avoid them, but you can't completely avoid them, as sometimes enemies can shoot you.

Holding a rocket launcher and left-clicking the mouse once will cause it to explode on you. You have to charge it up and shoot, or right-click.

The only positives are:

You can run.

This game has a health regeneration system.

Overall, I wouldn't recommend buying it for the reasons I mentioned. If you're going to buy it, you'd be better off buying the second game or another game. It's 50 baht off, and I don't think it's worth it at all. It's even harder than the second game. I even hated "Running with Scissors."
