So as of writing I've only played 26 minutes of this game, the game doesn't feel finished or polished, it's hard to aim with the third person camera, and it doesn't feel saitifying hitting things with the weapons.
It has really jaring cutscenes that are annoyingly aged on purpose, I also had an audio bug on one of them where something I was doing carried on in the cutscene.
The first actual mission has you cleaned uses tissues, and it took long to get to the conflict part of the level, fighting for the adversies was kind of fun, but it took too long to defeat all of them, and it became a bit of a slog.
The second mission I got attacked by enemies, had no real weapons apart from cats (Which worked the same way as the grenades which are a bit annoying to use) and then crashed and received no error logs.



I only paid for ¬£2 for this game, but I still think I overpaid for it, I'm refunding my purchase as I don't think the devs deserve the money for the game.
If it was free I'd most likely play it to mess around, but since I own Postal 2 I'd be better off playing that.

column8: This game is a guilty pleasure to be honest, I don't like to admit I enjoy it, but I actually do, yes it's extremely buggy and cannot compare to the legendary POSTAL 2, but this game has something special to it, the music is really good, the hand-drawn HUD and style of the game makes it feel unique, and I just feel if they would've given it more time and not rushed it out, many more people would like it. I know many RWS fans will probably be bashing me for my opinion on the game, and I could spend hours stating the negatives but I usually like to focus on the positives of games. The state this game is in, I feel it's definitely not worth the price, half the time the game key doesn't even work because you have to use some 3rd party login-thingy, it's a real mess, so I re-bought it on G2A because I'm not giving the devs money for a broken product. Anyway, you should get it on G2A or some other site if considering purchasing it, I respect your opinion if you really despise this game.

column8:
My basic summary is that this game is shit and you shouldn't put money into it at all. However...

I'm always able to put time and love into games that are considered shit, and in a way, I like Postal 3. It got so much wrong compared to the first games (curse you Akella and the Russian 2007-2008 economy collapse), but instead of feeling like it's a total abomination, I feel a sort of sadness for it. Like a kid who's dad went away for milk and never came back, so the kid started smokin' crack to cope. Or a sick dog you gotta take out back and shoot. It fills me with a sense that the game could have been great if some raunchy choices weren't made, and that it could have been so much more. Many people have put their hands on it in a chance to try and bring it back, with Vince D saying "Good luck, shitheads." and Mike J saying "Get fucked, shitheads."

The story is handled lazily, the Good/Bad side is just a dumb idea for a game like Postal, and a lot of the weapons you have to CAREFULLY learn the hitboxes of before you can even begin to go dismembering people. Pretty sure Akella wasted all of their money solidifying that sweet, sweet trench coat The Dude's wearing, because that thing's got more detail and fluidity than anything else in the game (the story sure don't). But, in a weird way, I have fun ignoring the mission when out in the city and just take the time to slaughter by-standers, like a TRUE Postal game.

I'm praying both that they come out in the next 20 years with a Postal 4 (extremely wishful thinking) or that SOMEONE manages to fix what Akella did to Postal 3 (maybe less wishful thinking, due to some heroes who think they got the Krotchies to touch it). I say that I don't reccomend this game, but in another sense, I do. ONLY if you want to experience the hell that this game is, and Cory Cruise's nice and smooth voice lines. Go ahead and think of me as that fatty in the Postal 3 house from Paradise Lost.

column9:
This is what happens when you flush all the months spent with story writing by entrusting the game development to Russian high school development team that only works on it during lunch breaks. It is a shame because it could be really nasty, politically incorrect game if the development remained in the Running With Scissors studio.

Rating: 2/10

I honestly don't understand the hate towards this game. It's a perfectly playable domestic product with decent optimization (considering the amount of corpses, dismemberment, and gore in the game, all of which, as I noticed, doesn't disappear once you reach the level).
Yes, it's not a canonical sequel to Postal 2, which I absolutely love and which was practically my first PC game. BUT the atmosphere of the third postal is more reminiscent of the trashy film "Postal" by director Uwe Boll.

While the second part featured a narrative mockery of the underdog, this game from our developers features a more vulgar and blunt humor. The game is completely different from its predecessor. But I wouldn't say it's for the worse. They're simply two different games.
For those who enjoy darker, trashier humor, or who liked Uwe Boll's films, I recommend playing the third postal and ignoring everyone else. The game is a breeze to complete, in one sitting.

column9:
Postal Dude always says: "I regret nothing" and that's also my motto, but I regret buying this game even during on sale.
Should've just asked Mike J for a key

Postal III is a pseudo-open-world first-person shooter from Trashmasters, a subsidiary of Akella. Akella primarily published games in Russia (e.g., Prince of Persia and Assassin's Creed), but also released its own games (Corsairs and Pirates of the Caribbean). Postal III is a sequel to [url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/223470/POSTAL_2/]Postal 2[/url], but due to its low, I'd say appalling, quality, the game was relegated to a spin-off of the second game.

The game turned out to be, if not disgusting, then incredibly stupid and shoddy. Its content is vile, its plot is dumb, its development is flawed, and its humor is at the level of, if not a toilet, then a sewer.

The game's plot begins with the Dude leaving Paradise. However, the bridge out of the city is sealed by the military. After a brief conversation with the military and teaching the player the "basics" of the game, the Dude raises the bridge, destroying the military cordon and... that's it. It doesn't make any sense, it doesn't make any sense, but it's presented as if we've pressed the button on a nuclear missile. Horrible! After this failure, the Dude finds himself in Catharsis, the second paradise after Paradise. The protagonist decides to settle here, and we help him do so by finding a job in the city.
The gameplay here is built around dark humor. All the side jobs are of a "backdoor" nature, and the game just plain makes it through, trying, through words and actions, like, "Ah-ha, it says 'masturbate'" or something like that. It's uncensored, and that's its main drawback. Postal 2 was remembered for its brutality, but the flexibility of its gameplay system and engine; it was remembered for the open city of Paradise, with its unrealistic yet manageable stupidity. Trashmasters followed in the footsteps of their name and created a trash game that took from Postal 2 what crazy people criticized it for, and many even sued it for‚Äîthe brutality and lack of censorship (both verbal and physical).

I didn't and won't write much in the review, because the impressions of the second part still haunt me. I liked the game so much that I didn't trust anyone and bought the third part. If you're a fan of the game or just want to get acquainted with Postal, this game is not worth buying, or even looking at. I don't recommend this game. At the time of writing, the price is an unrealistic 399 rubles, which is way too much for it. I bought it for 80+ rubles, hoping that at least I wouldn't hate it, but alas, it turned out to be the opposite. 
I want to note that this situation with the game series reminds me of FlatOut. If you remember (and if not, look it up), after the success of [url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/2990/FlatOut_2/]FlatOut 2[/url] and [url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/12360/FlatOut_Ultimate_Carnage/]Ultimate Carnage[/url], the series was taken over by Team 6 Studio, who released [url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/201510/Flatout_3_Chaos__Destruction/]Flatout 3: Chaos & Destruction[/url], which collected a bunch of negative reviews and... I will say from my own experience that the cult FlatOut series was simply denigrated.

column8:
Postal III is probably one of the worst received games of all time, and it's hard to argue against this notion if you've ever played it. The development of this game was a total crapshoot, and it's failure can mostly be blamed on the Great Recession, which effected the developers greatly. 

The game has a variety of issues plaguing it even despite the various bugs: Balancing of weapons and enemies are totally screwed, the gameplay is repetitive and a chore, the AI is terrible, and finally, the story and design are a cobbled together Frankenstein of terrible decisions and creative minds juxtaposing. Essentially the only really unarguable elements of the game that aren't bad are the art direction, level design, Corey's vocal performance, and the soundtrack, most of which seems to be unoriginal licensed music anyway.

If you've ever thought about buying this game and trying it for yourself, I can't say I encourage you. Even if you're a hardcore Postal fan, it's really not worth your time, and your opinion on it will most likely either be "terrible" or "meh", depending on the amount of other bad games you've experienced. If you think the game is anywhere near good then I can only assume you are being disingenuous.

The only reason I am thumbing it up is because if it didn't completely bomb, then I wouldn't have met and worked with a lot of cool, talented people to help fix it.
column9:
Postal III is probably one of the worst received games of all time, and it's hard to argue against this notion if you've ever played it. The development of this game was a total crapshoot, and it's failure can mostly be blamed on the Great Recession, which effected the developers greatly. 

The game has a variety of issues plaguing it even despite the various bugs: Balancing of weapons and enemies are totally screwed, the gameplay is repetitive and a chore, the AI is terrible, and finally, the story and design are a cobbled together Frankenstein of terrible decisions and creative minds juxtaposing. Essentially the only really unarguable elements of the game that aren't bad are the art direction, level design, Corey's vocal performance, and the soundtrack, most of which seems to be unoriginal licensed music anyway.

If you've ever thought about buying this game and trying it for yourself, I can't say I encourage you. Even if you're a hardcore Postal fan, it's really not worth your time, and your opinion on it will most likely either be "terrible" or "meh", depending on the amount of other bad games you've experienced. If you think the game is anywhere near good then I can only assume you are being disingenuous.

The only reason I am thumbing it up is because if it didn't completely bomb, then I wouldn't have met and worked with a lot of cool, talented people to help fix it.

Yes, the game is fun, because it's the same old Postal‚Äîstill just as wild and fun, and you can kill a couple of evenings playing it. But there are a couple of downsides that ruin the fun, namely poor optimization and a HUGE number of bugs (the most annoying ones are the random crashes). Because of this, you definitely won't want to play it for long. It's better to play the previous games.

Ni siquiera te brindan soporte tecnico ya que la pagina web oficial esta de baja. Una verdadera pena.
column9: Okay. This is the first time I've reviewed a game on Steam. And it's about "Postal 3." I've been a fan of the series for years. I have every Postal game. Even a ton of mods that aren't listed in the workshop. Like "Eternal Damnation," which is an excellent mod. Not to mention my favorite, and it's a shame it's not on Steam. The point is that Postal 3 is poorly designed. It's linear in concept, which undermines its predecessors, and worst of all, I get to a point where the game kicks me out. Not beating it is a sin. I bought it only out of respect for the series, but the truth is, it leaves a lot to be desired. It's a shame that such a good title has been ruined. They don't even provide technical support since the official website is down. A real shame.

column8:
This one is a difficult one for me. I hate it because it's a buggy mess that crashes frequently, I also hate it for the insanely short story and lack of freedom from the get go. But yet I still love the cheesy Postal humour but that's also another thing that bugs me, this was meant to follow Postal 2, one of my all time favourite games.

Like I say tricky situation but I've actually just had to grit my teeth at the crashes and keep pushing forward through the game, it's funny in places, in others not so much. The missions feel tiresome, just repeatedly escorting NPC's and killing hordes of feminists and terrorists. It's incredibly short but has a free roam once you complete the main story, I've yet to find any side missions aside from doing the achievements. That's a great shame to be honest.

If I put this down as just another third person shooter, I'd probably give it a positive rating, it's got all custom content, a main story, a free roam and decent voice acting. But if I put it down as the sequel to Postal 2. I'd have to gave it a negative straight away. Though, with their now being a Postal 2 DLC known as Paradise Lost, I guess I can class that as the true sequel to Postal 2. Therefore this game ain't all that bad, just don't expect it to be anywhere near as good as it's predecessors.

column9: The black sheep of the Postal series. If you're curious about what actually happened to the third installment, visit the official website of Running With Scissors, who own the series. Among other things, you'll read that the game is "unfinished barely-Alpha state". If you decide to buy it anyway, expect endless bugs and crashes. It's a shame it ended up like this, because the game feels like a good idea.

column8:
To start if you love Postal 2; please skip this game and buy the Postal 2 DLC. This game was a buggie peice of hot garbage.

The missions felt repetive and borning, and maybe thats due to the game crashing all the time and having to start the mission over. The only way I could beat this game was dumb down every setting to its lowest level as it kept crashing. It also felt like the makers were trying to force the over the top humor that made P2 a great game.

The world, unike P2 had very little open world feel to it. 

Postive notes to this game - None (aka Save your money)

 I bought the kicked in the nuts version (as in I wasted my money and got kicked in the nuts by this garbage game)

The only way I would recommend this steaming dog terd is if Steam made it free.

column8:
Actually somewhat playable, but it is WAAAY worse than Postal 2. The missions are not fun and the combat is clunky, not much to explore, lack of free roam, optimisation issues, bad level design, etc. The only thing that I liked about the game is the Postal Dude's playermodel. Maybe some music too, but the rest was awful. 
Probably not the worst game ever made, but it is close. It is sad because I had so much fun with Postal 2.
I don't recommend this one at all.
Just buy Postal 2 and the Paradise Lost expansion instead.

Let's start with the fact that the optimization is terrible: the fps either jumps to 100 or I can get by with 10. The game has a lot of inappropriate humor, which ruins the game. The graphics are no better than 2009 quality, and is it normal that people can walk after being beheaded? The controls are awkward, ammo is always in short supply, and the missions make you wonder: who came up with this? What's changed since the second game? Basically, I'm disappointed!

column8: The main difference between Postal 3 and a piece of sh!t is that I'm happy to see the latter every day. This is a badly optimized, poorly designed game with atrociously bad quests, and is just not worth anybody's time. I loved Postal 2, and frankly, that's where the development should have stopped.
column9: The main difference between Postal 3 and a piece of sh!t is that I'm happy to see the latter every day. This is a badly optimized, poorly designed game with atrociously bad quests, and is just not worth anybody's time. I loved Postal 2, and frankly, that's where the development should have stopped.

I won't list all the cons, but the most annoying ones are: you can't kill to get a good ending (meaning one of the main advantages, cruelty, is ruined!), the view is from a third person, monotonous and boring tasks like collect 25 napkins with sperm or kill 25 feminists, and the lack of a free world and free movement!

column8: Yep it pretty bad awful sound effects bugs and and terrible controls but  thanks for giving me a the free key rws :D just get new postal 2 dlc its  waaay better

column9:
Pros
Excellent illustrations in cutscenes
Music that matches the atmosphere
High replayability with two branching routes
You too can become everyone's favorite, super popular mascot, Crotchie!

Cons
Single-minded missions
Objects' target locations aren't displayed, making it unfriendly
The AI ‚Äã‚Äãis terrible
Cover actions are also terrible
Many weapons are difficult to use and uninteresting
Extremely long loading times
Extremely slow performance and low frame rate
Frequent crashes and forced terminations
A completely different voice and appearance from Dude from the previous game

This is the third installment (or so it seems) in the controversial, vulgar game series POSTAL.
2 was an open-world errand-running FPS, while 3 is a linear, stage-based TPS.

The reviews are overwhelmingly negative, and that's no surprise, as this game is clearly unfinished. Apparently, development was originally handled by the original RWS, but then shifted to Akella, with RWS acting as supervisor. Considering the seven years it took from announcement to release due to repeated delays, it's clear that development was difficult and didn't go smoothly.
Having played the game, I got the impression that it was a solid TPS game with a fairly wide selection of weapons and well-crafted stages and objects.
However, the AI ‚Äã‚Äãissues, numerous bugs, and performance problems, which I'll discuss later, ruin it all.
These are all issues that could have been resolved with repeated debugging and fixes, so it's a shame...
Whether they didn't have the technical ability to fix them or were struggling with funding, it's a mystery, but it seems like they released it unfinished.
It's crazy that they initially priced such an unfinished game at $40.

The AI ‚Äã‚Äãis just way too terrible, no matter how you look at it.
During gunfights, neither enemy nor ally takes cover. Instead, they dash right in front of the enemy and stand there for a few seconds before starting to fire, making it impossible to tell who is friend or foe, resulting in a chaotic battlefield.

Furthermore, unarmed residents will rush into the line of fire while screaming or calling for help, resulting in constant accidental fire and nothing you can do about it. Aren't they all in the same DNA?

There is the usual TPS cover action, but the fact that movement while taking cover is too slow and the direction your gun is aimed and your crosshairs don't line up is still laughable, and you frequently get stuck stuck in a wall while taking cover, making it completely unusable.

And to top it off, the game is incredibly unstable.

It's not uncommon for the frame rate to drop below 30fps in some stages. And to top it all off, the game crashes frequently.
The final boss battle is particularly bad, and it usually crashes when you move to a certain location.
I had to force quit more times than I died.
Putting on such a frustrating state, and then being bombarded with an image of incompetent film director Uwe Boll giving the middle finger while loading for such a long time, would make even the most saintly person boil over.
The previous game, POSTAL 2, was also extremely slow and unstable, but this game's instability is on the whole even more so, reminding us all just how unfinished it is.
Some of you might think, "It's because your machine's performance is rubbish," and that's quite true, so I would definitely recommend anyone with confident PC specs to give it a try.

Even putting aside the AI ‚Äã‚Äãand performance issues, I have to say it's still lacking in excitement.
Most of the missions consist of nothing but gunfights with groups of enemies constantly attacking you.
While the shooter elements are better than in POSTAL 2, the aforementioned AI still ruins everything.
POSTAL retained the brutality that was a selling point of previous games in the series. Players could open fire on innocent residents, blow off the heads of those on the verge of death or begging for their lives, and then set fire to the bodies, mutilate them, and urinate on them, bringing out the cruelty that lies deep within everyone's hearts and giving the middle finger to this crazy society. That was the true joy of POSTAL.

But POSTAL 3 completely forgot about these past traditions and devolved into a mediocre TPS.

If the game's content had been praised, it would have silenced existing fans and even gained new ones.

But the reality is that it's an unfinished product riddled with bugs that can't even be called mediocre.

As a result, it's nothing more than a game that exists only for crap game fans to play with a smug look on their face and write reviews.

-In conclusion
I think it was a good thing that POSTAL 3 was so poorly made.
If 3 had been even moderately good... POSTAL 2 would never have been Greenlighted and released on Steam, the decade-long DLC ‚Äã‚ÄãParadise Lost would never have been released, and the original game might never have been remade as POSTAL Redux, and it might have been forgotten by now...
In that sense, I personally feel that it's thanks to 3, for better or worse, that it has become a topic of conversation.
However, as others have said, 3 is a scam using the POSTAL name, so you should definitely buy POSTAL, POSTAL 2 (Paradise Lost), and POSTAL Redux.

Personal Rating

column9:
Postal 3 is an idea for a game.
I don't think it can be called a complete game.
It seems more like a demo to me given the length of the "story."

There are some very significant issues with the game.

- Gameplay is poorly optimized.

- Melee weapons and fists are impossible to use.

- Running with Scissors seems to ignore the third installment of Postal and seems to prioritize the second installment, pushing it to the forefront.

They frequently release patches to remove bugs and fix various issues with POSTAL 2.

And Postal 3 is left to its own devices with its problems, its poor optimization, and the lack of many features that were in POSTAL 2.

But all in all, it's not such a bad game. If you don't consider the fact that it's the sequel to POSTAL 2,
it's not even that bad.

So, I recommend this game.

column9:
The Postal series was a fantastic game. I didn't play the first one, but I did play the second one. The second one was a very over-developed game, great because of the story, which was a bit lackluster, but I still liked it overall. The second and third installments run on the Source engine, a very good company from Valve, known for CS:GO, Half Life 2, among other things.
Postal 3 has changed beyond recognition since the second one. Unfortunately, there's no good news here. The game is completely poorly optimized. Almost 90% of the time, it's noticeable that it's sluggish, running at max 30 or 40 frames per second, more often at 30 FPS. Another downside is the poor playability, even though the gameplay has completely changed. It didn't do any good because I had to struggle on the very easy difficulty to beat the first part of the game. But as for the graphics, it's much better, even though the game still runs on the same engine as CS:GO and Half Life 2.
Unfortunately, when it comes to weapons, the developer removed some of the weapons known from the original. 2, which further contributes to the game's negative rating. Ultimately, I don't recommend the game unless you want to get stressed out. I rate the game 4/10.

column8:
Une grande partie des avis n√©gatifs sont a mon avis l√† parceque ce n'est pas ce a quoi les gens s'attendaient. N'attendez pas de retrouver un Postal II bis (apres tout postal 2 n'a pas grand chose en commun avec postal I ) un monde semi ouvert, o√π vous vous baladez et faite ce que vous voulez. Non l√† ce sont des suites de niveaux, comme postal I, dans lesquels vous aurez diff√©rents "mini-jeu" √† faire. Et c'est tout. Si de faire des suites de mini-jeux dans des niveaux ferm√©s ne vous tente pas, alors n'achetez pas ce jeu, c'est tout ce qu'il a √† vous offrir. 
Il y a des id√©es sympatifque, comme le fait d'avoir des missions "bien" et des missions "mal", ce qui donne un peu de rejouabilit√©. Certe l'humour ne m'a pas fait autant mouche que le deuxi√®me, je le trouve moins "fin" que le deuxi√®me ( √† supposer qu'on puisse parler de finesse avec Portal X) ), mais certains moment m'ont quand meme bien fait rire. C'est pas du grand gameplay mais perso c'est pas pour le gameplay que je joue √† ce jeu. Et finalement j'ai √©t√© au premier abord dessus comme beaucoup, parceque je ne m'attendais pas √† ca, mais j'ai laiss√© une chance au jeu et finalement je m'amuse bien.
column9:
A large part of the negative reviews are there, in my opinion, because this isn't what people were expecting. Don't expect to find a Postal II bis (after all, Postal 2 doesn't have much in common with Postal I) a semi-open world, where you wander around and do what you want. No, these are series of levels, like Postal I, in which you will have different "mini-games" to do. And that's it. If doing series of mini-games in closed levels doesn't tempt you, then don't buy this game; that's all it has to offer.
There are some nice ideas, like having "good" missions and "bad" missions, which gives a bit of replayability. Certainly the humor didn't hit me as hard as the second one, I find it less "fine" than the second one (assuming we can talk about finesse with Portal X) ), but some moments still made me laugh. It's not great gameplay but personally it's not for the gameplay that I play this game. And finally I was on it at first like many, because I didn't expect that, but I gave the game a chance and finally I'm having fun.

column8: I would like to start by saying that I don't know why everyone said this game crashes a lot when I only had it happen twice. I did experience some npc glitches which is kind of annoying. The game it's self was kind of fun but very disappointing. The story was kind of a mess and they needed to hire a better writer. NO CAT SILENCERS (big letdown). Too many loading screens and takes to long to load. I felt this game could have been way better, but what can you expect when you have a company like trash masters (implied in the name) work on a game. Fun if you need to burn some time. 3/10.

column8: Postal III is not near as bad as people make it out to be. I had a lot of fun with this one, though not as much fun as I had with the first two games. It did crash a few times but, it didn't bother me that much to be honest. There's also three endings in the game, so you have lots of replay value. All of the Postal games seem to be games I will jump back to again and again from time to time. I definitely recommend Postal III. If it wasn't for the crashing, this game would be pretty much perfect.

column8:
After years of knowing it was bad, i wanted to be a completionist and i was in a stubborn mood, so I decided to actually give this a spin. The result: Yep, iiiiiiiiit's bad. 

The style is kinda okay and its no suprise that the story is incredibly goofy. But the game also overdoes it on the memes and hommages too, even for Postal standards. However, the technical part is just a complete mess. Like, the music is kinda cool, but its playing all the time and it's pretty loud. This is probably to hide the fact that alot of sound effects are simply missing. Corey Cruise (The Dude in P3) has some funny lines when he actually does some of his own, but alot of his lines are taken straight from Postal 2. These lines feel like he's just impersonating Rick Hunter, rather then doing his own twist, and it feels like a missed chance. And that thought pretty much sums up everything, and I really do mean EVERYTHING in this game: a missed chance. 

The game gives you the option to follow a Good and Bad path, but its just 2 flavours of suckage really. The karma meter that balances this mechanic is broken anyway, but either you:

A) Endure the good path and try not redecorate your PC with an Axe every single time you accidentely blast any retarded civilians in the crossfire of some of the most chaotic, and frustratingly broken fights you'l ever see, or:

B) Go nuts on a "less" enduring bad path and then get shat on because you went with the bad path this time so you wont get a proper bossfight, escape sequence and better ending (or maybe it's actually a good thing, because it makes the game abit shorter and you can do something useful instead)

As for the gameplay itself: Small missions with (mostly) straightforward objectives and little room for freeroaming, AI wonks out all the time, melee feels unresponsive, special weapons are either useless or only do what they feel like, and using any throwable weapons is a gamecrashing shortcut to exit this infuriatingly glitchy game. It's a shame, cuz it COULD have been good, but sadly, its not.

Long story short: It sucks, but at least the music and Corey Cruise are kinda fun.
And remember kids: don't do drugs and don't play Postal 3, or you'l be seriously sorry!

column9: Using the Source engine, there is not even a creative workshop, which shows how sloppy this game is.

- Atmosphere 8/10
- Story 9/10
- Graphics 8/10
- Gameplay 12/10
- Multiplayer is nonexistent
- Overall game 8/10
Yes, this isn't the Postal we're used to.
Everyone expected something similar to Postal 2, but when that part came out, everyone started criticizing the game.
For those people, I'll let you in on a secret.
Postal 2 isn't the part fans were expecting either.
They were expecting something similar to Postal 1.
But Postal 2 came out completely different.
Same with Part 3.
The controls can be awkward.
The voice acting isn't the best.
The jokes might not be the same.
But that's why they're giving such low ratings.
I think it's stupid.
(This is my personal opinion.)

column8:
Yet another game in my arsenal that deserves a neutral rating. If this game is on sale for $5 it's worth it. Beyond that, it's a very poorly built game. It's bad, like really bad when it comes to game mechanics. 

The game is clunky as if it was published in beta and never patched. I hate the third person perspective. 

They really missed the chance to make a great game. The hug arsenal of weapons with alternate firing modes is really cool. Excapt the rocket launcher, it's a terrible design, I never thought a game could ever make a rocket launcher unfun and un playable. However everything is just clunky. 

WAY too many escort missions.

The AI is complete dog poo, a dumpster fire of groups trying to shoot each other while the mash and bumb in to each other. 

The damn game keeps crashing, and that annoys me. Make sure to contantly quick save.

I'll just go ahead and write a positive review for Postal 3!

I played through this game several times in my early days and was generally satisfied. Now I just downloaded it, installed some mods, and am playing for fun, reminiscing.

The Edge of Madness is present, as well as: piss, a badger, bees, a dog, and a monkey. Holy shit!

On someone's recommendation, I bought this piece of crap. On sale. I can't seriously pay 400 rubles for it. What did I get?
A piece of domestically produced crap. A game that bears little resemblance to the second game. It feels like half the negative reviews were written by RWS fanatics, and the other half by those who couldn't get the third one to work. Linear missions, no freedom of action, but with a choice of paths. Jumping? No jumping, no jumping. But now there's cover!
What awaits us?
First of all, the first and most difficult task is to launch the game. Because even with patches, it might not work. For some reason, I even woke up a dead key activator. But, in the end, the game came back to life. Halfway. Bugs are still there. After a seriously awesome tutorial and a bunch of cutscenes of varying degrees of absurdity, we're sent to vacuum up soggy napkins, catch cats while running from gooks, and, at one point, choose a path to take, which will change depending on your behavior.

Speaking of absurdity. There's a ton of it here; the game is filled to the brim with it. You shoot mustachioed terrorists in a Mexican town, smash the Venezuelan army led by Hugo Chavez in a tank, crush moms, gay bikers, nerds (for fuck's sake, Steam, is that word that vulgar?), animal rights activists, work as a cop and participate in a special operation, direct a macaque/dog with a laser pointer. And all this in one game. Everything is spiced up with profanity and humor, mostly about asses, shit, and dicks. Honestly, this is the most epic crap I've played in a while.
So, what's the bottom line?
Collected by software monkeys under Akella's direction, it's a fucked-up, but fun product that apparently brings joy to completely insane, brain-dead crazies, of which I am one.
And most importantly, forget everything the second Postal taught you. This place has its own rules and laws.

column8:
I can't believe how many negative reviews this game has gotten since the day of its release. First of all, if you love 1970's exploitation films, and even Robert Rodriguez & Quentin Tarantino films, this game is the ultimate game for you!!!!!! Postal 2 was a fucking masterpiece, and this sequel is the "graphics" upgrade but it just doesn't stop there. The "missions" you have yo go through to complete the game are incredibly hilarious! Example: Save the cats from the members of a Chinese restaurant! Work with a vacuum cleaner in an adult club to collect as much worn kleenex and semen as you can to then toss it back to a moralist group of wives! Then you fight the cops, environmentalists and pretty much everyone inside the game. 

Although, the free world premise of the game is not that original, I think it's worth the try for fans of gory games with many sleazy twists.

column8:
People and the internet along with reviews said don't buy the game, yet some other videos made the game seem fun, and more recent reviews make the game seem like it's fun or not as bad as everyone intially thought when the game came out, but to be frank, while this game isn't the worst game ever it DEFINATELY is the shit stain of the series, but even then, it does get some things right Postal is known for. The problem that makes it hard for me to even finish the damn game is that it doesn't get enough things right to be a decent or below average but playable game and feels more like a chore.

In simple terms, the bad outweighs the good with this title (I legitimately need to push myself to finish the game)

But, lets get a few positives out of the way, which there are


1-Humor and Feel-At it's heart the Postal games have been all about ultra violence, parodies of pop culture, culture itself, and many topics, and gross/grim humor. (regarding the first two games, I consider Postal 1 and redux games in the series, but they are their own "animals" if you will) You can think of Postal as Duke Nukem meets South Park, and thankfully, Postal 3 does do well in the humor department, making fun of everything from soccer moms to Uwe Boll (who does make a cameo, which makes it funnier imo) to crooked politicians


2-Open World, precisely GTA style open world-This is a nice unexplored style of game that Postal has yet to explore, which is a (imo) fun and interesting way to go about the your mentally unstable endeavors with the game

Weapon Variety-The game keeps one of Postal's other key elements and manages to take care of that well, that being the over the top, ridiculous, and uncanny weapons selection, with classics like the crazy cat and shovel to new things like beehives and  a badger saw

Unfortunately, this is where the positives end, and the negatives start charging at you like an aggressive cat (as you can tell I've tried the other games)

1-Barren Open World-The idea of an open world for a game like this GTA style is great, what isn't is there is literally nothing to do other than rampage and destroy cars and massacre people. Now don't get me wrong, that was one of the points of postal, but it wasn't the only one, others were exploring buildings and vast environments, interacting with the world in comedic and ridiculous ways, and digging around for secrets amd easter eggs. To make an open world that is so desolate and with so little to do is a major missed oppertunity

2-Combat-While the gunplay isn't a train and weapon variety in it of itself is nice, what isn't is how "floaty" and unbalanced it is for lack of a better term. Melee combat legitimately takes getting used to and timing to hit foes properly and you might as well not move at all while using melee weapons or your fists, because you will be swinging around like a chicken with it's head cut off otherwise. As for guns, aiming can be slow like molasses as you barely move at all as you aim and not to mention that the weapons and damage feels off balance (a shotgun blast that is very close at times won't even take someone down, they just get back up) You are literally better off sticking to the best to use weapons in the game (pistol, m16, and machine gun) rather than anything else

The biggest thing that would otherwise make this at least a below average or PLAYABLE game however,is the bugs, I feel like you might need to call a fucking exterminator its so buggy in this game

Everything from AI acting unresponsive, leaving themselves open, or not following you around when you tell them to move, to the game going slow and laggy (even in compatibility mode with windows 7) to even crashing when you UNLOCK AN ACHIEVEMENT at times, and you have a game that tries to drain you of your energy with how buggy it can be)

This would be a "meh" title if it weren't for the bugs, optimization issues, and just overall lackluster feel/vibes Postal 3 gives off, but as brought up beforehand, the few nice things about the game UNDOUBTEDLY aren't enough to make this an average title, and there's so many problems it can be unbearable, I honestly just hope RWS learned their lesson (no offense to the company) about licensing out their games to the right developer and maybe we might see a re-release of this game in house which would be 1000x better, or maybe Postal 4 or a new game that'll blow this out of the water, until then, just focus on Postal 2 and Paradise Lost

Note-I may edit this reveiw if I choose to push myself and finish the game, but idk

column8: ƒ∞t makes me laugh

The game itself COULD be good if not for 2major things:

Terrible 3rd person view and aiming, with absolutely retarded interface. I saw some wierd combinations with Source engine, but this... 
AND
Terrible english voice acting, terrible music.

There are some minor things like overpowered ranged weapons, wierd NPC AI scripts, wierd mission logic, the way the story is given to the player... 

UPDATE

After getting used to controls and wierd targeting you`ll get your share of fun out of this game. Just keep in mind that ITS NOT POSTAL 2 mechanics, and you`ll do fine. There are some good ideas though in this game, but nothing that could save it in comparison with RWS works. 
I tried to give this game a second chance after doing P2 Paradise Lost, if you know the story of Paradise Lost, you`ll understand me. This game isnt bad, it just dont deliver the same amount of insanely fun target practice and Dude`s attitude to err... life. Like I said, if you keep in mind that its NOT POSTAL 2, just a game that people made BASED on Postal world... and you`d be surprised how you`ll start getting fun out of it.

column9:
Postal III is a game with good potential and music, but terrible execution.
Pros:
+ Music
+ Character design (especially Postal Dude)
+ Arsenal
+ Typical Postal atmosphere
+ Intro
+ Cartoony cutscenes
Cons:
- Optimization
- Limited and very small sandbox world compared to the second installment
- Terrible melee combat model
- Uneven shooting model
- Low resolution of most textures
- Many unnecessary, boring cutscenes
- Crashes
- Frequently bugged gasoline that won't flow from the canister
- Bugged or completely broken achievements
This game would be one of the better Postal games if all of the above issues were fixed. While the story was enjoyable, I still miss walking around a big city and hacking people to pieces with a katana that I can use as a boomerang. For me, it's a 5/10.

column9:
This game is simply amazing. It's perfect for those who enjoy playing crazy games. It has a fun storyline and two different paths. I was so hooked that I played both versions as soon as I installed it. If you don't skip the cutscenes, the whole thing feels like a movie. It's full of trash and hilariousness; I was outraged more than once by one scene or another. The only thing I felt a bit uneasy with at first was the controls, but you can easily tweak these little details in the settings.

In short, I was incredibly pleased with this game!

Ayant aimer les deux premiers (surtout le 2), j'avais d√©ja vu des vid√©os du jeux et je le savais que cela √©tait une merde mais pas √† ce point l√†. Sc√©nario inexistant, humour tellement bas qu'il fait honte a la s√©rie. Je n'ai pas eu le courage de le termin√© mais pour avoir vu les fins sur youtube, je ne loupe pas grand chose. 

Gameplay tellement basique et raide qu'ils ont m√™me foirer la vis√© ! Avec le moteur SOURCE !!! Optimisation aux fraises et crash souvent. Pratiquement aucune imagination que cela soit au niveau du level design que des armes.

column9:
NO NO AND NO!!! RUN FROM THIS GAME LIKE THE PLAGUE!

Having loved the first two (especially the second), I'd already seen videos of the game and I knew it was crap, but not this bad. The storyline was nonexistent, the humor was so poor it put the series to shame. I didn't have the courage to finish it, but having seen the endings on YouTube, I'm not missing much.

Gameplay so basic and stiff that they even messed up the aiming! With the SOURCE engine!!! Optimization is poor and crashes frequently. Practically no imagination, whether in terms of level design or weapons.
And just seeing the photo of Uwe Boll as soon as you launch the game makes me want to vomit. But I admit I enjoyed killing him. Speaking of humor, it's simple: you're using the same type of humor as "What have we done to God?" FUCKING walking clich√©s. In the second game, they were well managed, but this one, FUCK!!

No, I sincerely advise you not to play this third installment and stick with the first two. Plus, the DLC they released a year or three ago is way superior to this game. And you'll get it for less, so the choice is easy.

column8: THIS GAME SUCKS MAJOR BAWLS
column9: THIS GAME SUCKS MAJOR BAWLS

There are only two words that can describe this abomination. Utterly shameful. I knew the reviews were bad, I knew the game was so-so. But I decided to give it a waaaaaay chance. I launched the game ‚Äì the jokes are unfunny, the voice acting is lacking in intonation, every 30 seconds of gameplay is interrupted by cutscenes, grenades fly through the bridge, gasoline doesn't flow where you need it. And that's just the tutorial... Holy shit. 1/100

The game began development in 2006, but it was released in 2011. The game underwent many changes during the development process. RWS should not have entrusted the development to TrashMaster and Akella. They not only changed such a wonderful game for the worse, but they didn't take it seriously. Go to YT for the development of P3, and they were there drinking during breaks. In general, P2 had more freedom of action - go wherever you want, kill whoever you want. But P3 turned out to be corridor-like and closed, there is no freedom of action, and I won't even mention the shooting mechanics. In short, the game did not live up to the expectations of players at the time of release. Only humor saves the game.

column9: I really enjoyed Postal 2, so I was really looking forward to the third one. Unfortunately, practically everything in the game is wrong. The level design is terrible, there is no freedom here (no free walking around the city like in the second one, only consecutive missions), the optimization due to the poor graphics is disastrous and the game is full of all sorts of bugs. This is one of the worst games I have ever played and the only things that please me are a few perversely funny ideas and a pretty quick ending, if you have the strength to play it for more than half an hour. I recommend going with the first impression, which is terrible and it won't change for the rest of the game.

column8:
Este cacona, es mi gusto culposo. 
 Aqui les Explico el porque: 
 Se que es basura, que esta lleno de bugs y que, tiene un humor negro y ofensivo. 
 Pero aun asi, logra cometer su objetivo de entrenerme, tanto sea por lo malo que esta programado, tanto sea, como los enemigos caen como si fuesen trapos al rozarles mientras corres, o matarlos de un disparo en la cabeza, con hasta una aspiradora. 
 La historia, es ridicula y estupida, y que, solo brinda ocaciones bizarras, solo para divertir. Ya sea, Mexicanos chinos y Musulmanes que quieren matarte por que estas cumpliendo tu mision de capturar gatos con SIDA o proteger manzanas de unos hippies Armados hasta los dientes. 
 Ya saben, estereotipos mesclados, que dan risa a primera vista, luego, incomoda.
 Lo unico que lo salva, es la Banda sonora, que para mi PARECER, esta muy bien lograda, pero mal implementada, pero, se nota mucho talento desperdiciado en este juego. Desde musica MIDI, con toques sensillos, pasando por solos de guitarra al estilo COUNTRY, Luego Metal, o Alternativa, hasta lleguar a Remixes EDM.
 Tamb√≠en cabe destacar, de que, al explorar el juego (cosa muy lamentable que te dejen hacer, como recompensa, por completarlo, y no como se debe en un principio. Como la impresi√≥n que nos dieron en P2) se nota muchisimo, de que si AKELLA(empresa Rusa, famosa por crear mods raros y regulares, de el juego anterior) hubiese tenido mas tiempo para terminar este juego, al menos, hubiese estado mas pulido y jugable.
 Es una lastima que RWS no pueda mejorar este juego, debido a politicas con Akella. 
 Es una pena.
column9:
This piece of crap is my guilty pleasure.
Here's why:
I know it's garbage, it's full of bugs, and it has dark and offensive humor.
But even so, it manages to fulfill its goal of entertaining me, whether it's because of its poor programming, or whether it's because enemies fall like rags when you brush against them while running, or whether it's because you kill them with a shot to the head, or even with a vacuum cleaner.
The story is ridiculous and stupid, and it only offers bizarre occasions just for fun. Whether it's Chinese Mexicans and Muslims who want to kill you because you're fulfilling your mission of capturing cats with AIDS or protecting apples from heavily armed hippies.
You know, mixed stereotypes that are funny at first glance, but then become uncomfortable.
The only saving grace is the soundtrack, which, in my opinion, is very well done, but poorly implemented. However, it's clear that a lot of talent is wasted in this game. From MIDI music with simple touches, to country-style guitar solos, then metal, or alternative, to EDM remixes.
It's also worth noting that when exploring the game (which is a very unfortunate thing they let you do as a reward for completing it, and not as you should have done initially. Like the impression we got in P2), it's very clear that if AKELLA (a Russian company famous for creating rare and regular mods of the previous game) had had more time to finish this game, at least it would have been more polished and playable.
It's a shame that RWS can't improve this game due to policies with Akella.
It's a shame.

column8:
*sigh* okay so i bought this for 3.72 if im not wrong and as a POSTAL fan i didn't wanted to be an a$$hole so decided to give this game a chance and oh boy was i wrong...
before i talk bad about this game, i'm gonna try and add some good things about it aswell
+best thing about this game is the soundtrack. It is one of the best video game soundtracks i ever heard and it fits the game PERFECTLY
+decent voice acting (not for the main character)
+cool new weapons like HIV cats or bees that you can throw at people and watch them getting ripped apart
+some cool and challenging achievements you can get in this game
+follows the same story as the 2nd game:Dude goes to another sh@thole a.k.a Catharsis, does his "$hitty jobs" for people and tries to make cash for the trip while he meets more a$$hole people that hate him and wants to kill him
+violence and gore just as the previous ones
+you can choose a good/evil path blah blah blah and get a good/evil ending blah blah blah
Okay now that we got that out of the way let's go to the sh#tty side of this game:
- firstly lets get the obvious one out of the way that it was NOT made by RWS but instead by some russian companies that did knew what they were doing...
- multiple bugs, glitches that makes you even restart the damn game
- Postal III a.k.a The Definition of Crashing
- Dude's voice acting...the way Postal 2 dude says quotes sounds BADA$$, but the way Postal 3 dude says quotes sounds so lazy and boring
- sh#tty dark humor that can only make a 10 year old laugh (let's not forget this is a M rated game)
- oh you remember how i said how achievements can be challenging ? well it's because they are so BUGGY
- repetitive story...you get your "sh#tty job" you do it, you fail to get paid, you go to do another "sh#tty job" of yours
- melee weapons ? don't bother using them
- in Postal 2 you can pee for 2 hours...but in this game you can pee for 2 seconds
- AI is so f@cking retarded in this game that you might aswell play the game with your eyes closed so you wouldn't have to see their stupid actions
- cover system is USELESS
- cutscenes look worse than the gameplay itself
- sound effects (best solution is to mute the game sound and just leave the music sound)
- you have to beat this buggy piece of crap in order to unlock free roam and then again...the free roam is SOOOO boring because all you can do is kill a bunch of innocent people that wont even fight back and give you a challenge
- Uwe Boll is in this game
- it's full price right now is 11.99 when it should be for free imo
- don't you think i should stop now ?
Okay i think you get the point now. What i DON'T reccomend ?
DO NOT buy this game for 11.99 just wait for the sale if you're a hardcore POSTAL fan
What i reccomend ?
Get a Postal 3 disc so you could pee on it or just buy Postal 2 instead
Final score:3/10
I REGRET EVERYTHING
Edit:
Also don't forget to pray for those who bought this for 59.99

Postal III - Divine Symphony

The Postal series was going through hard times. Postal 1 was commercially unsuccessful, and the second installment was barely making ends meet. Akella, Russia's leading publisher, stepped in to rescue the series from the depths of oblivion. Only they were able to lift the decaying series to a new level and breathe new life into it. So, before us is the masterpiece of our lords. A light of hope in the depths of a decaying industry: Postal 3.

Plot: Worthy of the boldest and finest literary works. From the first seconds of the game, it becomes clear that this is more than just a game. This is an entire life, which we will experience on our screens. A profound and spontaneous, beautiful and at the same time terrifying creation of the highly intellectual minds of venerable men and beautiful women. The average person lacks the chromosomes to comprehend the full genius of this work of art. Luckily, the authors were equipped with an extra bit of creativity and were able to create such divine splendor. A stunning mission in a sex shop. Vacuuming up masturbation and then throwing it at violent feminist protesters. All of this is executed within a beautifully crafted narrative framework and with a profound message that not everyone can grasp. Stealing cats from shawarma vendors or delivering hoverboards from point to point. An ordinary person would never have come up with such brilliant ideas. This work of art is worthy of the best literary genres.

Gameplay: Such a well-developed and balanced combat system has never been seen in a game before. It feels like you're playing real life from the very first seconds of our epic campaign. It's impossible to tear your eyes away from this action.

Graphics: The game is centuries ahead of its time. It's as if the developers built a time machine and traveled 150 years into the future to spy on alien technology. No other game has such stunning graphics. Naturally, only the world's most expensive computers can handle them.

Visual style and music: It's clear the designers have been drawing inspiration for years. Antiquity, Renaissance, and Gothic are blended in this game, blending virtually every genre, producing a true bouquet of awe and a delightful palette of colors. This style can only be compared to the best modern paintings. The musical accompaniment is reminiscent of a divine symphony. You won't hear something like this even in the timeless masterpieces of the classics. This style and quality can perhaps only be compared to Fryderyk Franciszek Chopin.

Bottom line: This isn't a game. It's an entire religion, the religion of Akella in all its forms. This masterpiece deserves nothing but prayer and praise.

1.0/10 The only thing worse is sex with a dead grandmother at night by candlelight.

column8:
This is nothing like Postal 2.

If you enjoyed Postal 2, you won't like this.

If you think Postal 2 is rubbish, you won't like this either obviously.

First and foremost, the aiming is horrible (the aiming reticle is a complete lie), the controls are clunky. It's enough alone to make the game unenjoyable. This is even with the Improvement Mod.

But while Postal 2 was an open-world game where you do menial tasks like buy milk and break into people's homes, to varying amounts of insanity, this game is more mission-based in closed environments, and ultimately is a shoot-em-up. Two sides are having a kerfuffle, and you help one, or neither.

No amount of wacky (awkward/impossible to use) weapons or pornstar cameos can save any of that.

The game has even been disowned by the developers, and do you know how low THEIR standards are?

column9:
Another installment in a well-known series, but is it a valid one? My review will be objective and straightforward.

Postal 3 ‚Äì a game supposedly released in 2009. It's the third installment in the adventures of the Dude, the protagonist from the two previous installments and the 2004 Apocalypse Weekend expansion. Unfortunately, the game was released a few years later, but I don't know why. It's not the worst game, but it's not the best either.

Pros:
- The Dude and all the humor and world-building that characterize the series return and spill their unique flavor onto the new city they find themselves in. Simply put, it's still fun and goofy.
- The arsenal and items, of which there are quite a few. - Shooting and body parts falling off are fun.

Between:
- The simplicity and linearity of the gameplay may appeal to some players.
- The storyline may be enjoyable.

Cons:
- Short, 4-6 hours.
- The town you play through is tiny and not particularly impressive.
- Freemode is unlocked only after completing the story.
- Besides shooting, driving a vehicle from the future (an electric two-wheeler), and interacting with trash with a vacuum cleaner, there's nothing else to do. The interaction options seen in the second game (buying various items, weapons, etc.) are missing.
- The Artificial Intelligence in this game is abysmal, although the second game wasn't exactly glamorous either, but everyone here is at a disadvantage.
- Bugs, for example, with missions where you have to escort someone, are completely destroyed. Each NPC we're supposed to escort doesn't need to be under any care. Even if we leave them at the beginning and they don't follow us, we'll still successfully complete the mission as long as we reach the starting point and our NPC doesn't die.

No conclusions. I recommend buying the game on sale because, trust me, it's not worth it at 43.99 PLN.
Still the same old post. Crooked and merciless!
The game was a total rip-off, it's impossible to even complete the tutorial.

Infelizmente, eles tiraram um importante elemento que sempre esteve presente em toda a jogabilidade do Postal II - a sua liberdade. Postal III √© um jogo onde voc√™ deve seguir instru√ß√µes e cumprir tarefas; diferentemente do seu antecessor, onde voc√™ tinha liberdade de fazer tudo que o jogo permitia que voc√™ fizesse. 
Em Postal III, os desenvolvedores focaram em tentar contar uma historinha, algo legalzinho, mas falharam: a hist√≥ria n√£o convence, ela perdeu o humor √°cido e negro que existia em Postal II.
Enfim, uma decep√ß√£o. Nem se assemelha a Postal II. 
N√£o perca seu dinheiro comprando este jogo. Compre Postal II se realmente quiser jogar algo interessante.
column9:
Unfortunately, they removed an important element that was always present throughout Postal II's gameplay‚Äîyour freedom. Postal III is a game where you must follow instructions and complete tasks; unlike its predecessor, where you had the freedom to do whatever the game allowed you to do.

In Postal III, the developers focused on trying to tell a story, something nice, but they failed: the story isn't convincing, and it lacks the dark, acidic humor that existed in Postal II.

In short, a disappointment. It's nothing like Postal II.

Don't waste your money buying this game. Buy Postal II if you really want to play something interesting.

column8: So! I like POSTAL 2, I really do, but this one has nothing to do with it. It tries way too hard to be funny, has numerous bugs, glitches, audio problems, etc... What I don't understand is that they managed to fuck up the Source engine (one of the more optimized game engines out there). Controls are okay, but sprinting makes you wanna puke. It may sound dumb, but it's somewhat like a tie-in with the movie [yes, it exists, and yes, it's not a great movie (let's just say Uwe Boll), *actually I think it's watchable once a decade*]. To be honest, if you've played the Paradise Lost DLC, then you can pretend, that this dude is not Postal 2's dude (helps a little). But(!) what I can't forgive, the story mode is 3 hours. Conclusion: If you are fast enough, you can actually beat this game under 2 hours, then refund it. Music is neat tho.
column9: So! I like POSTAL 2, I really do, but this one has nothing to do with it. It tries way too hard to be funny, has numerous bugs, glitches, audio problems, etc... What I don't understand is that they managed to fuck up the Source engine (one of the more optimized game engines out there). Controls are okay, but sprinting makes you wanna puke. It may sound dumb, but it's somewhat like a tie-in with the movie [yes, it exists, and yes, it's not a great movie (let's just say Uwe Boll), *actually I think it's watchable once a decade*]. To be honest, if you've played the Paradise Lost DLC, then you can pretend, that this dude is not Postal 2's dude (helps a little). But(!) what I can't forgive, the story mode is 3 hours. Conclusion: If you are fast enough, you can actually beat this game under 2 hours, then refund it. Music is neat tho.
The second part might have been more interesting, but it's still a stag and despite the bugs, it's worth just playing through if you're a fan of the series.

column8:
[h1][b]Avoid At All Costs[/b][/h1]

EDIT 2.0: I guess the bullet points don't show up on the store page, so you have to actually click on the review to get a cleaner version. Sorry for Steam being trashy.

I'm just going to sum up this review in a very large pros v cons list because I feel like that would be best for this game.
[list][h1]Pros:[/h1]
[*] Unlike the 2nd game, there is no backtracking and instead there are missions
[*] The good/bad system is pretty neat and you can get different missions depending on how you decide to behave
[*] A majority of the humor is on-par with the 2nd game
[*] The models look nice and the voice acting is done very well
[*] Some of the missions are very enjoyable and are really fun to play through
[*] Ron Jeremy is in the game
[/list]
[list][h1]Cons:[/h1]
[*] The average fps, especially in gunfights, is in the mid teens, just like Kevin Spacey
[*] The game has really bad crash issues and during my playthrough crashed over 15 times total
[*] Some of the missions are really drawn out and boring
[*] The health regen system, you can't manually heal yourself, so you actually have to take cover
[*] The cover system sucks.  Numerous times I was shot through walls and died from an enemy around a corner
[*] Aiming while in cover is nearly impossible and most of the time you can still be shot while sitting in cover
[*] The voice lines are repeated often and get super annoying within an hour or so
[*] When shooting the rocket launcher, it explodes as soon as it exits the chamber and blows up in your face
[*] The boss missions are the worst because the fps is awful and you need to make quick movements and accurate shots
[*] The sprinting system is odd, because sometimes it doesn't actually recharge and you cannot spring any more for that level
[*] The gunshots are so loud that you can barely hear the character over them
[*] The sounds are incredibly goofy because they're default source engine sounds. Think of cs:go noises in a comedy game.
[*] The pathing on the NPCs are terrible and often run in front of you while you're shooting, causing you to lose repuation.
[*] This doesn't feel anything like a postal game, other than the few tie-in characters from the 2nd game.
[*] The "vehicle gameplay" is just you riding on a segway for a mission and a half. It even jokes about it in the game.
[*] The weapon wheel is a pain to navigate and only a handful of items have hotkeys.
[*] A majority of the weapons feel incredibly useless compared to the weapons from the 2nd game.
[*] The game doesn't feel like a "week in paradise" and instead a bunch of "boring accidents and meetups"
[*] Some of the weapons are a pain to use because they end up harming yourself or other civilians due to their awful pathing and the weapon's AOE
[*] On the lowest graphics options possible, it is near impossible to even read the main menu screen
[*] Alt+Tabbing causes the game to freeze and crash
[*] Sometimes after respawning you get a bug where you keep moving back and to the right.  To fix this, throw a grenade or restart the game.  Usually throwing the grenade crashes it anyways
[*] There's a chance that whenever you throw an item the game will crash
[*] Akella is a Russian dev team that dropped the ball hard on this game and even RWS says that this game is trash.  It is even referenced in the Paradise Lost DLC for POSTAL 2
[*] Running With Scissors is more fun than playing this dumpster fire
[*] I'd rather dunk my balls in boiling water than have to sit through this campaign again
[/list]

Don't consider buying this.  I thought that, "It can't possibly be as bad as people are saying it is".  I could have not been more wrong.  Playing this was absolutely frustrantingly rage-inducingly painful. The awful controls, the terrible framerate, the boring as hell missions, and the awful sound design make me want to vomit out an entire toddler. Do not spend your money on this. Do not support this developer. Stay far away from anything that they may make in the future. This is the biggest turd that I have ever bought and I would rather spend 15 days of my life in terrible achievement farming games than have to sit through another 5 hours of this filth.

Please don't consider buying this. Please don't think that it's a good deal. Please refund this if you can. Do not make the same mistake that I did. Please save your time and money. Please stay safe from the rage and frustration of this stinky doodie. Please save yourself.

EDIT: I don't even remember making this review. Thanks for reading it though. Also, here's another friendly reminder to not buy this dumpster of despair if you didn't get it in the above section.

I'm changing my review to a positive one, because after playing Postal 4, I realized all my hopes for a top-notch sequel were completely dashed.
RWS managed to lose face and make a game that's technically on par with Postal 3, and even worse in terms of story.
Just think about it ‚Äì they managed to make something worse than the third game, even though they themselves made fun of it in the new Postal 2 expansion (Paradise Lost).

A real disgrace, a real shame. I never thought I'd live to see this.

column8: hade inte h√∂ga f√∂rhoppningar men blir √§nd√• besviken det k√§nns inte som postal. detta √§r ett mistag har spelat i typ 2 timar men kanske beh√∂vs det mer tid. plus att det har h√§ngt sig r√§tt ofta.

Get this on sale and you'll regret nothing.

Basically, consider it as Apocalypse Weekend 2.0 with a free roam in the end as a bonus. So you play through missions, they are basically alike, it's like in Postal 2, sans the part where you get to location, you start with a 2nd part immidiately, where you have to kill or pacify opposing nerds, hockey moms, ecologists etc.. I played through a good part and it was actually satisfying. Not so many games where you play as cop. And Postal Dude cop always have a funny comment about things around.

This game is not THAT bad as not recommended reviews describe it. If you are, like me, thought wether you should get this game, i'd say get it on sale. Music is fine. Humor fits into Postal universe. If you got bored playing Postal 2 and want more fun in this style, i guess you'll be satisfied. But beware, as this game feels unpolished, just be ready for some things i'll tell you about. It crashed few times, few bugs, but actually it's like early P2 unpatched games, same shit. Also NPCs behavior seems a lilttle chaotic compared to P2.  Anyways it's pretty cheap on sale.

column8:
Two quick notes:
1) Got this alongside the Postal XX box set, so I'm at least glad my money didn't go to someone who didn't deserve it.
2) Most of my playtime with this came from outside of Steam thanks to the DRM Fix, so the playtime is not accurate.

Where do I start with this? Postal III is poorly optimized, confused in terms of story, boring in terms of gameplay, and terribly short. The fact that the series creators have disowned this should state it enough. Just watch reviews on YouTube, like TehSnakerer, to understand the pain this game brings.

Support RWS and buy Postal/Postal 2/Postal Redux instead.

column8: I got this game for free from RWS. Don't buy this game just buy the other postal games and if you really want to play this ask RWS for a steam key. This game is shit, I couldn't even finish the game because it's so broken with bugs and boring and dull gameplay. The only weapon you really need is the M16 or Pistol and after you have that you're all set. Just buy Postal 2 if you want something funny, satisfying with weapons, and fun with messing with NPCS. And if you only want it for the humor go find a video on youtube for all the cutscenes for they're the only parts with actual humor. The NPCs have boring reactions and aren't as fun to mess with as in postal 2. Overall I say this game is just boring, dull, and VERY buggy.

column8: I knew the game was terrible based off what I heard. Having to of actually played it out of curiosity, it really is bad. Compared to Postal 2, combat is a huge step down. While the game is made on the Source engine, everything is done from a third person perspective so don't expect to play it in first person like Left 4 Dead or Half-Life. The errands (which could be done in any order) are replaced with more linear missions (defend store from angry soccer moms, then collect 15 cats while fending off angry Mexican Asian sushi chefs). The humor of Postal 3 is not on par with Postal 2. Overall, Postal 3 is a huge step down, so much that RWS refers to it as "Russian Postal" and takes one hell of a jab at it in their Postal 2 DLC.

column8:
TL;DR don't buy this game, no money goes to RWS and they're unable to fix the game because the actual developers refused RWS access to even try to fix the game. They say so on their site.

[quote=Directly from the RWS homepage on Postal 3.] You‚Äôre a responsible adult (we hope), so I‚Äôm sure you‚Äôre capable of making your own purchasing decisions. I just want you to consider all of the above, before you make the leap of regret into paying real hard-earned money for this title. We don‚Äôt own the game, we can‚Äôt support it and we don‚Äôt get anything from its sales, so if you decide to risk the purchase ‚Äì you‚Äôre on your own. [/quote]

In the relatively short time i played this game it just feels like a chore of finding certain things under certain conditions.

Examples from the game include:
Find 8 cats whilst fighting against the Chinese restaurant workers.

Protect the stall from being trashed by people, this one was infuriating to some degree, as soon as you grabbed someone, there is just no way for you to let go of your hostage but you just straight up snap their neck.

Postal Dude voicework supposedly has a different actor, I could just be not so nitpicky but I don't notice any significant difference in the acting.

I'll probably add more if I could be bothered to review what feels like something made by the same people from Hunt Down the Freeman.

column9: Innokenty returned to his village after the war in Afghanistan. It seemed like life was going to be a happy one, but upon returning home, new troubles awaited him. The eighth cousin of his maternal grandfather's uncle's wife, his brother-in-law's great-nephew's brother (oh, fuck) died after injecting himself with solvent 646. Innokenty's mother is heavily in debt to the local loan shark Moishe, and his own wife committed suicide by throwing herself in front of a Dushanbe-Moscow plane landing at Domodedovo Airport. Will Innokenty be able to cope with his own flashbacks, earn enough money unloading coal cars at night, recover from the loss of his wife, and find new love in a village increasingly under the control of the Armenian National Socialists?

column8:
Catharsis. Far from cathartic, and in no way relative to Paradise. Much like Gary, Indiana. Or Detroit. If you don't know where Detroit is, I'd suggest looking at a map. You are geographically challenged, and the fact that you're still alive right now is a miracle in itself. But I digress.

Six years later, after having bought this game in 2011 initially, revisiting it in 2017 as of the time typing this review, I can safely say that my tainted nostalgia in regards to it, if you will, wasn't exactly contradictive to reality. Everything about it is still hot garbage. I don't say this just because I'm a believer that Postal 2, Apocalypse Weekend and Paradise Lost were the best entries in the franchise, either. From a technical standpoint, in tandem with general fun factor, while there were some briefly hilarious moments scattered throughout my time on this, I cannot in good conscience recommend this entry in the Postal series to anyone, for any price. Seriously, a penny spent is a penny lost, along with a piece of your soul with this purchase.

[B]Pros:[/B]

[list]
[*]The graphics are probably the best part about this, speaking in completely relative terms to other entries in the series. And for general 2011 standards, while these were not the best on the market back then even, they were still completely passable.
[*]The voice actor for this game, at the time replacing the original postal dude, actually wasn't half-bad. I may be in the minority with this opinion, but I completely believe that had the game been set, say, 20 years after the events of Postal 2, and the character were in his 50s, the choice would have been completely appropriate.
[*]The source engine wasn't a bad choice for this game, and they certainly could've done worse in this aspect. Although I'd like to think of it more as "middle of the road" in my personal estimation of pros and cons than anything. Which, inevitably, leads me to...
[/list]

[b]Cons:[/b]

[list]
[*]The glitches are phenomenal with this game. Hitbox detection is very spotty, environmental clipping was notorious in the opening tutorial, and the game crashed twice on me, Just randomly. Nevermind that my system has a GTX 1070, i7-4790k and 16 GB of DDR3 RAM.
[*]While voice acting never has, nor will be an academy award winning fare among the NPCs by and large, some of it was just downright ridiculous even by RWS' usual standards. Particularly when it comes to elderly pedestrians, among other stuff of the sort.
[*]Third person view - hands down - was the bane of my experience across the entire board. The controls, as well as general movement, are way too stiff and should have been a lot better tuned out of the gate.
[*]The move to a more linear experience just does not suit this series at all, and is one of the biggest reasons why playing it - as stated earlier - felt more like work than anything. And that's pretty much it, too. You literally HAVE to work in order to earn the ability to free roam. How much more counterintuitive can you get here?
[*]Phoned in humor and sub-par writing. From my own subjective experience, it had its moments. But for the most part, it was about as funny as watching a blind man trip over his own feet while he's burning to death. Actually, I'd go as far as to say even [i]that's[/i] funnier than what [i]this[/i] game ended up being. It's certainly not like its predecessors, nor its successors (and even in its development phase, I'm considering Postal 4 to be pretty damn phenomenal).
[*]Fill in the blanks. If you can name it, it probably sucks.
[/list]

And for my current ratings scale, which I am now revising all of my past and present reviews to match:

[table]
[tr]
[th]Rating[/th]
[th]Summary[/th]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]5 out of 5[/td]
[td]Perfect on every level, or damn close to it. The fun factor completely overshadows the very few, if any shortcomings, and the overall product is, without debate, worth the full asking price.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]4 out of 5[/td]
[td]Above Average. While it's still a good, if not great product, there are noticeable issues here and there. Worth full price, but if you can rent it on console, watch gameplay online, or wait for a sale on PC, even better.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]3 out of 5[/td]
[td]Average. The caveats are on equal ground with the amount of entertainment provided. Rent it on console, watch gameplay online, or wait for a sale on PC.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]2 out of 5[/td]
[td]Fair. The problems with the overall product are noticeable, and outweigh the fun factor on most levels. Watch gameplay of it online if you must, or rent it on console. Deep sale on PC at absolute best.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]1 out of 5[/td]
[td]Poor. The product is an unmitigated disaster with very little, if anything, to be lauded. Unless you're a masochist, the best recommendation I can possibly give is to watch gameplay of it online. Don't waste your money.[/td]
[/tr]
[/table]

[b]Overall Score for Postal III:[/b] 1 out of 5

With all of the above taken into consideration, the staff at RWS must have been drunk, high, or beamed back in time and dropped on their heads as babies when they made the decision to release this. The biggest reparation they could've made, and thankfully have as a company, was to totally disown P3 and mark Paradise Lost as the true successor in the P2/Apocalypse Weekend lineage, with Postal 4 continuing in a trend that they obviously know now is right. I can safely say, a thousand times over, if you really want a worthy sequel, give your money to these instead. If you buy this game, you are guaranteed disappointment. Playing with a zipper or a light switch is more gratifying.

column9: Sickening! I don't recommend it! Only if you really like it!

Bitch! (Dog) This is the best game in the world! There are no rules. The very first mission is such a disaster!!! You have to fucking douse zombies with gasoline and set them on fire. The second mission is just as bad. You have to first collect [strike] cum-filled napkins[/strike] in a vacuum cleaner, and then throw them at angry mothers! You can also walk up to someone and pee on them.

So. Over the course of the game, I've determined:
[h1]Pros:[/h1]
-Action set
-Storyline
-Voice acting (It's very original)
-Weapons set
-Personally, I found the credits interesting

[h1]Cons:[/h1]
-Not the voice acting itself, but its quality
-Graphics
-Physics (the main character mentioned this (yes, that happens))
Well, that's it, I guess. I hope this review was helpful.

column9:
I mean, no. Absolutely NO.
What a pile of garbage.
I don't know how you managed to lower the bar so much. This piece of crap is unplayable, with repetitive missions, and incredibly difficult, considering the shitty gameplay it has, because aiming or EVEN MOVING around the environment can be like watching a drunk, cross-eyed duck with Parkinson's disease running through a minefield (that's when the character doesn't bug out during cover and make you restart the whole damn mission because you can't even move). Seriously, please don't buy this. I was expecting something like Postal 2, a beautiful amalgam of gratuitous violence, dark humor, extremely simple and predictive gameplay, and a sandbox system of exploration and slaughter.
And what did I find? This. This CRAP.
NPCs tougher than Chuck Norris, a Postal Dude who can't aim at a guy two meters away without missing, a disgusting camera that makes you dizzy and points wherever it wants, a cover system that won't let you aim, bugs, and is disgusting, LINEAR missions, and more crap.
You know what?
Fuck you, Postal Dude 3. I'm going back to 2. To scrub.
