Postal 2 is an opportunity to commit massacre without provocation, and if you succumbed to such temptation, the game offered you various options for dismemberment, somewhat encouraging your genocidal tendencies.

Postal 3 is a struggle against temptations; it feels like it was made by people with little religious affiliation, because killing is forbidden. In one mission (I think it was the second), you're forbidden from shooting at all, and if you shoot, that's it, 10 minutes of your life are lost and you have to start over. To make it easier to understand what I mean, imagine if NFS Underground 2 forbade driving over 60 km/h and breaking traffic rules, even though the previous game didn't bother with these issues at all.

There's a branching plot here, and everyone reaches their own conclusion. I decided to play the game the way it wanted me to, i.e., Without killing anyone (i.e., playing as a cop), there were essentially missions where you had to commit genocide. But what upset me was that at the end of this storyline, another one immediately begins, playing for the bad guy, so to speak. It would be fine if it were a continuation, but no, it's a complete restart of the game. All the characters you killed suddenly give you missions again, and you get the same missions you had as a cop, but from a different perspective (you even keep your weapons).

I don't recommend this game just because of this point, but if you complete N% of the game, there will be plenty of missions where you have to commit massacre.

Even now that it's finally on sale for a very low price of 4.99 I still have to say that you should not spend money on this. Don't buy this game, get Postal 2 paradise lost instead. I'm getting a refund for this right now.

column8: why i m buy this game !

[b] This game is horrible. [/b]

And when I say horrible, I mean literally the worst game I have ever played, in my entire life.
Node graph errors occur every time you play this game, and you will always expect some sort of graphical issue when playing this title. Akella has ruined the macabre concept of the Postal Dude, getting a new voice actor, and removing jumping and replacing it with a faulty cover system.

Hell, the only way to have fun in this game is heavily mod it. The only realistic model in this game is of Postal Dude, with every single civilian appearing to be a cartoon character from a Disney film. Commanding Champ to take out enemies just straight up doesn't work, you are better off using the helper monkey which appears literally once in the game. The third person view is not that bad, but then you realize Akella probably did that to make the Postal series more like a GTA clone. 

The whole good/bad paths in the game do not mean anything. In a game where you can amputate a mans arm, throw it at another person, all while urinating on them, the game punishes you severely for doing anything close to bad. And if you select the good path, the game is no fun, whatsoever. Nobody confronts you (except Osama Bin Laden) and because the game is on rails, being wanted by the police means nothing. There isn't even a system that allows you to know you are wanted, you just do soemthing, and every single officer unloads on you. To make that worse, you can't evade them until you die.

The high note in this game is the weapons. I mean, a badger on a stick that you can have maul people to death, it's crazy. Krotchy doll nukes, the shop-vac, all were great ideas, but had a very poor execution.

The demo shown in 2007 had better graphics, gameplay, and overall feel than this game.
At best, this is something a college student would make in Unity3D. 3.5/10

column8:
Hoo boy, this one is comparable to Duke Nukem Forever in disappointment. I guess I'll go over the (very few) saving graces first like I usually do.

-Voiceover: Whilst Rick Hunter was unavailable during development, we got Cory Cruise as The POSTAL Dude this time around, who did an excellent job.
-Environments: Most of the textures and modelling make the environment feel closer to home with real life at times.

Well, there are more cons unfortunately...

-CTD: This game uses an older, more unstable version of the Source engine, and many of the game's features can crash the game for seemingly no reason at seemingly anytime. this includes grenades (maybe even all throwable weapons), fire (from what I've experienced), gibbing, and simply too much chaos.
-Missing Content: The game has some content missing from it such as certain sounds not playing correctly, broken scripts, and even a level monologue. the level of scripts missing is staggering, yet is simply disabled in the source code rather than not present at all.
-Issues: Ever wonder why some of the achievements don't trigger? that's because of some issues in the game's code. ever wonder why the kick along with most melee weapons are practically useless? issues in the code causing them to be aimed downward rather than forward. I could go over them all, but I don't have enough time for that.

All in all, POSTAL III was a flawed entry that left a bad taste in my mouth. now, there are many sources that could tell you all about the "where did it go wrong?" part of development, but all in all, I recommend you get POSTAL 2 or POSTAL 4: No Regerts instead. if you insist on grabbing this box of pink crap, I suggest grabbing a few improvement mods first. hope I helped.

This was massively dissapoinying, and i even knew what i was getting in to when i first staretd. *sigh*

i supose i ought to explain so:

 graphics are fine there is nothing i have problem with vidually (mayble blood effects but that ill adress later.)
physics : passable nothing to complain about
story : huh? like that ever mattered

and now on to important stuff
atmosphere sucks, there is something about catarsis that just dose not work for me, something that was there in Paradise i can not quite explain it but it feels like lesser coppy of previous attempt in postal 2.
combat mechanics are quite strange, i have had problems landing mele attacks, whener i managed to do so it never felt like it was something i did that made the attack land it seemed to me as tho it was chance. in here i would like to adress blood effect which managed to fail at being overexadurated squirts as in P2 but allso fell short of being reasonible representation of what i assume blood squirts would look like in real life as result of that one of main draws of previous two games is just not fun annymore. look if you are doing game with main focus on gross humor and carnage you must make them fun damit!

charakters of player and nonplayer origin are allso falling short of mark, honestly this feels like  fan made mod than proper game.

sorry RWS this one is a failure

column8:
[h1]I regret everything[/h1]
[b]Postal |||[/b] fue el primer videojuego de [b]Running with Scissors[/B] en distribuirse en la plataforma [b]Steam[/b] , este juego [b]sufre[/b] de una [b]discriminaci√≥n[/b] de parte de la comunidad de [I][b]Postal[/b][/i] y de sus creadores, al momento que analise este juego en [b]2015[/b] estaba algo mal informado de ciertos aspectos fundamentales de este juego y en este an√°lisis los explicar√©.

[h1]innovar, ¬øno siempre es bueno?[/h1]

Postal 3 en se comenz√≥ a desarrollar en alrededor de [b]Inicios del 2006[/b], por una estudio llamado [b]Trashmasters[/b] que ven√≠a de la mano de [b]Akella[/b] empresas [b]rusas[/b] que se acercaron a RWS para desarrollar Postal 3, ¬øque podr√≠a salir mal? [b]es el a√±o 2008[/b], pasa uno de los eventos m√°s importantes del mundo la [url=https://es.wikipedia.org/wiki/Crisis_financiera_de_2008]crisis financiera[/url] Akella se queda sin dinero y no le queda otra opci√≥n que despedir al grupo de desarrolladores, el proyecto pasa al grupo B, despu√©s despiden al grupo C, y as√≠ sucesivamente, el juego ten√≠a planeado lanzarse en [b]2008-2009[/b] sufri√≥ varios retrasos hasta que akella se qued√≥ sin dinero en 2011, se qued√≥ sin dinero y el juego se lanz√≥ en ese mismo a√±o como un √∫ltimo intento de Akella de generar ingresos.

[h1]No es tan malo como ustedes creen... ¬øO si?[/h1]

Bueno en esta entrega controlamos a [b]Postal Dude [/b] otravez despu√©s de los eventos de [b][I]Postal 2:Apocalypse Weekend [/I][/b] , la mec√°nica y la idea son las mismas pero hay que tomar en cuenta un punto muy importante, [b]Postal 2 corr√≠a en Unreal engine 2[/b] que si esta algo anticuado para los tiempos que corren daba la posibilidad de dar la sensaci√≥n de mundo abierto, punto fuerte para que fuera un √©xito, [b]Postal 3 corre en Source[/b] Motor gr√°fico en cual corren juegos como [b]Half-Life 2 y Left 4 Dead[/b] ambos juegos lineales, esta no es la excepci√≥n, si bien los escenarios son m√°s detallados que en el 2, son m√°s peque√±os que en Paradise.

[h1]Un juego Lineal, con sistema de Karma[/h1]

Llegamos a una ciudad llamada [b]Catharsis[/b], ciudad en la cual llega en b√∫squeda de Gas, dinero y poco despu√©s a Champ, la historia es floja, s√≥lo te dejan un par de misiones con objetivos muy espec√≠ficos con [b] una inteligencia bastante floja[/B], durante el trayecto hay un [b]sistema de karma[/b] que influir√° mucho en el juego, bueno realmente muy poco, solo son las mismas misiones con un par de cambios aqu√≠ y all√°, nada relevante, en el juego hay 2 caminos, [b]el camino bueno y el camino loco[/B], algo que no tiene l√≥gica viniendo de un juego donde puedes tomar un camino u otro no influ√≠a o no ten√≠as persecuci√≥nes, (o muy pocas).
El camino que tomes influir√° al final del juego ya que dependiendo te que camino tomes ser√° el final que te toque.

[h1]Gears of Postal[/h1]

La jugabilidad del juego es algo tosca y poco responsiva, [b] la mirilla del juego aveces parece estar de adorno[/B], el modo de apuntar es est√°ndar, la manera de correr y cubrirse esta calcada de [b]Gears of War[/b], es literal el mismo movimiento solo que ejecutado en un juego Source, ¬øque rayos estaban pensando? Y ¬øporque?, a igual que en Gears of War, en este juego [b]no se puede saltar independientemente[/B], algo que limita, bastante la exploraci√≥n, algo que en la entrega pasada se te recompensaba bastante.

[h1]Un cat√°logo de armas algo peculiar[/h1]

Las armas en Postal 3 [b]se controlan poco y tienen poco poder[/B] con algunas excepciones, la M16 y la Sierra Tejon son de lo mejor la √∫ltima muy disfrutable pero en varias misiones le sufres bastante porque los enemigos traen armas en una pelea de pu√±os, y hablando de los pu√±os...
[b]Dios mio con el combate cuerpo a cuerpo[/b], da pena, no responde como debe, es aburrido, y no se disfruta del nada. Simplemente no funciona, no puedo creer que sean tan Incompetentes de implementarlo como se debe.

[h1]Postal III: The Aftermath[/h1]

Empeze hablando sobre el desarrollo del juego porque muchos creen que Postal 3 es odiado por sus propios due√±os, este no es el caso, [b]Vince Desi[/b] dijo en un [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zlLr8e-QESY&index=2&list=PLzm2jHdsIATtuSXV4WbyFz3kY1wfRKJzc&t=1009s&ab_channel=RunningWithScissors]podcast[/url] de Junio del 2016 que tienen el c√≥digo, el detalle es que esta todo en ruso y el est√° dispuesto arreglar el juego si hay bastantes personas que dominen el idioma y colaboren para arreglarlo, todo esto qued√≥ en que era posible, siempre cuando se cuente con el apoyo suficiente.

[h1] ¬øQue paso con Rick Hunter?[/h1]

[b]Rick Hunter[/b] es la voz original de los 2 primeros juegos del Postal Dud√©, en este juego no lo incluyeron por motivos personales, en ese caso invitaron a [b]Cory Cruise[/b], para hacerles honestos su trabajo me encant√≥ y para mi ser√° el segundo Postal Dude. 
Fuente:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gu2i0bd8XnQ&

[H1]Conclusi√≥n[/h1]

[b]Postal 3[/b], fue una mala decisi√≥n de RWS, dejando el desarrollo, a manos de una empresa Rusa a la que e o√≠do era el equivalente de [b] Electronic Arts[/b] en Rusia, en mi opini√≥n no creo que sea el peor videojuego del mundo si no s√≥lo una mala decisi√≥n de una empresa, a√±os despu√©s RWS Lanzar√≠a [b]Postal 2: Paradise Lost[/b] como una forma de decir perd√≥n a los fans que estaban tan ilusionados por este proyecto, ahora RWS apost√≥ por Unreal Engine 4 y Lanz√≥ Postal 4: No Regerts Como acceso anticipado en Steam con las mismas ideas y con la misma mec√°nica del 2, la verdadera secuela que deb√≠o haber existido.

I enjoyed it and all these people can say my mind is just out there for liking such a trainwreck of a video game but I enjoyed it and thats what matters the most

column8:
Postal 2 won't go down in history as one of the greatest games of all time. It probably won't even make the average top 500 list. That said, I thought it was very entertaining. When it comes to Postal III, I'm at a loss for words. I'd prefer to write a positive review, describing in detail on how this game improved on its predecessor. If necessary, I could write a negative review, filled to the brim with reasons as to why I believe this product to be a disappointing sequel. Instead, I'm staring into the abyss.

The Postal Dude is at it again. After blazing a trail of death and destruction through the town of Paradise, he finds himself in Catharsis. Madcap mayhem and wacky hijinks await as Postal Dude tries to find a paying job. Will you somehow find the light of virtue within yourself? Or will you once again submit to your demons, using murder to solve every minor dilemna? Whatever the case, you're sure to be in for a great time. This game also stars Ron Jeremy and Jennifer Walcott. I'm surprised that Lloyd Kaufman didn't make an appearance as well.

This entry uses a morality system. Unfortunately, this doesn't mean The Postal Dude will be helping old ladies cross the street (or into woodchippers). Basically, if you want to be the good guy, you have to abide by the law. Naturally, this requires that you become a police officer, and make the law your own. While this doesn't give you a free pass to endanger innocent lives, at least you're doing your part to make Catharsis a safer(?) place. If that sounds like too much trouble, you can always be evil incarnate. This will result in different levels, and eventually a bad ending, if you don't change your ways. If eternal damnation doesn't appeal to you, there's always the handy taser gun. Non-lethal takedowns slowly add up, allowing you another opportunity to join the force when you complete the level. Unfortunately, the possibility exists that your morality, will be at the mercy of the game itself.

While I applaud the writers for their attempt at injecting more story into the Postal saga, things stop making sense very early on. I suppose this can be attributed to the fact that I had to skip stages in order to progress. Let me rephrase that: I had to cheat* just to complete this game. Aside from the high probability of crashes, there are numerous scripting issues. Some doors are scripted to open when an event occurs. For reasons that can surely be attributed to the troubled development of the game, these scripts frequently break. 

To give an example: Shortly after I joined the force, I was tasked with eliminating the homeless that were running rampant through the police station. Eventually I reached a point where a door was supposed to open, but it didn't. I could see the enemy's guns clipping through the door, but there was nothing I could do about it. I restarted the level, which fixed it. However, there was another door later on in the level, and it had the exact same issue. This happened again in another level, where I was supposed to go to the mall, the doors simply wouldn't open. 

Unlocking all of the stages in Postal III via cheats is a simple task, but that isn't the point. All that work I did trying to be a good Postal Dude? Gone. Putting difficulty aside, when a game can't be completed without resorting to cheats, that means it is broken.

Postal III tends to feel like busy-work. Most of the levels start off with an extremely boring job, which fits in with the story. After a short time, things get crazy when Soccer Moms or Savage Nerds or Eco-Terrorists or ???? show up. This is the point where you have to kill/subdue a certain number of them so that the level will end. Postal 2's strength wasn't in standard FPS mechanics. A lot of the entertainment came from using the sandbox aspects. It was a game designed around finding different solutions for everyday problems (sometimes without murder). With Postal III, almost the entirety of the product involves shooting, and it is very poorly-handled. The Postal Dude can take cover, but it's so ineffective you're sometimes better off standing out in the open. On the bright side, the enemy AI is so bad they're liable to ignore or even forget about you in the heat of combat. The levels that don't require the player to deal with x amount of enemies, tend to be really linear slogs. There are even escort missions, as if players wouldn't have enough reasons to hate this game. 

Aside from severe technical faults such as long load times and poor performance, Postal III also suffers from awful mechanics. Melee is basically useless. Even the heavier weapons, like the fire ax, don't work all that well. One of the items you acquire is a laser pointer, for leading Champ (your dog) to enemies. It is complete trash. The same can be said about most of Postal III's weapons. There's no real incentive to play with them, because they either don't work, or just aren't satisfying. Typically, the average Postal III play-through is going to revolve entirely around shooting everything. It gets old very quickly. Urinating is no longer infinite either. The Postal Dude can't piss as much as he wants, now he has to wait for his bladder to refill. Yes, it's probably an unnecessary thing to complain about, but it's still a nonsensical change that adds nothing to the game. Everything about Postal III is worse than its prequel...Everything**.

Some of you reading this review might not care about Postal. You might even think "It's a garbage franchise anyway. Who cares?" Well, it's just my opinion, but I liked the second game. It was crass, offensive, and sometimes the humor fell absolutely flat. Yet underneath all of the nastiness, there is still a game. Postal III is broken, and is more prone to cause headaches than provide any entertainment value. The multitude of bugs, scripting failures, and generally unfun game-design, make for a forgettable entry in this controversial series.

*While I did cheat to complete a couple stages, I didn't actually try to skip any. 
**The soundtrack is pretty decent.

column8: wtf i didnt even buy it

If the president played this, there would be another Cold War.

Seriously though this game is dog shit, for one the weapons are terrible and inaccurate. The missions are also terrible, they play more like Apocalypse Weekend where you have to do a repetitive activity a few times until you can progress instead of like Postal 2 where you go somewhere and do an errand like "get milk" you can choose a few ways to do it (i.e buy the milk or go guns blazing) and maybe something goes wrong (like robbers showing up at the bank). The morality system is dumb and discourages playing how you want like in postal 2, instead you pick one way and have to stick to it the whole the game. 

The game is also filled with outdated references and internet memes which will do nothing but make you cringe, the memes are also on the loading screens which are another issue, countless loading screens that take forever. Postal 2 had loading but that is an unreal 2 game from 2003, those loading screens are also way faster and don't feel the need to slap jokes on the screen.

Even the developers of the first two games discourage buying this, don't do it, buy Postal 2.

column8:
Not nearly as bad as everyone says, it's damn fun actually. After all, Postal 2 was nothing like Postal 1.

It may take a while for you to get to the great Run N Gun action this game offers, but it's there.
Some of the eralier missions can be boring, but if you know what to do they'll fly by.
Hell, there's even an in depth choices to give you branching quest lines. I'd suggest dodging between them to get the maximum gameplay value. Twenty dollars is a little pricey for something the devs don't support anymore, but if you're open minded it's worth a try. 

Pretty original with it's wacky story, even if some of the humor falls flat. Such as over usage of the word retarded in the stupidest of ways. The duded may not be just like his old, asocial asexual self from the last game. but he's still pretty good. Now he's a white-trash meme loving dead beat with shitty luck. He's deffinetly more layed back and not much of a psycho.

The game has great music, even if it does end up looping a couple times in each level, but it's mostly one song for each level so it's pretty good. Oddly serious and good music on the tutorial, fairly surprising and uneeded.

The game is crappy yet incredibly fun, and it know it. Almost has a saints row 3 feel, with how it doesn't take itself seriously. It has a lower-class outsider dark humor to it, which works in its favor. Honnestly, as a white-trash dead beat I find the postal dude relateable for the most part, with how he's scorned by everyone and's always an outsider.

Over all, the game is a 7/10. Not a huge winner, but it's pretty dang original.

Also, I became god of the tabby-cats. By the end of the game, I had about thirty of them. This makes me very happy, considering I choose to save them all, hoping I could make them my army.

Edit: Jesus christ above, I don't know what I was smoking when I wrote this review but let's just pretend it's ironic
column9:
Not nearly as bad as everyone says, it's damn fun actually. After all, Postal 2 was nothing like Postal 1.

It may take a while for you to get to the great Run N Gun action this game offers, but it's there.
Some of the eralier missions can be boring, but if you know what to do they'll fly by.
Hell, there's even an in depth choices to give you branching quest lines. I'd suggest dodging between them to get the maximum gameplay value. Twenty dollars is a little pricey for something the devs don't support anymore, but if you're open minded it's worth a try. 

Pretty original with it's wacky story, even if some of the humor falls flat. Such as over usage of the word retarded in the stupidest of ways. The duded may not be just like his old, asocial asexual self from the last game. but he's still pretty good. Now he's a white-trash meme loving dead beat with shitty luck. He's deffinetly more layed back and not much of a psycho.

The game has great music, even if it does end up looping a couple times in each level, but it's mostly one song for each level so it's pretty good. Oddly serious and good music on the tutorial, fairly surprising and uneeded.

The game is crappy yet incredibly fun, and it know it. Almost has a saints row 3 feel, with how it doesn't take itself seriously. It has a lower-class outsider dark humor to it, which works in its favor. Honnestly, as a white-trash dead beat I find the postal dude relateable for the most part, with how he's scorned by everyone and's always an outsider.

Over all, the game is a 7/10. Not a huge winner, but it's pretty dang original.

Also, I became god of the tabby-cats. By the end of the game, I had about thirty of them. This makes me very happy, considering I choose to save them all, hoping I could make them my army.

Edit: Jesus christ above, I don't know what I was smoking when I wrote this review but let's just pretend it's ironic

column8:
It's not ENTIRELY terrible. If you can snag it at below $10 you'll find it's just as delightfully offensive as Postal 2. That being said, it has  LOT of shortcomings compared to Postal 2 (like the lack of an open world and SUPER terribad optimization issues), but after my time with it, I'd say "eh, it's still fun to taze monkeys, cats, dogs, and people and then pee on them before riding off on a segway to protect mayor Ron Jeremy because he's running for president (I think, I don't really remember, things were so crazy).

Unfortunately you WILL have to reload the game a lot because of bugged missions, and you WILL hate the dumbass morality meter (which sometimes doesn't seem to work), but overall, it's offensively innoffensive with a fun arsenal of weapons and the same complete disdain for the player and the world that characterizes Postal.

I only recommend it on a DEEP price cut, however.

column8: Horribly buggy and unstable, but damn, it manages to be fun to play around with the varied arsenal going from your average pistol, shotgun and assault rifle to a bee hive and a machete. Too bad there is no true open world like in Postal II where you could f*ck around.

Postal III is a janky, barely functional mess that has none of the charm, character, or fun of Postal 2. Running With Scissors had little to do with this game and it shows. The game runs like shit (if you can get it running at all), and the first person, open world nature of the second game is replaced with boring, medicore, third-person cover based shooting. Oh yeah, don't forget everyone's favorite: A shallow binary moral choice system! Going around on rampages is still somewhat fun, but there is no heart or soul in this game. If you are an abosule, diehard Postal fan, pick it up on sale as cheap as you can if you're into some casual masochism. Otherwise avoid like the plague.

Also, fuck the Postal Dude's new voice.

column8:
As a diehard fan of the real Postal games, it's very difficult for me to think of any redeeming qualities of Postal III.

Many know this already, but for those who don't, Postal III is not the creation of Running With Scissors. It was licensed to Akella in hopes of developing a next generation Postal game, but thanks to the Russian recession Akella went bankrupt and all developmental work went to a fledgling "b-team." The results were catastrophic, as what was once intended to be an open ended and graphically impressive Postal became a bug-ridden mess. 

Although its price can never be justified even at 50% off, I will say that for those who already own it, two things about this game are decent. First is the free-roam feature that is unlocked after completing those horrid story missions. If you really can't stand playing through it, which few can, there are ways to bypass the missions that a simple Google search will yield. The free-roam itself is mediocre, as there are few things to do but walk around and slaughter a few civilians until the game crashes, but it's much more rewarding than the series of tutorials that constitute the main game.

The second feature worth mentioning was a joke that occurred... I'd say about halfway through the game, where the Alternative Postal Dude is approaching a building being held up by rather incompetent shooters. In the midst of the inaccurate bullet fest, a peacekeeper attempts to approach the building only to have his head blown off. The Postal Dude then exclaims, "holy s***, did they level up?" It made me laugh, anyways.

That's really all that's worth experiencing in Postal III. You're much better off paying a fraction of Postal III's price to own the real Postal games.

column8:
So fucking disappointed in this game. Don't get me wrong, I loved the first two Postal games but this one is hands down one of the worst games I've ever played. It's Sonic '06 level bad people. Basically the game throws you into 3-4 minute load screens and that's not even the worst of it. Sure, you can run around and kill whoever and whatever you want, but the missions are all, and I mean every goddamn one, is a kill this many people or keep this many protesters at bay. There's nothing else to this game.

Still want to play? Enjoy the worst voice acting I have ever heard and somehow, the graphics look worse than Postal II. The gameplay and weapons are all grotesque, and not in a good way. The "sick humor" is about as sick as my dying veteran, grandpa, bland and just lies there laughing to himself like a four year old that finds the word "booger" to be the funniest thing ever. Can't believe I wasted my money on this and I wish I could get a refund and afford to see a therapist about this game.

column8:
the postal game that RWS technicaly dousen't own

I'm a RWS fan, and I respect Vince Desi, so it pains me to say - don't buy this game. if you have to find out what its like, find someone who has it and play their copy for 15 minuets. find a lets-play, do something, just don't buy this game. this is a train wreck and everyone knows it. 

Unless something changed in the past two years RWS is not even making money off this because of the shady coding house they did business with to produce this. that company gutted the script, gutted the features and hurried the alpha out the door as a final game and screwed Running With Sissors out of the rights to the code. 

this is an official game but one that RWS can't support and likely a game that they are not making a dime off of. wait for the next chapter of the game because I'm sure the postal dude will dismiss this one as the nightmare it is. Like mario's dream that was Super Mario Bros 2, Postal III might as well not exist in the catalog of this franchise.

I do no exagerate in saying that this game is completely broken, unbalenced and not fun. a total waste of $20

buyer be ware- This is a steaming pile!

column8:
The game is buggy, broken & sometimes unplayable.  

I get to around chapter 3 & can't progress any further because of constant crashes or glitches.  The game hasn't seen any fixes either.  I honestly can't recommend this game unless one day the devs decide it's worth fixing.  Even then the humor is tasteless & might have been funny or offensive in the early/late 90's.  Now, it's just childish & sad really.

If they ironed out the bugs it would be a decent 3rd person toilet humor shooter but with all the bugs, glitches, crashes & other problems the game has it's just a chore to try and play through it.

I got this game when it came out, too.  What a waste of money.

column8:
When I first bought this game I came straight from postal 2 and i thought it was a utter waste of money and I hated it like everyone else.  I came back months later and it is still extremely buggy and crashes often but nonetheless the game itself was really fun.  Everyone expects something like the Paradise lost DLC for postal 2, but this game is not that but instead took the series in a entirely different direction.  Once I stopped expecting another postal 2 and actually treated the game as something of it's own rather than a replicate of the previous game, I enjoyed it very much.  Yeah, there are bugs and the game crashes sometimes frequently, it doesn't make it not enjoyable by any means.  I would recommend this game to anyone that isn't looking for a postal 2 clone.  If you want a postal 2 clone go for the DLC they made and not this game.  

Ignore all the comments with people less than an hour who got the game uninstalled it and raged in the comments.  They were all hoping for a postal 2 clone, this is not that.

8/10 (would be 10/10 if the game didn't crash)

After I bought Postal 2, i saw that there was a third one and it had modern-day graphics and i thought that was pretty cool and then I saw all the negative reviews except for the literally only postive review and i thought to myself, hmmm I wonder how bad this game is? Seeing as how the second one was badass and amazingly better than some of the AAA games we get served today, so i bought it, played it and beat it, and now i now why this game is slandered, even RWS has given up on this trainwreck but before i trash this game more i have to say there are parts of this game that are good but far from being awesome.

Like my review of Postal 2, this review will broken down in the same areas

Gameplay, Graphics, Sound and most importantly Story

Warning: this is my opinon and if anything offends you, i deeply apolgize

Gameplay 5/10: the overall gmeplay isn't all to bad, the controls aren't bad but they are a big difference from its predecessor, the main control feature i like about this game is you don't have to use the mouse scroll for changing your guns, you can now use X and C for that which for me (being a console gamer for 16 years) is a big up for me since i'm still new to the PC controls. The game praises it's so called "advanced AI" but in reality the so-called "advanced AI" isn't so advanced unless advanced AI means running in your line of fire and killing all the "advanced AI" in like two seconds

Graphics 6/10: the graphics of this game are not that bad but also not that good for a game that was realeased in 2011. there are times where the graphics acutally look complete and then other times your face palming with more regert than Patrick Stewert.

Sound 8/10: this is the only department that this game did good in. The BGM of this game is amazing, the only time the BGM is bad, is that it is stuck in a never-ending loop, so in the longer levels in the game it starts to become a ear ache. The sound F/X of this game is why the sound gets an 8 out of 10 instead of being a perfect score, the gun noises in this aren't as realistic as they were Postal 2, but they aren't horrible either, at least they are actually sounds instead of one guy making "pew-pew" noises.

Story 6/10: the only reason this game's story did better than Postal 2 is because it's more of a linear based game, so there is more room for story, but the main reason ot only did a point better was becasue it's story was all over the f***ing place, when i finally beat the game, i had no f***ing idea what the f*** happend, the story has more holes in it than swiss cheese or a Micheal Bay movie (uggh don't get me started on him)

Overall 4.5/10: Overall this game needs A LOT more work and if it was developed on for a little bit longer (i'd say like two more years) it may have been a better game but I personally think that it should have been the exact same game as the second but with a new story and graphics like Halo 3. (ahhh if only) But before i go, the nic people over at Anthology Production, are making a mod for Postal 2, and it's basically taking Postal 3 and putting it into the engine of the second game and more! So i cannot wait for it to come out. so as you can see I do NOT reccomend this game but if you really want to play this s***ty game than wait for that mod.

If you like better than Duke Nukem Humor, then you will enjoy this game. If you thought Postal 2 was good, this one is even better. More sex, humor, gore, I mean whats not to like.

Pros: Good Jokes, Gore, Sexual Humor & Themes, Dismemberment, all out mayhem as long as you can stay alive.

Cons: Is loaded with bugs, the occasional load screen freeze, So Save often. 

Other than the bugs, its a good game to kill time, and if your looking for a good laugh, buy it. 
Is it worth the $20? Not really, best to buy it when it goes on sale.

column8:
What can I say that would do Postal Triple justice?
Huge let down?
Sucks ass?
Complete bullshit?

No, none of these do justice to what a failure this game was. Hyped, hyped and hyped, but ultimately it is trying to mimic Duke Nukem Forever, which we all know is not a good thing. It tried to build off of contraversary and it failed miserably. The game is more or less just a constant "look at me! Satire!" mess endorsed by Ron Jeremy.

Take my advice, don't buy this game. It's a buggy mess, the story is laughable and not in the funny way the developers want you to think, and on top of that, it's just not fun.

Generally that's what counts: the game isn't fun. Physics make for unfun combat, wonky AI makes for unfun enemies, unfunny story makes for unfun experience.

column8:
* Well to sum it up, the problem of this game is that is just plain boring, it fails to recapture the ridicolous morbid fun of its predecessor. 
* The graphics are good, it runs on Source Engine and looks alright to me, although there some mighty performance glitches with frame rate dropping.
* The open world is there partially, but you cannot complete missions as you like but have to stick to the main story line. 
* You revisit the outdoor locations several times during the game, which gets repetitive and the task you get are one stereotype.
* You collect something, then all of sudden there is a riot by some of the minorities or some other group of extremists, which you have to eliminate.
* You cannot get inside any building, you can take a look indoors only during missions, which is a nice change of pace, then you go back outside to one of the three main locations: downtown of city, mexican border or some kind of farm.
* I loved Postal 2 for not being the perfect game, but for trying not to be convetional and yet entertaining, but this one just couldn't hold up its potential.

The sounds are rancid, the controls are broken, the glitches are nasty, the camera has tourette's, the story is fucking stupid, the new postal dude style is so fucking ginger, the new voice is something to frown upon, the music is garbage and random, the cast is meh, the menus are bland as shit, the weapon choice is so shitty, the frame rate is worse than the Xbox one; need i say more? Not only is this a failure of a Postal game, but this is one of the worst games i have honestly ever played in my entire life. I never in my entire life uninstalled a game 1 hour in. There is not single positive thing about this game at all. It does not deserve the title of Postal and now i can see why Urinating on the Postal 3 case in Postal 2 gets you an achievement. Even Running With Scissors acknowledges that it's a shitty ass game, and that's why they continue to update Postal 2 and pretend Postal 3 is just some spin off.

Do not buy this piece of shit unless you either
A. Want to play a game that is the equivalent to Foodfight! on Heroin.
B. Want to play a game to torture yourself from start to finish.
C. Want to buy it for someone else to make them contemplate suicide.
              (that's actually how i got this game)

So please, don't fucking waste your time with this piece of shit shitted from another piece of shit.

column8:
I didn't really have my hopes high when I got this, but I'd say it was a positive surprise.
Ambience is just great, like in Postal2. 
I love the way you can handle problems, you can actually choose to do things differently in this game.
So far, the only things I've disliked is that Postal Dudes voice character could have done a bit better work, but it works. Also it is bit lame, that third game of the franchise has the same sayings that Postal2 has.

But, it's a Postal game. It's not supposed to be pretty. It's supposed to be fucked up. And that's how I like it.
5/5, because in which other game do you get to shoot people with cumstains?

I am running a good system but I have had nothing but trouble playing this game.(you dont need a super computer to run it)

1.Lagging very bad that the game is unplayable.
2.Unexpected game stops???
3.Freezing in certain places and it does not recover.
4.The achievement made are not all on the steam account???
5.Graphics just freeking out and changing to mad colours.
6.Sound sometimes goes into a loop.sticky
7.Transfer and loading is laggy and sticks but it recovers (but not always)

One problem is OK but seven..not on.

I do not recommend this game,I have played the other Postal games with no problems but this one is very bad.
You would actually think it would be much better.I was hoping it would be better.

Not happy waisted money on it.lucky it was a reduced price.

Stop Running With Scissors and walk.

Okay, let's stroke the elephant in the room. Just grab on, and give it a stroke.

I honestly believe that the Russian Dev group really tried to make this a great game.

And, really, it's close to it. 

However, it falls short. I'll attempt to tell you why, in very few words.

This has the feel of a proper Postal game. Moreover, it's got the voice and design of what should be a postal game.
Where it falls short is crappy code.

It jerks when it should fug. Really, it's a system hog, and unless you are cheating in Godmode, and notarget, it's almost unplayable. Yet, if you do figure out how to enable those, you will see what this game could be, and almost IS.

The hilarious scenarios are there, as are the ridiculous weapons and characters. Plus, there is a split in the story where you decide to be good or evil. The problem is that the gameplay is just retardedly difficult. Not only because of the sheer number of MASSIVELY respawning opponents, but the jerky, unavoidable video issues. With the highest specs, you will still discover horrible curse words you never remembered learning spouting like a turettes volcano from your twitching lips as you desperately try to navigate the horrible issues crippling this diamond in the rough.

Yet...as I've mentioned, if you just give in, and pull a cheat or two (there's even a workaround for steam achievements), you will discover pure joy in this bastard child of the already black sheep of the gaming community.

I will refrain from describing any scenarios in detail, as your experience will differ depending on your personal bent, as it should be. So, wait for a sale (I waited for a year to get it at 50%), and find the cheat. Then, you will giggle your ass off, and hopefully, experience a little of what the guys intended. 

Honestly, it's worth the hassle. It's a shame that RWS isn't making money from it, but hopefully, one day, they will get access to the code, and make it what it should be.

Until then, get it cheap, get some cheats, and laugh your ass off at what is very close to a wonderful slice of Postal history.

I'm fugging loving it.

I love Postal 2! And I loved the humor and story of Postal 3. The only thing why I dont recommend this is the lackluster gameplay and the several technical Issues.

Pros:

+ its Postal through and through, Sex , Violence, Racism, Animal Abuse and tons of other stuff that made this franchise famous
+ the story is pretty funny
+ many new and old weapons to choose from
+ a new city to explore
+ some celebrity characters
+ great sense of humor and satire
+ multiple paths to choose from, that actually change things up


Cons:

- on a technical side the game is a complete mess. So many bugs,glitches and crashes, I will point out the worst one by one
- a bug caused one of my save games to crash on being loaded.....that pissed me off so much since I was far into the game
- ALL the mlee weapons are absolutley useless.....you cant hit anything because they are so extremley poorly programmed - hit detection is a absurd
- 3rd person view is pointless and even worse can trigger bugs and camera glitches.......why not stick with first person? This is a major downer!
- ranged weapons feel way off when aiming, you can hit your targets but it just feels so bad to aim
- gasoline is buggy and doesnt work like in postal 2, you cant pour it onto people anymore, they have to walk on the ground you¬¥re pouring at (like I said, many special weapons are buggy)
- way too many missions stick to the same formular - horde shooter where you have to take out certain people
- many random crashes
- you cant mount a cat on a gun -_-  seriously whos decision was it to remove this feature? Its like one of the most iconic things in Postal 2!
- the explorable city is pretty small, there isnt much to actually do, I expected some kind of funny mini games, there are funny arcade cabins, but they are only cosmetic.....how disappointing
- the enemy AI is none-existent.......they are so incredibly incompetent at doing anything
- and like I said....many many bugs in missions and scripted events

Oh Postal.....I loved the second one, and the humor and one liners are back....but with such a horrible gameplay mechanics thats its barely playable. I played through the good campaign and it crashed too much on the bad campaign and I deinstalled in rage. If this gets waaaaay lower in price I can recommend this to a hardcore fan, other than that keep away from this.

column8:
Terribad.

Nothing like Postal 2, the controls are clunky as shit, and there are SO MANY LOADING SCREENS. Seriously, there is one stage where its just you in a room waiting to push a button, be prepared for many many one off scenes like this. There is no real explorable world to mess with, its just isolated scenes you do a single mission per scene.

The combat, holy fucking christ the combat, how do you mess something like that up ? Theres a scene where you fight these crazy soccer moms, but "making them leave" is almost impossible as they seem to take 10 fully charged stun gun shots and NOTHING HAPPENS. The vagueness in the combat system and missions are laughable at best and after so long get annoying as hell. This is also the first game I have encountered where the crosshairs are completely useless, so that is another gem of a fuck up to add to the ongoing list of fail this game has.

Just buy postal 2 and forget this game came out until RWS decides to make their own kick ass addition to the series instead of this outsourced joke of a "game".

*UPDATE* Another thing to note: I beat this game in 10 hours, and it only took 10 hours cause i am an achievement slut who will waste lots of free time on any achieve if its there. So this is maybe an 8 hour game at most.

column8: Horrible, horrible game. I like Postal 1 and really enjoy Postal 2. The open endedness is what I especially enjoy and it's totally missing in Postal 3. I played for a short while, to the part where I'm supposed to pick up "used" tissues. It was at this point I realized the entire game was going to be like this; they stick you in an area with a specific goal and can't do anything else. It's more like a bunch of mini-games. Totally dissappointed and regret spending money for this game.

column8: I sure enjoyed Postal 2... Now there's a Postal 3 on the Source Engine! The trailers and gameplay look cool, nothing too serious just messing around. Is this game worth buying? No. Not at all. Back when this was first released the publishers of this game released it early by mistake (a month!) later on the game was re-released a few months later. It was a complete disaster. The steam version is in Russian, and there is no legit or 'legal' way should I say to get this game into English. The game is very buggy, very poor performance and frame rate issues, clunky controls, the game is just bad. Don't buy it. Ever.

column8:
I would not say this game is bad. It is rather good, but if you are looking for a new version of Postal 2, then sorry, but this game is not what you are looking for.
  But why is it not like Postal 2 and feels so... Dissapointing and unfinished comparing to Postal 2? Let's compare those games. First of all, the old postal two was sort of a soup made of chaos, blood, gore and insanity as a topping. And the whole soup was made in a bowl of some weak law system. That game was finished. It felt so complete and just complex enough. It was a great game and my favourite game since childhood. I was very excited when I saw this game come out. It was so promissing. But when I actually got it and played it, something felt wrong about it. It is still a great and fun game, but for me it is not ''Postal''. It is much more sane, even too sane to be honoust. It is VERY short, it has much less black humor in it. Gosh! I miss those fat ladies showing their middle finger and moving their jaw weirdly as they speak. Now it is not as insane, not as chaotic and above all, it is not a fee roam game. Personally, I prefer Postal 2 to this one. This game just feels like a ''lesser'' copy of Postal 2 that has less of everything but graphics. Controls are kind of overly complicated. Characters are not as dumb and mean as they used to be. 
  If you never played Postal 2 or wish to play a cheap and good shooter with some dirtyness and black humor in it, this is the perfet game for you.
  But if you are looking for a game that feels just like Postal 2, that has this chaotic insane spirit that Postal 2 had, I would reccomend you to rather spend 50$ to buy Dead Rising 3. That game feels so much like Postal 2. 

I would say this game does worth it's money, but not a cent more than it's price.

column8: Unfortunately for RWS, this game was really badly developed and completely unoptimized. It's not their fault as they handed the development off to a russian company that started having financial troubles and had to lay off their prime team because they couldn't afford to pay them anymore. Instead, they fell back to the backup team which couldn't handle most of the intended design, and the game had to be extensively redesigned to accomodate their lack of experience and skill. I believe the company has completely shut down now, and won't give RWS the source code so they could properly clean it up and perfect it. Instead, RWS has chosen to abandon this horrible game, and resume working on Postal 2. Buy that instead, don't waste your money on this game! (they're working on a new DLC for Postal 2 right now!)

column8:
It‚Äôs not fair to say that the darkness consumed me, for it was I who enveloped myself in it, there was no coercion involved, only my own maddened curiosity. Another Postal game was released? Well, the second one was charming in that somewhat difficult to explain way that not very good games sometimes are, and it was on sale for a tenner, what could I possibly lose?
Sometimes in the quiet hours of the night, when it seems not even God is there to hear me, I ask myself what I could have saved had I never clicked ‚ÄòAdd to Cart‚Äô. It‚Äôs more than the ten dollars, what I lost that day transcends the mere balancing of a checkbook, when I played this game the concepts of love, of faith in my fellow man, the very knowledge of any pleasures I had once known all fled from me in an instant.

	I wish I could chalk my dislike of this game up to the awful controls, the movement clunkier than a 50‚Äôs movie robot or the aiming that I can only describe as ‚Äòacrid‚Äô, like the breath of a drunken pirate manning the cannons of his schooner, the fearsome ‚ÄòNobody Will Ever Love You‚Äô. I can‚Äôt though, much like an iceberg made of solid human feces it goes much deeper than the surface problems. I didn‚Äôt even come across anything that offensive in my two-hour waterboarding session with Postal 3, I know that‚Äôs exactly what it‚Äôs meant to do, and it succeeds with a lot of people, but it just fell flat. The limp and lifeless writing, which is exactly what it permanently rendered certain parts of my body, is the most grotesque thing here aside from the animations and cutscenes. All of this combines to form some sort of chimera of awful design that leaves an unpleasant taste in your mouth that has nothing to do with the attempted gross out humor involving vacuum cleaners and AIDS infected cats.

	In the end, it all just tries so hard to elicit some kind of response, positive or negative, from the player, but much like God on the day this game was released, it simply left me feeling apathetic.

column8:
After so many years, Postal 3 is released... BUT... by the aptly named Trashmasters. The game, while it has an awesome themesong you can hear in the trailer, has agonizing load times, insufferable missions, awkward controls, and forcing you to sit through all this for the sandbox option, make this worse than a disappointment.

Running With Scissors has completely disowned with "installment" and with good reason. Stay far away from this. This is not a "game," it's a shattered dream.

Edit: Oh, also, RWS didn't even make the thing. It was made by the aply named Trashmasters.

Instructions for Postal 3:
1. Launch the game.
2. Select New Game.
3. Endure the pain.
4. Open the Pause Menu.
5. Select Quit Game.
6. Uninstall Postal 3.
7. Install Postal 2.
8. Launch Postal 2.
9. Enjoy!

3.0

6. Uninstall Postal 3.
7. Install Postal 2.
8. Launch Postal 2.
9. Enjoy!

Rating:
3.0

column8: no se me inicia

Okay, after finally playing the first and second Postal games, I finally decided to give the third installment another shot. Even after learning the backstory of the game (RWS Inc. hired an underfunded and tyrannical game developer company from Russia to code the game), I decided to give it a second chance. Sure, I wouldn't get all the extra little achievements like I did with the first two Postals, but I'd at least beat the game and give it a fair judgment from that, right?

Wrong. I had completely forgotten what it was that had kept me from playing this game in the first place. It wasn't the linear levels (Postal 1 had linear levels). It wasn't the stupid jokes or the weird weapons and minigames (Postal 2 had stupid jokes and weird weapons and minigames). It was the gameplay. Yes, Akeela Software (or whatever they call themselves) had suffered through a Russian economic crash and in suffering fired their competent, cooperative developers and assigned this project to a group of Prima Donnas who not only couldn't correctly string a game together even if it was coming out of their own ass, but also deliberately altered the structure of the game against the wishes of RWS Inc. (you know, the people who wrote the game series and own the rights to them and CONTRACTED Akeela TO DO MAKE THE GAME THAT RWS had envisioned!!!). Not only that, but Akeela also refused to release the code to the general public because they didn't want those loyal gamers to make MODs or anything, even though RWS Inc. wanted them to. As a result, the gameplay is sticky, jagged, the graphics go photo-negative after 15 minutes of gameplay and glitches flood this game. For example, I had to restart a level because the game wouldn't let me open a door that was integral to the plot, and the escort mission with the segways was almost impossible. All in all, it kept me from enjoying this game not once but twice, which is a shame, because otherwise, I thought it could have been an enjoyable game. 

*SPOILER ALERT* For those still interested in knowing, the game pickups where the second one left off: after detonating Paradise, Arizona with a nuke, the Postal dude drove to the next closest fictional town in Arizona, Catharsis. There, a wealthy Ron Jeremy owns and runs everything with a pretty open mind. The problem is that he's constantly being undermined or even flat out attacked by Eco-terrorists, Al Queda, God-fearing hockey moms (led by Sarah Palin...wait...why is she in Arizona?!) and other satirical and colorful characters. The Postal Dude, just trying to make a buck, is given constant choices as to whose side he is on, or at least which side he wants to flip flop to and from. While the levels are linear, your actions do choose the course of the game.   Unlike the last game, the third Postal gives you a Max Payne type of third person layout and aiming system, and you get most of the weapons from the previous game, plus a few new ones like beehives, a shopvac (filled with questionably stained tissues) and the badgersaw. 

Like I said, it could have an enjoyable installment to the series, but the Russian contractors completely ruined it to the point that RWS Inc. even tells people to stay away from it.

column8:
It's not as bad as everyone says, it's just not worth 20 dollars. I personally enjoyed Postal 3, yes it's not POSTAL or POSTAL 2 but it's still a blast in it's own way. To actually describe the game I'll say it's your typical modern mature third person shooter (Like Gears of War and it's clones) with a extremely punishing morality system. As for steam support I've seen everywhere most of the achievements are literally impossible to get due to bugs,glitches,or horrible game making; but hey this game is notorious for a reason! 

Yeah it has a handful of performance issues (glitching,bugged npcs,freezes) from time to time but it's often so few and far between. I've been able beaten the game numerous so it is playable. Win 8.1

If you are even remotely thinking of buying this game, go buy Postal 2 first. Postal 3 is developed by Trashmasters (some would say they "trashed" the game) and published by Akella (as opposed to Running with Scissors who both published an developed the previous game). Trashmasters left out the key concepts that made Postal 2 a good game. Very much a linear game no open world. The only benefit of playing this game is that when you eventually play Postal 2 it looks like a frikin' masterpiece compared to this.

I love humor and some ideas in this game (soundtrack is quite good too) but, well, too many things are f*cked up. Stupid AI (espessially in escort missions), a lot of bugs, crashes, outdated graphics, cover system which doesn't help in any way, collision system, tiny city, police which doesn't really give a f*ck (if you kill something about 20 people a few policemen will start to chase you and if you kill them... that's all), good path (really?) which is boring as s**t, aiming... Do I really need to mention more? It's quite pity... Oh, it doesn't even work on Windows 8.1 by the way.

EDIT:
Well, I found a way to launch this s**t on Windows 8.1 but still, all other things I mentioned aren't fixed (and most probably won't be).

column8:
[strike]"I Regret Nothing"[/strike]
(NON STAVOLTA DUDE!)

PRO:

-nonostante tutto diverte
-carina l'idea della scelta: buono o cattivo
-ho apprezzato maggiormente le sparatorie
-arsenale sempre ricco con piccole chicche
-graficamente nulla da dire, si presenta bene
-ottimo il doppiaggio di Corey Cruise per Dude
-seppur inserite male le musiche sono carine e varie

CONTRO: (tralasciando la pubblicazione di tale opera...)

-senza la RWS Postal non √® Postal...
-troppi pochi contenuti in confronto al predecessore
-tecnicamente √® un disastro... (bug ovunque)
-molti achievements buggati, altri non raggiungibili
-spesso instabile ed enormi cali di FPS in varie sezioni
-mappa spoglia, quasi mai esplorabile e non degna di nota
-difficolt√† sparite, non puoi pi√π scegliere nulla...

CONCLUSIONE:

Dice tutto il fatto che la RWS l'abbia non solo rinnegato ma anche offeso pi√π e pi√π volte negli anni successivi tramite il secondo capitolo di recente aggiornato tramite l'espansione...
Postal III infatti √® come molti altri un gioco che semplicemente non doveva uscire ma che hanno rilasciato in una grave crisi che stava assillando la casa che si occupava del gioco in questione proprio in quegli anni, per questo il gioco all'inizio prometteva bene e magari, dico magari, poteva venir fuori qualcosa di paragonabile o seppur superiore al secondo capitolo; ma come vi ho gi√† detto senza entrare in dettaglio il gioco √® stato vittima di un pessimo e frettoloso sviluppo in balia di crisi finanziarie alle porte che ne hanno quindi compromesso lo sviluppo.
Nemmeno successivi e tentati restauri hanno portato a qualcosa e solo in questi ultimi anni si parla di una sorta di mod per restaurarne l'originale contenuto, ma nulla di finale od ufficiale...
Ma cosa presenta questo gioco tanto buggato e con uno sviluppo tanto problematico alle spalle?
Per prima cosa nonostante l'ironia tipica del secondo nel gioco si vede l'assenza della RWS e non si respira la stessa aria anche a causa dei forti cambiamenti come la terza persona, che nonostante non sia poi cos√¨ male, non √® andata gi√π a molte persone anche per l'impossibilit√† o difficolt√† di compiere determinate azioni pi√π comode nel secondo come quella di urinare ovunque si voglia.
La citt√† non √® pi√π esplorabile o non offre semplicemente pi√π tutti i contenuti che prima offriva come segreti, armi speciali e la libert√† di esplorare quel bizzarro mondo ricco di contenuti ora spoglio, piccolo e noioso; le molteplici difficolt√† sono sparite e talvolta il gioco risulta troppo facile e frustrante in altre...
Insomma senza entrare in altri dettagli vale l'acquisto? per me s√¨, ma solo ad alcune condizioni: il gioco offre davvero pochi contenuti e lo finirete in nulla; presenta talvolta crash improvvisi, enormi cali di frame in varie sezioni e bug ovunque tu vada (achievements compresi); insomma un gioco davvero malridotto e sconsigliato addirittura dalla RWS stessa in pi√π occasioni... ma perch√® lo consiglio? lo consiglio esclusivamente a chi si aspetti il peggio e non abbia pretese, a chi vuole conoscere questo "Postal di un'altra dimensione e degli incubi" come visto nell'espansione del secondo, agli impavidi giocatori pronti anche al peggio pur di completare la saga.
Lo consiglio in quanto nonostante i difetti oggettivi del gioco per quel poco che mi ha offerto mi sono divertito e non mi √® dispiaciuto provare questo capitolo alternativo; mi aspettavo maggiori crash sinceramente e nonostante tutto se lo trattate come tale, ossia come un gioco fallito per le proprie cause e non completo come doveva essere, potete anche affrontarlo senza troppi problemi anche solo per curiosit√† o per completare la saga pur essendo a conoscenza degli eventuali rischi che correte a qualche misero spiccio o addirittura gratis quando possibile, quindi aspettate un ulteriore calo di prezzo se possibile o prendetelo in sconto o da qualche altra parte in quanto non vale assolutamente un prezzo pieno...

VOTO PERSONALE: I am The Law! (5.7)
I'll never see that money ever again.

Dont buy this game unless it is ¬£2 / $3.50 its just not worth any more than that.
I am a fan of the Postal series so i was happy to buy it, i knew it would be bad from reviews but wanted to play the story through for storyline reasons. 
Dont buy it unless you have played Postal 2 as it could put you off the series

This on the other hand is a complete knock up of a game, its buggy and its incomplete.

Theres no way the game can be fixed because akella wont release the source code to RWS .
Why !? 
couldnt they just make more money if the game was better?
i dont know the polotics and im not bothered...them & running with scissors issues not mine 

So basically a badly broken game, bugs glitches, no crashes for me but others have said they had them. 
It does have some humour but not like postal 2 . 

But all in all a let down , and a prime example in gaming of "what could have been"

column8:
Wow. Talk about one of the worst products ever made, in just about every way possible. Unlike the previous postal, the game/level design is painfully linear with little to no room to explore. The third-person POV also feels really awkward, and using weapons and such feels really clunky. Loading times are atrociously long and the game itself is full of bugs that will probably never be fixed.

What's worse than all those things is that Postal 3 was really poorly optimized. It doesn't matter whether your gaming rig is decent or top-notch, you'll get random lagspikes and frame drops. Oh and the game crashes entirely too often, and for no apparent reason. Certainly not the game I was expecting, considering this game took several years of waiting to come out...ugh. The humor also feels really offensive, in Postal 2 the humor felt at least somewhat funny, but in Postal 3 it feels like they were being offensive for the sake of being offensive.

In short, Postal 3 felt like a huge waste of money and time I've spent playing it. RWS themselves deny having anything to do with Postal 3, and the gamers themselves refer to it as "the russian postal" instead of a sequel. After playing it, I can hardly blame them. 0.5/5.0

column8:
There is simply NOTHING good about this game. Think of everything that was fun about Postal 2 and none of that is in Postal 3. This is a really god awful 3rd person shooter with terrible gun combat mechanics, a broken melee system with horrible hit detection, and remember the open world non linear structure of Postal 2? Well now it's 100% linear. It wasn't until months after its release that they put in an open world mode which is just a save file with the whole city and no missions. That was the only midly decent thing in the whole game. Another thing that sucks is that they don't even have the Postal Dude's voice actor from the last game.

Do you want to know what the worst part of this game is? A good 80-85% of the game are escort/protection missions. Apparantly in Russia game devs think that gamers LOVE escort missions with the worst AI so they should make that the focus of the game. Because when you think Postal, you totally think of escort missions. Maybe that's what was missing from Postal 1&2. The game's long series of escort missions involve never ending spaws of enemies who all have one goal which is to kill your target and shoot at you. The guy you protect has no logic, they just stand there getting shot until they die. In missions where you need to follow someone to a goal, they often just stop or get stuck on something while the endless enemies kill them. When it comes to protecting someone in a single location, it's more of the same, they stand in once place and get shot to death.

The story is passable, but you can watch all the cut scenes on YouTube and save yourself $20. One thing that was promised was branching story paths with real drastic changes to the plot, like what jobs you have, such as being a cop or a terrorist, or even running for president. The reality is that the game has a karma meter and the more innocents that die in your crossfire, the more the meter turns evil which puts you on the evil path. One of the first "evil" missions has you on a cult where you use their version of the Gravity Gun from Half-Life to suck up apples and shoot them in barrels, 100 apples. They actually thought this would be fun. In the end, it's the same old crap, and I never did find a way to gain moral points. You just lose morality from accidently killing people with the terrible controls.

That's the whole game. There's a ton of escort missions, really bad shoot 'em up levels that have terrible level design (often getting you lost,) tons and tons of glitches, a variety of weapons, but none of them are that useful, the worst AI possible, weak voice acting, a lame story, and the creators of Postal had nothing to do with the making of this game, they infact disowned this game and pulled it from their web store. I remember a lot of critics hating Postal 2 and giving it crazy low scores without even playing it, but this game actually deserves to be bashed. There's just nothing fun about it. Not even mods could ever fix this mess of a game.

column8: In a word NO!  Don't go for it.  I loved Postal 2 with its open ended world (with progressive plot if you knew where to look) and wicked sense of humour.  I thought I was getting a good deal when I got a $10 steam key from the publisher for Postal 3, but it couldn't even live up to that.  Each mission takes place on a small map.  The movement is awkward.  It isn't even worth saying more.

Waaay too many bugs and a horrible storyline. And on top of that this game crashes very frequently, for ANY spec computer. Terrible aiming mechanics (why do you need to hold both mouse buttons to throw a grenade???) , bland to poorly designed missions, a moral system that seems unnecessary, and it randomly chugs RAM for no apparent reason (poor optimization for ANY video cards). To put it simply, avoid this game at all costs.

You will like this game, if you're a masochist!

Postal 3, now officialy renamed Russian Postal, is game publised by the bancrupt Akella Studios and produced by (defunct at the game's release) studio Trashmasters. You play as Not the Postal  dude from Postal 2 by surviving an onslaught of whacky shenaningans in the city of Catharsis.The game is a linear third person shooter that pits you against ecologists, Asians and bees. Your arsenal ranges from graffiti cans to rabid badgers and shotguns. There are also moral choices to consider that eventually determine which ending you get at the completion of the campaign.

Sorry, the previous paragraph praising Russian Postal is made of lies and I am a terrible person, but hey, have an imaginary biscuit as a reward for reading this far! Now on to the actual review:

Russian Postal is so terrible it's not even funny. The game has never been properly tested (if tested at all) upon its release which is noticable right from the moment you boot it up. If it doesn't crash, good for you, it will do so later, a bunch of times.   The main campaign is broken into missions which open as you progress through the story. They offer a variety of things from stealing sagways from gay bikers to protecting Uwe Boll from DnD nerds and trekkies, crammed with awkward stereotypes and 'hillarious' jokes. The little writing this game had really shines here when you scratch your head on reffereces that stopped being funny 10 years ago.

Gameplay wise the game is passable, but not anything stellar. Everything happends in third person and you use your mouse and keyboard to navigate, fire weapons, scroll your inventory and huff catnip. The problem is that most of the creative weapons like the badger saw, machete and the fart gun are ALL useless because physical damage is paltry and the hitboxes are broken to hell, which makes you swining at air instead of your assailants. It doesn't really help going mellee because every enemy in this game carries a machine gun and is also an ace shooter. The firearm encounters chew your ammunition in mere seconds and leave you with half-dozen unusable weapons  Therefore the game forces you to farm bullets from NPCs, which also mostly use mellee weapons...ah and the loading times between zones are atrocious. Fun!

Where little the game DOES shine are its cutscenes, which have some artistic merrit and are genuinely funny, but they are not worthy buying Russian Postal nor the pain of enduring it. My praise ends here.

In the end I can't really recommend this game to anyone, with the exception of gifting it as means to an end a frienship or a relationship. Postal fans will be dissappointed because it's a downgrade from the previous two games, achievers won't be satisfied either because some trophies are not attainable due to poor coding. If you are a masochist and enjoy playing broken games with zero satisfaction, this one is right up your alley!

Final verdict: two thumbs down and a fart /10

column8:
Postal 3 starts with Uwe Boll giving you the finger, in a loading screen.
This follows through the missions where it's apparent that the game it's just trying to mess with the player but not in the good old fashioned Postal way.
Postal 3 strives so far from both of it's predecesors that eventually it seems clear that Trashmasters (ironically) don't know even the involment that a player has when it comes to it's game, it expects you to sit throughout boring, unstilized missions, without any purpose or reason behind them.

Postal 3 it's the pinnacle of bad game design, and insultity for the pleyer and the series, i'ts the lame, pathetic excuse that comes from a group of people that believe comedy begins with a fart and ends with and insult, with people that make pathetic. lame jokes, thinking that what causes controversy and makes someone feel offended somehow it's an attractive point in entertainment. Shame.

column8:
After the whole shitshow, postal dude and his loveable dog champ finds themselves in the small town of Catharsis.
This game is really a step down from previous postal titles, its just not very good. But me being a postal fan I gave it a chance and I think despite the road they went down with Postal 3, its not to bad. The good/bad system is really interesting, and the different missions do keep it playable. There is a some-what freemode to it, and you can cause a lot of carnage. The effects are pretty awesome, and the fact you can shoot cops from a segway lol. but the lack of a few things really bums me out like  a suicide button which was the prime thing that made postal unique, that fact you could kill yourself at anytime made it really different from other games.
Postal 3 is just a far far cry from Postal and postal 2, and thats why they messed up. Again though if you are a fan like me, you may enjoy it even though its glitchy as hell. If you do play. I recommend going to the fourm and looking at the topic on how to reduce lag and frametear. Once I did those little things in my auto.cfg for the game. It started without a problem and have had no problems with lag or tear at all.

If running windows 8, DO NOT BUY. You will run into a nearly literal hurricane of bugs that will first, keep it from activating, but once you get around that, you have another ~8 minutes before you encounter a second bug that causes the game to crash every time you try to progress. This game was released when it was barely in alpha, and it looks like there has been one patch since, but other than that, it has been forgotten completely by the devs. Just buy Postal 2.

column8:
Hi

I want my money back, isent working.. Internal error (error code: 0xE2003053) windows 8.1!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Also ich habe lange √ºberlegt wie ich dieses Spiel bewerten soll, gut oder schlecht, ich habe Postal 2 und das Addon sehr viel und gerne gespielt! Ich mochte den schwarzen Humor und die v√∂llig √ºbertriebene Gewalt. Ich habe mich total auf Postal 3 gefreut und als es dann da war haben es fast alle schlecht gemacht und beleidigt, nicht ganz zu recht! Denn es ist immer noch das was man von Postal erwartet, pervers und krank aber witzig! Postal 3 kann man gar nicht auf Steam kaufen, deshalb hab ich es von nem Keyshop, wieso steht da dann der preis wenn es eh nicht zu kaufen geht!?!? Verarsche! Ok, nun zum Spiel: Die Grafik ist deutlich besser als im Vorg√§nger und passt zu Postal. Wenn man anf√§ngt einfach auf Leute zu schie√üen und sie t√∂tet, rennen alle in der N√§he panisch umher, wimmern, rufen nach den Cops, das ist schonmal geil gemacht! Man kann auch jemand den Arm, Beim die Hand oder den Fu√ü abtrennen und aufheben und damit werfen, warum erw√§hnt das niemand!?!? Sowas ist ne coole Gameplayneuerung und ich habe das seit Die by the Sword vermisst! (Kennt das √ºberhaupt wer?) Aber leider wirkt das Spiel sehr unfertig und st√ºrzt st√§ndig ab und dann geht das letzte Savegame meistens nicht mehr sodas man das davor nehmen muss...Dann die langen Ladezeiten, WIESO??? So toll ist die Grafik auch wieder nicht das diese Berechtigt sind, kacke Programmiert w√ºrd ich sagen! Aber ich empfehle es trotzdem jedem der Postal 2 mag, der wird diesen Teil auch wieder m√∂gen! Man sollte nur frustresistent sein da es teilweise derbe schwer ist! Man kann kein Schwierigkeitsgrad ausw√§hlen und dann kommen die laaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaangen Ladezeiten dazu und h√§ufigen abst√ºrze! Aber ich hatte und habe immer noch sehr viel spass mit dem Spiel! Gebt dem Spiel eine Chance, Postal-Fans und lasst euch nicht von irgendwelchen Magazinen beeinflussen, die anderen Spielen immer wieder Wertungen geben die sie nicht verdient haben!

Update: Nachdem ich den Windows 8.1 Fix (der den Kopierschutz aufhebt) installiert habe, den man ja braucht um das Game unter Windows 8.1 √ºberhaupt zocken zu k√∂nnen, hab ich bemerkt, das das Spiel nun viel stabiler l√§uft! Es ist erst 1x beim laden abgest√ºrzt,sonst nicht! Keine Abst√ºrze mehr!!! Richtig geil! Der Nachteil ist, das Spiel st√ºrzt jetzt jedes mal ab wenn ich eine Granate oder Katze werfe...Naja mir egal! Man kann die ja auch hinlegen...^^ Ich kann endlich nochmal Postal III durchzocken im guten Pfad, ENDLICH!!!

Mittlerweile ist die Steam-Version automatisch gepatcht und l√§uft problemlos unter Windows 8.1!

column8: I enjoyed the first postal and postal 2 for the B grade gore and humour. Don't come into this expecting fluid gun control and movement. There are MANY bugs. I have not encountered any that are breakable to the story but more a laughing matter. But they do not overall detract from the humorous gameplay and storyline behind the the sadley aged source engine used. However the good/bad moral alignment can be a little difficult as some missions require you to be bad to complete them. Again, not a major issue for somebody willing to take the time to look past these issues and play it in the same thought as the prequels. Even the controls feel the same. A fun romp through a wild story filled with cursing and blood spurts so over the top you would think they were made to look that way. Hell, you can craft a gun that shoots a cat off it by its butt hole!!! Running with scissors, you have done a good job in all the harsh remarks this game brought with it. Although an ingame map would have been handy...... Still much of the game to play, but first impressions are good. Graphics: 6-7. Gameplay: 7. Overall: 7

Also hier mal meine Meinung:
 
Pro:
- Akzeptable Grafik (nicht die beste, aber f√ºr 2011 in Ordnung und deutlich besser als im 2. Teil)
- Witzige Zwischensequenzen und Missionen
- Viele Neue Waffen
- Splatter/Gore-Effekte sind detailreicher als im Vorg√§nger
- Deutsche Untertitel
- Story wird durch Verhalten des Spielers beeinflusst
- Neue Spr√ºche des Protagonisten

Contra:
- H√§ufige Abst√ºrze
- Open World erst nach Beendigung des Spiels (trotzdem weniger Freiheit als in POSTAL 2, kaum Geb√§ude betretbar)
- Fehlerhaftes Ziel/Deckungssystem
- KI-Fehler
- √úbersetzungs/Textfehler (teils fehlen bei den Untertiteln ganze Worte und Silben)
- Viele Bugs (Grafikfehler, Bewegungsunf√§higkeit, Passanten bleiben an Gegenst√§nden h√§ngen und zucken)
- schlecht ausgereifte KI (Leute bewegen sich wie auf Schienen)

Fazit:

Das Spiel ist definitiv nicht so schlecht, wie es oft beschrieben wird. Es unterh√§lt mich sehr gut und wird (zumindest mir) auch nach l√§ngerer Spielzeit nicht langweilig. Allerdings nerven die zahlreichen Fehler. Es wirkt so, als ob die Entwickler eine fr√ºhe Beta-Version released haben. Der Vorg√§nger ist in jeder Hinsicht besser und auch deutlich g√ºnstiger. Leuten, die den 2. Teil mochten und nicht sehr auf KI, Technik und Grafik fixiert sind, sondern einfach nur Spa√ü am Spiel haben wollen, w√ºrde ich dieses Spiel trotz allem empfehlen!

column8: Mega!!

While Postal 2 was a satirical, tongue-in-cheek parody of American culture, video games and anything else it could get it's hands on, the third game in the series seems to have forgotten all that and just decided to be as stupid as possible. And not in a good way. 
Unpolished, buggy game with inconvenient missions that feel much more like chores than the actual chores you had to tick off your list in Postal 2. Awful voice-work, terrible script, worse gameplay. Avoid!

column8:
I am fan of the Postal games.  The adult humor will keep you laughing, so you found yourself trying to get through the game just for the humor...but as for the thrid installment its not worth it.

The awkard controls, camera angle, and the very poor poro A.I.   I can bare with the controller and the poor camera, but the A.I. is ...shit.  Your enemies will run by you just to smack themselves into the wall, stare at you and do nothing, or studdenly unload a clip in your face.  Your partner A.I is not any better.  When you are doing an escort mission, then tend to stand in one spot til you hit them upside the head with a shovel.  Even worse is when you are trying not to the shot the cops, who like to run into your line of fire and now you got the whole squad after you because the f**king idiot decided to be your meat shield.

Only get this game just to say "i have all three" like the Matrix.
